description: LONDON, Nov. 23 (AP)  The dollar declined on European currency exchanges today in trading slowed by the Thanksgiving holiday in America and Japan.

title: Enright First in Poughkeepsie
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Nov. 23 Bob Enright of Pearl River, N.Y., won the 25kilometer Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union running championship today with a time of 1 hour 24 minutes seconds. The first woman across the line was Bridget Bennett of New York City, running for the Mil!rose Athletic Club, with a time of 1 hour 50 minutes seconds. The team championship was won by the Warren Street Athletic Association.

title: Ouster Urged in a Police SickPay Case
description: A hearing officer has recommended the dismissal of the New York City police officer who is regarded by the department as its No. 1 chronic sickleave abuser.

title: Treacy Is an Easy Victor
description: MANCHESTER, Conn., Nov. 2.3 Showing so little exertion he seemed to be sleep running, a former Providence College star, John Treacy, sailed to 22minute23second victory in the 92d annual Manchester FiveMile Race.

title: Economic Scene
description: WHEN the Social Security system was established during the Great Depression of the 1930's, one of its key aims was to induce older workers to retire and leave more jobs open for younger workers with families to support. Even the oast decade of relatively high employment, pressure on the elderly to leave the labor force remained intense as those born during the postwar baby boom attained working age. But that pressure of young people on the aged to retire is already beginning to go into reverse, as a result of the decline in fertility rates and the slowing of United States population growth.

title: OPEC OIL PRICE RISE IS EXPECTED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal is understood to believe that the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries is likely to break the twoyearold price freeze on oil and announce a moderate increase next month.

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. New Orleans Jazz, at Rutgers gymnasium, Piscataway, 8 P.M. (Radio WVNJ, 8 P.M.)

title: Giorgio de Chirico, 18884 978
description: Giorgio de Chirico gave art a whole new direction. In Italy, 60 years ago, he gave to the dream that primacy which it was later to assume in painting, in poetry, in the novel, in films and of course in psychoanalysis. He took the great industrial city  that supreme constructionof the 19th century  and called its bluff.

title: Bethpage Captures Title, 147
description: Bethpage, the Division A champion, won the Nassau Conference 2 title yesterday by defeating Wantaugh, the Division B Winner, 147, at C.W. Post College.

title: Associated Press
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov: 24 (UPI) Pete Maravich scored 20 of his 31 points in a secondhalf New Orleans rally tonight to lead the Jazz to a 10698 National Basketball Association triumph over the Golden State Warriors.

title: Housing in Idaho Hurt by Bank Laws
description: BOISE, Idaho, Nov. 21  New Federal Reserve requirements for member banks and a usury law that limits interest rates on home loans have combined to cripple what was once a booming housing market in Idaho.

title: La Mama Is Staging A German Expressionist
description: Approaching Zero, an adaptation of The Gas Trilogy by the German Expressionist playwright Georg Kaiser, will begin previews tonight at 7:45 P.M. at La Mama, E.T.C., 74A East Fourth Street. The play, performed by the Direct Theater, has been adapted by Thom Thomas from Kaiser's 1917 play about a billionaire's rise to power.

title: Text of Draft Treaty Published in Cairo Newspaper
description: CAIRO, Nov. 23 (UPI) Following is an unofficial translation from the Arabic of what the Cairo newspaper Al Abram said was the draft text of a proposed peace treaty between Israel and Egypt.

title: Art: Lost Murals Of Arshile Gorky
description: MURALS URALS Without Walls at the Newark Museum has everything that we want of an exhibition on a holiday weekend. It has some very superior works of art. It has history, romance and detection. It has a human story in which everyone behaves well and collective effort wins the day.

title: Art: A Tenderness For Living Things
description: WR1TING about sculpture of the 1920's and 30's, the historian Daniel Robbins has observed that artists found in animals a vehicle to communicate individual emotion ranging from the grand to the trivial. And, besides refleeting a certain disenchantment with humanity, their choice of subject gave them more freedom to experiment stylistically at a time when direct carving and truth to materials was all the rage.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MIYAZAKI, Japan, Nov. 23 (AP) Andy Bean of the United States and Katsuji Kikuchi of Japan matched fiveunderpar 67's and tied for the firstround lead today in a $312,000 golf tournament.

title: Tanzania Says Uganda Killed Its Own Soldiers
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Nov. 23 (Reuters)  More than 120 dead Ugandans have been found in a Tanzanian forest, but they were not killed in the recent border fighting between the two countries, a Tanzanian Government statement said tonight.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TOMORROW, Nov 7S OCEANIC (Homelier, Nassau Nov 7:i, due 8 A M W. 5th Street

title: The Region
description: LINCROFT, N.J. (AP) The memorios of elderly Montmouth County residents are being recorded for posterity at Brookdale Community College here by Norma Klein, associate dean of community education. The tapes will also be used for high school social studies classes.

title: 'sarava, a Musical, Goes Into Rehearsal
description: Rehearsals have begun for Sarava, a musical adapted from Jorge Amado's novel, Dona Flor and Her Two Husbands. The story was also made into a Brazilian film that was wellreceived in New York.

title: Pornographer Taken to Georgia For Trial in Killing of Two Rivals
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 23 (UPI)  Mike Thevis, a convicted pornographer who was apprehended Nov. 9 after eluding the Federal authorities for six and a half months since his escape from an Indiana jail, has been returned to Georgia for trial on charges of killing two business rivals.

title: Betty Carter Sings Jazz on Broadway
description: Betty Carter has been singing for 30 years but she has only recently begun to be acknowledged as one of the grea improvisatory jazz singers. One further step in that acknowledgement will occur on Sunday evening when Joseph Papp will present her in concert at thi Shubert Theater at 9 P.M., an outgrowth of her earlier appearance in the jazz series that Mr. Papp inaugurated last spring downtown at the Public Theater.

title: Boys Town Programs Plagued by Problems, Series in Paper Asserts
description: OMAHA, Nov. 23 (AP)  A weekly newspaper that won a Pulitzer Prize for its disclosures about Boys Town in 1972 reported yesterday that the institution's administrators had knowingly misled the public about how donors money was spent and that its three major programs were in trouble because of poor planning and unrealistic coals.

title: Newspaper Sold
description: MORGANTON, N.C., Nov. 23 (M)). The Morganton NewsHerald has been purchased by Roy H. Park, owner of newspapers and broadcasting stations in 15 states. The sale includes The NewsHerald's sister weekly newspaper, The Valdese News. The NewsHerald has a circulation of 11,700. Mr. Park, of Ithaca, N.Y., owns 11 dailies, five Sunday publications, 18 weeklies and 21 broadcasting stations.

title: For Children
description: SANTA AND A PUPPET SHOW, featuring enter tainment by Elizabeth Abbot and her Punch and Judy show, and Phil Ivory, The Magic Man, on Saturday at 9:30 A.M., at Lord & Taylor, Fifth Avenue and 39th Street (11th floor.) Admission per Satur childdays, $2 (includes breakfast.) Repeat showson saturday through Dec. 23d.

title: Diggs Gives Up One Post Because of Jail Sentence
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)  Representative Charles C. Diggs Jr., who is appealing a threeyear prison sentence on his conviction for allegedly taking payroll kickbacks, has surrendered a committee chairmanship to avoid controversy, but he will try to retain control of a key foreign policy subcommittee.

title: Her Political Savvy Added to Carter Team
description: Ten years ago she was a housewife in Westport, Conn., a mother of two, the wife of an ophthalmologist and an active volunteer with an interest in politics. She hadn't held Paving job since 1951.

title: Concern Over Health Costs Deters Use of Body Scanner
description: Efforts to hold down rising costs of health care in the United States have begun to slow utilization of the costly and controversial C.T. scanner, a diagnostic instrument that researchers say is just beginning to demonstrate significant contributions to patient care.

title: Canadiens 8, Penguins 4
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 23 (AP) Jacques Lemaire scored two goals and assisted on two others in a sixgoal Montreal first period and the Canadiens went on to rout the Pittsburgh Penguins 84 tonight.

title: The Charlotte St. Risk
description: It is 18 bleak acres of bulldozerflattened rubble, punctuated  and almost surrounded  by burnedout or halfdeserted buildings. Their gaping windows look down on a scene as desolate as if it were set in a dead crater of the moon instead of amidst the living volcano of the South Bronx.

title: EWALD KERSTEN
description: Ewald Kersten, founder and president of the Kersten Shipping Agency, a New York ship brokerage and management concern, died yesterday of cancer at Mount Sinai Hospital at the age of 67.

title: Iran Found Improving Prisoners' Treatment, But Still Jailing Many
description: PARIS, Nov. 23  Two humanrights investigators said here today that Iran had recently improved its judicial procedures and treatment of political prisoners but had not carried out any fundamental changes.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Ukrainians, Greeks, Japanese, Austrians, Arabs and Turks are just some of the groups participating in the Folk Dance House's 38th annual jamboree. There are so many folk dancers that we can't fit them all in In one night, says Mary Ann Herman, codirector of Folk Dance House, so the jamboree will start tonight and continue all day tomorrow. The public is invited to the P.M. dances tonight ($3 admission) and tomorrow ($4 admission). And tomorrow afternoon at 1, there will be workshop in Israeli dances ($5 admission). All at St. Vartan Cathedral, Second Avenue and 35th Street. Information: 5390675.

title: Westfield 62 Victor
description: Westfield, the perrenial football powerhouse, which failed to qualify for the state playoffs, defeated a playoff finalist, Plainfield. 62. before 11.855 yesterday.

title: TV WEEKEND
description: SING SING Thanksgiving being shown a day late on Channel 13 (Channel 21 carried it yesterday at P.M.), but the independent production is probably accustomed to neglect.

title: A Buoyant Feeling for Thousands at Macy's Parade
description: Would Bullwinkle the Moose successfully squeeze his heliumfilled girth between the tall buildings along Broadway? Would Underdog keep from scraping his inflated nose on the pavement?

title: Andrew Stein, Investment Analyst
description: Manhattan Borough President Andrew Stein has called on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to change the way it invests its money. He suggests that instead of pursuing the highest safe yield, the Authority put the money to work to stimulate New York City's economy.

title: Guyanese Comb Jungle Fruitlessly For Survivors of Sect's Suicide Rite
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 23Guyanese Government patrols spent the day in a vain search for California cultists who might have survived the mass suicide and killings at their jungle commune by fleeing into the bush. The lack of success of their search increased their doubts that hundreds had survived.

title: Bank Merger Off
description: The Garden State National Bank, Paramus, N. J. and the National State Bank, Elizabeth, N. J. have announced termination of their plan to merge following a joint decision that the banks could not meet some requirements established by the state's Comptroller of the Currency for the merger.

title: Mayor's Holiday Somewhat Thankless
description: Mayor Koch spent part of his Thanksgiving holiday yesterday fielding complaints from New Yorkers who were less than thankful for some aspects of local life.

title: Coast Cultists Are Still in Shock
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 23  Five days after the mass suicide and killings in Jonestown, Guyana, 22 members of the People's Temple are still in a state of shock at their headquarters here.

title: Centereach 5 Seeks FastBreaking Help
description: The pressure is on for Carol Walderman of Centereach. The last three years, the Centereach girls basketball team has won the Suffolk County championship, posting a 603 wonlost record. But after last season, three of its starters were graduated. Now it is up to Miss Walderman, a 5foot 10inch forward, to lead an inexperienced squad on a successful fastbreak offense.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23 (AP)  Leaders of the sevennation Warsaw Pact called today for early completion of a new arms limitation treaty between the United States and Soviet Union and an end to all the vestiges of the cold war, the Soviet news agency Tass reported.

title: Yiddish Songs Share Day With Black History
description: Sunday events at the Y.M.Y.W.H.A. of Metropolitan New Jersey, 760 Northfield Avenue in South Orange, will include an afternoon of Yiddish music, drama and humor and an evening with the actors Ruby Dee and Ossie Davis.

title: Justice Dept. Ruled Out Inquiries Into Charges of Abuses in Cults
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  The Justice Department has rebuffed several requests by members of Congress to investigate allegations of brainwashing and physical abuse in religious cults on the ground that such investigations would violate constitutional guarantees of freedom of religion, interviews and Government correspondence have disclosed.

title: Murray Perahia Is Ripening His Piano Artistry
description: The familiar old Latin saw has it that art is long and time is fleeting. Art is long, Murray Perahia might agree, so it deserves all the time you can give it. The pianist's highly successful career has been distinguished by the frequent periods of retirement from concert tours that he takes in order to consolidate and advance his artistic maturity.

title: Vote at State U. Shortly to Test 2 Rival Unions
description: An election to determine who will represent faculty members and nonteaching professionals on 32 campuses of the State University of New York has pitted the two major unions in the educational field against each other in a crucial contest.

title: Goodrich Sells Some Holdings
description: AKRON, Ohio, Nov. 23 (UPI)  The B.F. Goodrich Company announced today the sale of 18.7 percent of its holdings in the Yokohama Rubber Company to Japanese investors.

title: New Face: Gregory and Maurice Hines
description: GREGORY AND MAURICE Hines have two of the hottest pairs of dancing feet this theater season. Appearing in Eubie, they have been singled out for rousing ovations by enthusiastic audiences as they tap, sing and clown their way through their first big Broadway show. For them, the applause is only part of the iov.

title: What's in Store When Abrams Takes State Job
description: Call up the Attorney General's office in New York State, ask an assistant about case that will be tried in 1979, and there a nervous laugh: I may not be around then.

title: Poll Finds New Legislators Moderate
description: With tax cuts as their goal and pragmatism as their political banner, the new members of the New York State Legislature  like their counterparts in the new Congress in Washington  are a moderate group who will spend most of their time worrying about the local problems of the communities they represent, according to interviews with newly elected legislators conducted by The New York Times.

title: British Miners Seek Pay Raise
description: LONDON, Nov. 23, (AP)  Union leaders of Britain's 260,000 coal miners demanded a 40 percent pay raise in meeting today with members of the National Coal Board.

title: Brezhnev Warns Against a British Jet Sale to China
description: LONDON, Nov. 23 (Reuters)  Leonid I. Brezhnev has warned Britain that there could be serious consequences if it decides to sell China the verticaltakeoff Harrier military iet.

title: Auctions
description: SINCE a week ago Tuesday, sales of Russian icons, silver, Faberge and enamels have kept some collectors and dealers on the go between the sales conducted by Christie, Manson & Woods in Geneva, and Sotheby Parke Bernet in Zurich.

title: Echoes of the 19 71 Attica Uprising Haunt Courtroom in Damages Suit
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 20  In a nearly empty courtroom here, the 1971 Attica prison revolt is being slowly and painfully relived.

title: Publishing: A Wall That Unites
description: NINETY INETY percent of our business comes off The Wall, Burt Britton was saying the other day in his new handsome and inviting emporium, Books & Co., on Madison Avenue near 74th Street.

title: Rutgers Bowl Selection Is Vindication for Burns
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Nov. 23 When Rutgers compiled an 110 wonlost record in the 1976 football season, Coach Frank Burns and his squad waited for the postseason bowl offers to arrive. They still were waiting when all the assignments were made.

title: Program Aides Foresee Harm In Budget Cuts
description: The drama of national government in this country comes at tense Congressional hearings or in startling Presidential announcements. But the budgetmaking process  that exercise by which an administration defines itself by clarifyUrban Affairs ing and making explicit its priorities, perhaps the most important governmental step of all  happens almost silently, out of public view.

title: Curbing U.S. Budget Called a LongTerm Job
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  In striving to shrink the Federal budget deficit below $30 billion, President Carter is trying to repeal  or at least make dent in  the unwritten iron law of Federal budgeting.

title: Jazz: Flanagan at Piano
description: AFTER 10 years on the road as Ella Fitzgerald's accompanist, a virtually anonymous existence, Tommy Flanagan has, in John Le Carre's phrase, come in from the cold. He has left Miss Fitzgerald and, as a step toward concentrating on his own career, he is playing solo piano this week and next in the Bemelmans Bar at the Carlyle Hotel, 76th Street at Madison Avenue.

title: Study Shows Shifting Tides of New York's Poverty
description: The shifting boundaries of New York City's poor neighborhoods have been mapped as the underpinning for the Koch administration's efforts to change the structure of thd multimilliondollar antipoverty programs.

title: The Wrong Man for Disarmament
description: President Carter's choice of a retired lieutenant general to head the nation's disarmament agency was the kind of disingenuous political maneuver that could only boomerang. And it did.

title: 1,527 Files Are Reported Missing In Case Against ExF.B.I. Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Defense lawyers for two former highranking agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation accused of overseeing illegal breakins, wiretaps and mail openings against the Weather Underground asserted yesterday that the Justice Department had lost or destroyed 1,527 files relevant to its case.

title: McEnroe, Fleming Gain Net Semifinals in Italy
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, Nov. 23 (AP) John McEnroe and Peter Fleming of the United States, Zeljko Franulovic of Yugoslavia and Adriano Panatta of Italy gained the semifinals today in $50,000 indoor tennis tournament.

title: Rhodesia Finds Tribal Loyalties On the Increase
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia  Rhodesian nationalist politics, both inside this country and in guerrilla movements based in neighboring countries, are becoming overtly tribal, moving toward what many analysts believe to be an unavoidable civil war between blacks.

title: Texas Couple Found Slain
description: EL PASO, Nov. 23 (AP) A young couple were found dead last night, stuffed in the trunk of their car, police said today. Felipe Navarrete, 17 years old, was shot in the head, and his wife, Lourdes, 16, was stabbed to death, officials said. Two teenaged youths, acquaintances of the slain couple, were arrested yesterday and charged with murder.

title: Marketplace Sizing Up CashRich Ford
description: QUESTION: If a gigantic company shows almost as much cash in the bank as the combined worth of its common shares, are the shares a bargain?

title: CAIRO PAPER PRINTS TEXT IT CALLS DRAFT OF MIDEAST TREATY
description: CAIRO, Friday, Nov. 24  As recriminations continued over who was to blame for the deadlock in the current peace talks, the authoritative Cairo newspaper Al Ahram published today what it said was the text of a draft version of the peace treaty negotiated with Israel earlier this month.

title: Teamsters Accept Grocery Pact
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 23 (UPI) The 19week northern California grocery strike has ended with the teamsters union accepting a settlement approved by negotiators last week. A spokesman at Local 315 said yesterday that the 3,500 warehouse workers and drivers would be back at work on Monday if the union's international leadership accepted the vote in lieu of a mailed ballot to individual members.

title: Associated Press
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov: 24 (UPI) Pete Maravich scored 20 of his 31 points in a secondhalf New Orleans rally tonight to lead the Jazz to a 10698 National Basketball Association triumph over the Golden State Warriors.

title: To the Losers Go the Spoils
description: WESTBURY, N.Y., November 23 Two horseplayers were rewarded with a Thanksgiving Day gift of $1,020 tonight when Pay the Price finished third in the third race at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Algerian Affairs in Limbo as President Lies Gravely Ill
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 23  With President Houari Boumediene gravely ill and attended by a Medical team from six nations, Algeria has entered what could be long period of political uncertainty.

title: P.L.O. Objects to a Film by U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Nov. 23  A controversial film on the rights of Palestinians is unacceptable to the Palestine Liberation Organization and its supporters, even though United Nations officials agreed to include more scenes of Yasir Arafat. the P.L.O. leader.

title: Lions Beat Broncos on King Run, 1714
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Nov. 23 (AP) Horace King ran 1 yard for a fourthquarter touchdown that capped a 77yard drive today and gave the Detroit Lions a 1719 victory over the Denver Broncos in a National Football League game.

title: Restaurants
description: IF ratings were given out for concepts, the trim, goodlooking modern grill, Les Tournebroches, in the Citicorp Center. would certainly be worth at least three stars. Developed by Charles Chevillot, who also owns La Petite Ferme, the grill idea is beautifully suited to its surroundings on the crowded, fastpaced thoroughfare that is the atrium of that building. In addition, the limited menu of broiled fish, poultry and meat and a few stylish accompaniments should be Mile to be turned out by the chef with dispatch and a high level of excellence.

title: Colombia Seeks Loan
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 23 The Government of Colombia is trying to borrow MO million in a syndicated loan from international banks, a foreign banker said here today. He said that the Government wanted the loan for 10 years at threequarters of 1 percentage point over London interbank offer rates. At least part of the loan would be used to refinance existing debt.

title: O.S.U. President Accused Of Slush Fund Knowledge
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 23 (AP) Jim Stdnley, the ousted Oklahoma State University football coach, contended for the first time yesterday that he and the university's new president were aware of the existence of a football slush fund now being investigated by officials of the Big Eight Conference and the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

title: Doctors Form Own MalpracticeInsurance Units
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 23 When the malpracticeinsurance crunch hit CaliSpecial to The New York Times fornia two years ago, rates soared sky high  even higher than in New York, where premiums for malpractice insurance tripled.

title: TEXAS MURDER TRIAL HEARS MAIN WITNESS
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 23  When the state's star witness in the trial of T. Cullen Davis left the stand this week, the defense had managed to depict him as a man with poor memory and had called attention to discrepancies in his testimony. But it had yet to challenge directly the witness's assertion that Mr. Davis had hired him to have a judge murdered.

title: The New York Times /Joyce Dopkeen
description: Moods of a Salvation Army Dinner

title: Lakewood Trounced
description: Toms River South scored 20 pcints in the first half on its way to a 358 victory over Lakewood yesterday. Jim Ault and Rich Gaffney ignited the rout on touchdown on runs of 54 and 23 yard:: respectively.

title: Safety of Nuclear Waste Disposal Is Heatedly Argued in New Mexico
description: LOS ALAMOS, N.M., Nov. 23  An exiled Russian scientist engaged in heated debate here yesterday with Dr. Edward M. Teller, who has often been called the father of the hyrdrogen bomb, on the issue of nuclear waste disposal.

title: Bruins Defeat Sabres
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23 (AP) The Boston Bruins spoiled a stellar performanc tonight by the Buffalo goaltender, Don Edwards, with a 52 victory over the Sabres in a battle of National Hockey League Adams Division rivals.

title: Radio
description: 7.8 A.M., WNCN. Banchetto Musi. cale, Suite No. 1 in G, Schein; Hun. garian Rhapsody No. 15, Liszt; Sonata, Caldara; Rondo, Dvorak: Sarabande and Gavotta, Popper; Adagio ma non troppe for Mandolin and Harpsichord, Beethoven.7:309, WNYCFM. Three Kings, Smith; Piano Pieces, Grainger; Concertino for Trombone and Strings, Milhaud; Transcriptions for Strings, GluckStokowski; Suite for Harpsichord No. 2. Handel.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Latin Exiles, Heartened by the Easing of Political Repression, Begin to Return Home
description: RIODE JANEIRO, Nov. 20 In January 1969, Cpl. Jose Ferreira abandoned his infantry brigade to join the clandestine Popular ReVolutionary Vanguard, a group dedicated to the overthrow pf Brazil's military Government.

title: BUSINESS. Digest
description: The price freeze on oil is likely to be broken with a moderate crease ranging from 5 to 7 percent next month when OPEC meets Abu Dhabi, say American officials who accompanied W. Michael Blumenthal, the Treasury Secretary, on a trip through the Middle East this week. Economists say an increase of this magnitude would not seriously impede world economic growth. [Page A1.]

title: Army Mules Dies at 46
description: FT. CARSON, Colo., Nov. 23 (AP)Wind River, one of the last two known Army mules, has died at the age of 46, officials at Fort Carson Army Base announced. Wind River, purchased by the Army in the 1930's, saw combat action during World War It.

title: S.B.A. to Aid Firms in Tris Ban
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)  The Small Business Administration said today it will use existing loan programs to help small businesses that have suffered losses because of the Government's ban on Tris. The flame retardant chemical, once used in children's sleepwear, suspected of being a cancercausing agent.

title: Advertising
description: NOW Kelly, NasonUnivas, an agency that had domestic billings of about $70 million last year, has opened a branch office in Morristown, N.J. It is headed by Finlay W. Morrow, a senior vice president. He was president of Riedl Associates, the Clifton, N.J., agency that went out of business last Aug.,31.

title: Doctors Polled on Organ Sales
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23 (AP)  About 20 percent of the doctors polled by the American Medical Association say they would not object to the sale of human organs for transplants, but threefourths of the doctors were flatly against it. Of the 244 doctors questioned, 75.4 percent said the sale of transplantable organs should not be legalized, 19.3 percent said they would favor commercial sale of organs. and 5.3 percent had no opinion.

title: Quarterbacks Should Be Selfish
description: Benny Friedman was watching on television when Richard Todd, in his first game with the New York Jets after repairs to a broken collarbone, ran a quarterback draw play, gained 7 yards and was squashed. Friedman winced when brace of Philadelphia Eagles landed on Todd. Later, when learned that the recycled collarbone had been cracked again, he shook his head. It hurts me, he said. It happens somewhere every Sunday and it isn't necessary at all.

title: N. Mexico St. 33, W. Tex. St. 31
description: CANYON, Tex., Nov. 23 (AP)  Ray Locklin ran 78 yards for a touchdown in the final quarter last night, and led New Mexico State to a 3331 victory over West Texas State and the Missouri Valley Conference football crown.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Edward Ball, the nonagenarian billionaire, has been quiet recently. But not, it would appear, inactive.

title: A THE WITH IRAQIS LIFTS SYRIAN SPIRITS
description: DAMASCUS, Syria  A murmur of excitement runs from the collonaded prayer room of the Ommayad Mosque, along the bustling streets of Hamidiye Souk, strung with brightly colored paper garlands, and into the lobbies of the best hotels: the Iraais are here.

title: Assault Case Reopened
description: Three Bronx men were arrested yesterday and accused of attempting to rob 15yearold youth who had been accused of shooting one of them. The Bronx District Attorney, Mario Merola, said the arrests were the result of excellent police work.

title: Slit Skirts: A Question Of Taste
description: Legs are, apparently, the newest show in town. In the throes of the current retro mood in fashion, some designers are reliving the time when the sight of a pretty ankle drove strong men wild.

title: Art People
description: THOSE rejoicing noises on West 53d Street mean that the Museum of Modern Art has its Klimt back, after a short spell in the hands of  a dealer! The Park, an early landscape by the Austrian painter Gustav Klimt (18621918), has had an appreciative band of followers since its aquisition in 1957, and there were loud laments among them when it almost got away.

title: Striking SteelHauling Truckers Tell of Grievances
description: PITTSBURGH. Nov. 22  I cheated and I robbed, said the truck driver in the green zippered jacket. I cheated on the turnpike. I cheated on the licenses. cheated on the log. I cheated on the weight. That's a hell of a way to make living.

title: Canadians Put Off on Auto Pact
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 23  The United States has told Canada it is not interested at present in revising the widely criticized free trade agreement between the two countries on automobiles and parts.

title: Ballet: Baryshnikov's Harlequinade
description: EVERY so often, one does walk out singing in the street after a ballet performance, and Wednesday night with the New York City Ballet at the the New York State Theater was one of those nights.

title: Black Leaders Ask to See Carter On Budget Cuts in Social Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  Fifteen prominent black leaders called for President Carter today to meet with them to discuss their deep concern with reports that Federal support for programs aiding minority groups is to be severely cut back in the 1980 budget now being drafted.

title: Business and the Law
description: IT has always been clear that the large law firms on Wall Street and Park Avenue have marched to the corporate drum, but in days past the titans who ran these firms attracted and held important clients. Now, with a few exceptions (such as John J. McCloy of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley & McCloy and Whitney North Seymour Sr. of Simpson, Thacher & Bartlett), most of the legal giants who stalked the land have retired or died.

title: Pop: Helen Schneider
description: IF Bob Dylan is going to persist in changing his old freeflowing songs into stagey set pieces, he could do worse than to listen to Helen Schneider. At the Bottom Line Wednesday night, Miss Schneider sang Just Like a Woman in a dramatic, carefully plotted manner and made her song; rarely has a piece of Mr. Dylan's been appropriated so effectively.

title: China Buys More Wheat from U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP) China has bought an additional 145,000 metric tons of wheat from the United States, the Agriculture Department has announced.

title: LongDistance Auto Commuting Is a Way of Life for Many in U.S.
description: Every weekday at 4:45 A.M., in the green rolling hill country of southern Louisiana, James M. Pierce gets out of bed, dresses and climbs into his Chevy pickup for an 80mile ride to New Orleans, where he is a civil engineer for the Exxon Company.

title: New Soviet. Thinking
description: PRINCETON, N.J.The most important development in Soviet ideology since 1917 has taken place almost unnoticed by American commentators, concerned as they have been with controversies over dtente, arms controls and human rights.

title: Liberal Leaders Acting to Revive Party's Strength
description: The Liberal Party  facing the ignominy of a possible defeat by the amateurs of the RighttoLife Party at the official New York State vote count in midDecember  has begun a series of private talks about how to revive the considerable power it once wielded.

title: Suburban Cabs Seek Road to Survival
description: I remember once, when Macy's had their Thanksgiving Day Parade up here, this woman waited inside one of my cabs for two hours. Watched the entire parade from inside the cab. She refused to get out, until we took her to her destination.It was only five or six blocks away, but she didn't want to walk. Know how much she paid after delaying my cab for two hours? $1.30  no, $1.10, because she was a senior citizen.

title: U.S. Banks Stepping Up Retail Activities Abroad
description: LONDON, Nov. 23  Several of America's biggest banks are moving quietly to exploit an overseas market most have long ignored  the banking business of ordinary European consumers.

title: Suit Alleges Coastal Gas Made Illegal Payments
description: A stockholder of the Coastal States Gas Corporation has accused its directors of having made illegal, irregular and improper payments totaling more than $10 million to a Venezuelan oil stunner between 1973 and 1975.

title: A Star in Tartuffe Finds Trouble in TV
description: For bwoosie Kurtz, last season had been the best of her professional life. Good parts in three New York plays A History of the American Film, Tartuffe and Uncommon Women  and laurels to follow: an Obie award and a Drama Desk nomination for Rita in Uncommon Women, a Drama Desk award for History and a Tony nomination for her Mariane in Tartuffe. Then along came these people from Hollywood offering her a part in a television series with Mary Tyler Moore.

title: Bulletin Cancels Holiday Edition
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 23 (AP) The Philadelphia Bulletin canceled its Thanksgiving edition early today because of a strike by printing pressmen over the issue of holiday pay. The holiday edition is The Bulletin's largest paper of thh year, and some 650,000 copies were scheduled to be printed. The newspaper's normal weekday circulation is about 536,000.

title: Books: Let The Pastor Solve It
description: DELETE the homicides and the search for the killer from Charles Merrill Smith's latest book and there will still remain a suavely written and amusing light novel, though the issues dealt with are weighty enough. In this, the third of the series invoving Con Randollph, the professional football player turned minister, we get a tantalizing glimpse of the working of the church from the inside, where the world of the here competes mightily with the world of the hereafter.

title: Hawthorne, Shut by Fire, Cancels Racing for Season
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23 (AP)  Hawthorne Race Track, which was almost completely destroyed by fire early last Sunday, yesterday canceled the remaining 28 days of the its thoroughbred meeting scheduled through Dec. 21.

title: Madrid, Awaiting Vote, Forbids Demonstrations
description: MADRID, Nov. 23 (AP)The Government today banned all public demonstrations in Spain until after a national referendum scheduled for Dec. 6 on a new constitution.

title: White Plains Prevails
description: Mark Martino threw for two touchdowns and ran for a third as White Plains defeated its crosstown rival, Stepinac, 2815, yesterday.

title: New York Court Bars Halt in Use Of a Power Line
description: AIANY, Nov. 22 The State Power Authority won a preliminary round yesterday in a continuing court battle with the State Public Service Commission in dispute involving the testing and use of controversial 765,000volt electric transmission line in northern New York State.

title: Sports Dinners: Speakers Main Dish
description: It begins, fittingly, during Thanksgiving week and it reaches its end in March. They call it the rubberchicken circuit  the welter of banquets and personalappearance events that have become a part of the sports landscape.ably more nervous than when I was playing football. I knew what I was doing when I was playing football.

title: Broadway
description: THE Goodspeed Opera House is forever dusting off antiques, but Whoopee, before Goodspeed revived it last spring, was supposed to be more than just old; it was supposed to be kitsch. Then it sold out for 10 weeks at Goodspeed (actually, this didn't mean much; everything sells out at Goodspeed), but it received extravagantly good reviews, too. Now Whoopee coming to Broadway, where it will open at the ANTA Theater on Feb. 8. The second act has been revised; there have been cuts, but it will still be Whoopee. Is Broadway ready for a musical that was first done in 1928?

title: Saving CETA for the Poor
description: The timing could not have been worse when the $12billion Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA) came up before Congress for renewal in August. Revelations of fraud and abuse, abounded and budgetcutting fever was in the air. But thanks to artful lobbying by CETA's legislative and executive branch backers, Congress finally voted to extend the program with only modest cuts. And it wisely restored CETA its original, and most defensible, mission making the hardcore unemployed employable. These changes may temporarily unbalance the budgets of some hardpressed cities, but.they are welcome news for poor people desperately in need of jobs.

title: Dance Gets Into Stride Uptown and Down
description: PUT down that turkey wing. Unplug the television set. Give away those theater tickets to a deserving relative. This is the weekend to catch up on dance. Everybody's dancing everything, it seems, from the vast reaches of Lincoln Center to a tiny loft on Warren Street. They're even dancing up the walls of the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the International Center for Photography.

title: Constance Welch Fund Being Established at Yale
description: Friends and former students of the late Constance Welch, for 38 years professor at the Yale Drama School, have begun a drive to raise $35,000 for scholarship fund in her memory. Interest from the endowment will provide an annual tuition award for an acting student at the school.

title: Penn StatePitt Clash A Reversal of Status
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Nov. 23 Penn State  undefeated, untied, ranked No. I, and heading for the Sugar Bowl  will meet Pittsburgh tomorrow at Beaver Stadium in a nearduplicate of the situation that prevailed when these arch rivals met in their annual season finale two years ago in Pittsburgh. There is one minor difference the role of each team is reversed.

title: In Valley, Ifs Passaic
description: Tony D'Arxilito gained 148 yards and scored twice yesterday to lead unbeaten Passaic Valley (100) past Wayne Valley, 209. D'Apolito scored on plunges of 1 and 3 yards.

title: Books of The Times
description: ELLEN SCHWAMM'S remarkable first novel. Adjacent Lives, begins, dramatically and familiarly enough, with a fervent love affair fallen into almost inadvertently by an art critic and one of his lecture students. Both of them are comfortably married to people they like; neither of them is consciously looking for passionate release. Love happens to them, and heatedly, but not without a sense of irony: She reaches up for his neck. His body is silken, long, lean and silken. He has long silken flanks. She wonders what flanks are. She is not certain, but he has them, of that she is certain. She wonders what his body looks like. Her eyes are closed. She wonders if his are. She looks. They are. She closes hers again.

title: Auto Output Down in Week
description: DETROIT, Nov. 23 (AP)  The Thanksgiving holiday and a weeklong shutdown at an American Motors Corporation plant dropped this week's United States automobile production 47 percent below last week's, according to Automotive News.

title: Gems Stolen From Alexander's in Thanksgiving Robbery on L.I.
description: An undetermined amount of gems and precious metals was stolen from Alexander's department store in Valley Stream, L.I., sometime early Thanksgiving Day, according to the Nassau County police.

title: Stage: Doctomw's Drinks Before Dinner
description: IT is tempting to apply the old British Club epithet brilliant but unsound to E.L. Doctorow's play Drinks Before Dinner, but it is net (mite accurate.

title: Pilot and Family Die in Air Crash After Refusing Plea to Turn Back
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 23 (UPI)  A pilot with nearly a dozen years of experience rejected the pleas of an airport operator to turn back in bad weather, then died along with his family in a crash of his small plane on their way to a Thanksgiving celebration.

title: World Gold
description: Selected orld Gold Price (or Thur Nov. 23.)

title: 121 Bodies of Cultists Arrive at Dover Base; Leader's Is Identified
description: DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del., Nov. 2.3 (UPI)  An aluminum coffin labeled Rev. Jimmy Jones, 13B and 80 other coffins with the bodies of the cult leader's followers who committed suicide in Guyana were silently unloaded from an Air Force cargo plane here tonight.

title: Barazzutti, Solomon Gain
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 23 (AP) Corrado Barazzutti, Harold Solomon, Jose Higueras and Jose Luis Clerc advanced easily today to the quarterfinals of the Argentine open Grand Prix tennis tournament.

title: POSTER ASSAILS MAO OVER WIFE'S ACTIONS
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 23  A new wall poster appearing in Peking today suggested that Mao Tsetung must have been involved in the activities of two of China's most reviled figures, his radical wife, Chiang Ching, and the former Defense Minister. Lin Piao.

title: Auto Loans Of 5 Years Emerging
description: With inflation continuing to push up the cost of new automobiles, an increasing number of major commercial banks around the nation are offering fiveyear car loan. This movement comes just as the fouryear car loan, introduced by banks a few years ago, is taking hold.

title: United Press International
description: RESCUE IN MALAYSIA: In Kuala Trengganu, a villager pulled a Vietnamese refugee from the Trengganu River after a boat carrying refugees capsized on Wednesday. Sixtyone persons survived; about 200 drowned.

title: At the Movies
description: WHITEHAIRED, ruddy, wearing a sober gray suit, white shirt and maroon necktie, Stanley Kramer looked for all the world like a prosperous farmer down for a day on the horse cars as he lunched at the Regency Hotel the other day. In fact, the onetime boy wonder of Hollywood is looking at the world from a different perspective these days. In February, having sold his house in Beverly Hills, Mr. Kramer drove to Seattle with his wife and their two daughters, II and 8.

title: Coalition Calls 12 Water Projects A $13.5 Billion Flock of Turkeys
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI) conservationist coalition said today that 12 of the most bloated Federal water projects in the country represented A $13.5 billion flock of turkeys that ultimately would cost taxpayers more than $28 billion.

title: Boehm Leads Pack To Win a Cold Race
description: Some of the rigors of winter road racing were on frosty display in Brooklyn's Prospect Park yesterday as more than 400 enthusiasts, ranging in ages from 6 to the 60's, engaged in the New York Road Runners 3.5mile event.

title: Oregon  A Jazz Band That Defies Categories
description: The joke this week is the one about how you get to Carnegie Hall, Glen Moore, who plays bass with the group Oregon, cracked the other day. The other members of the band groaned. Practice. Moore flashed a wicked smile, but then he turned serious for a moment. Actually, he said, We've been practicing for a long time.

title: Lafayette Scores 280 Triumph
description: Andy Lazarus ran for three towndowns to lead Lafayette to a 280 victory over New Utrecht yesterday in the battle of Bensonhurst known as the Lasaena Bowl.

title: Ballet: New in Copplia
description: YES, it's possible to have too much of a good thing. Take Coppelia, for instance. The greatest comic ballet of the 19th century, Coppelia certainly deserves to be danced. Yet should a company dance nothing but Coppelia?

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: Public service commissions, which are charged with the responsibility of protecting the public in its dealing, with large corporations, frequently shirk that responsibililty and end up serving the very organizations that they purport to be policing.

title: Bettors at Big A Give Thanks for Usual Trimmings
description: What kind of person goes out to race track on Thanksgiving Day?

title: Deaths
description: ARANOWDorothy. Beloved wife of George. Devoted mother of Harold and the late Ruth Lubin. Loving grandmother. Services Sunday, 10:30 AM at Gutterrnan's 14ay.au Memorial Chapel Long Beach Rd al e/stone, Rockville Centre, U.

title: Neighbors in California Say Cult Members Were Helpful
description: UKIAH, Calif., Nov. 22  According to many townspeople here, the People's Temple was that strange little religious group that settled north of town in Redwood Valley in the late 1960's and seemed intent on becoming a good neighbor.

title: Butler and Madison Borough Set Stage
description: Butler and Madison Borough, a pair of unbeaten teams that will play for the North Jersey, Section 2 Group 2 championship on Dec. 2, posted identical 270 victories yesterday. Both have 100 wonlost records. Butler victimized Pompton Lakes and Madison, winner of 22 straight, halted Millburn.

title: A Pageant of Shakespeare's Kings
description: A feast of another kind is being offered this holiday weekend by the CSC Repertory: a marathon of Shakespeare's kings. Tomorrow, at the Abbey Theater on East 13th Street, the Off Broadway company will present its Hollow Crown Trilogy  consecutive performances of Richard II, Henry IV, Part One and Henry IV, Part Two.

title: Cowboys Take Over First Place With a 3710 Rout of Redskins
description: IRVING, Tex., Nov. 23 It took the Dallas Cowboys almost three months, but they finally captured undisputed possession of first place today by turning back the Washington Redskins before a capacity crowd of 69,905 prideful rooters in Texas Stadium. The score, 3710, was hardly indicative of the swing of the game, so dominant were the defending Super Bowl champions. Something like 33710 would have been more like it.

title: 2 Documents Termed Basis for New Inquiry Into BusShelter Pact
description: A letter and a memorandum that had not been shown to the Board of Ethics during its inquiry into a controversial busshelter contract led New York City's Investigation Commissioner to open his own inquiry this week. The documents raised questions about the role of a former city official now working for one of two companies competing for the busshelter franchises.

title: Canada Narrows Plane Choice
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 23  The Grumman Aerospace Corporation and two other aircraft manufacturers were eliminated today by the Canadian Government from consideration for a contract of close to $2 billion for fighter planes.

title: Pass Wins for McMahon
description: Todd Hermanson's 4yard touchdown pass to Bob Johnson with 31 seconds remaining lifted McMahon to its first Fairfield County Interscholastic Ath. letic Conference championship yesterday over previously undefeated Wilton, 127. at Boil Stadium.

title: Events and Openings
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, LIncoln Center, Ver. di's Luisa Miller, B.

title: As Raisin Prices Climb, Try Currants Instead
description: With all of the holiday cakes, cookies and puddings soon to be made for the Christmas season, raisins will be in peak demand. And, as you may have already discovered, those sweet and chewy dried grapes are at recordhigh prices this year, $2 per pound now and climbing steadily.

title: Elderly Hold a Special Feast
description: Florence Mills, 77 years old, decided months ago that she would feed at least 23 people this Thanksgiving, but 11 of the 23 guests she entertained yesterday she had never seen before.

title: Colorado State 20, Pacific 13
description: STOCKTON, Calif., Nov. 23 (AP) Colorado State posted a 2013 victory over the University of the Pacific today on a fourthquarter plunge by Jeff Br hrowicz.

title: CORE Leader Vs. Dissidents
description: They employed the pacifist tactics of Gandhi 15 years before the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. applied them successfully in Monteomerv. Ala.

title: 3 Children Die in Ohio House Fire Believed Caused by Heat in Wall
description: UHRICHSVILLE, Ohio, Nov. 2.3 (UPI)  Three children were killed and their mother was injured early Thanksgiving Day when a fire destroyed their twostory wood frame home.

title: About Real Estate Developers Concerned About Rents, High Interest Rates
description: We'll be breaking around in 10 days, said Joseph Giffuni. Make it Christmas. he said, on second thought.

title: Judge Refuses to Halt ShOwing Of Movie on Disabled Defendant
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23 (UPI)  A judge has refused to prohibit the showing in Illinois of a television movie based on the life of Donald Lang, an illiterate who can neither speak nor hear and has twice been charged with murder.

title: JAMES J. NAGLE DIES; REPORTER FOR TIMES
description: James J. Nagle, a financialbusiness news reporter for The New York Times for many years, died yesterday at West pester Square Hospital in the Bronx after a long illness. He was 69 years old and had been with The Times for 51 years.

title: U.S. PREPARES GUIDE FOR ENERGY CRISES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP) Federal planners, studying ways to cope with future energy crises, are considering such options as diverting power from Navy ships, reducing the use of elevators and encouraging fourday workweeks.

title: The Pop Life
description: FOLK MUSIC exists in a kind of netherworld these days, at least in commercial terms. you broaden the scope of the word folk wide enough, every conceivable kind of millionselling pop record can trace its roots to folk (of course, if you broaden the word further still. pop music is folk music, but that's another matter).

title: Girl Denied Party Line As Fire Destroys Home
description: GOODELLS, Mich., Nov. 23 (UPI) Kathy Teodecki, 13 years old, tried to call the Fire Department to report fire that eventually destroyed her home, but two people using the telephone party line refused to hang up, according to the authorities.

title: Roosevelt Triumphs, 10, In AllCity Soccer Final
description: A firsthill goal by Roberto Russo enabled Theodore Roosevelt, the public schools champion, to defeat Holy Cross, the Catholic champion, in the allcity high school soccer final, 10, Wednesday at Bayside Field in Queens.

title: TANZANIANS, BITTER, DENY WAR IS ENDED
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Nov. 20  Now that Uganda's invasion has been stymied, the problem for Tanzania, as summed up in a newspaper headline, is What Next?

title: Notes on People
description: The big date for Veniamin G. Levich and his wife, Tanya, has been set for next Thursday. That is when they finally will be able to leave the Soviet Union, after being denied exit visas for six years, ostensibly because Dr. Levich had been privy to nuclear secrets as a highranking physical chemist.

title: Let in the. Cuban Prisoners
description: In public remarks and in diplomatic messages to Havana last year, President Carter asked that Cuba release its political prisoners as one important step toward a resumption of normal relations. Fidel Castro has unexpectedly offered the hand of reconciliation an estimated one million Cuban exiles in the United States. To seal the bargain he has started releasing political prisoners, most of whom apparently want come to the United States.

title: Stieglitz's Portrait Of O'Keeffe at Met
description: MY first memory of Stieglitz was on a day in 1908 when I was at the Art Students League. New York was covered with fresh snow. I went with two or three other students to see the Rodin drawings at 291.291 was a few rooms at that address on Fifth Avenue where a new kind of art was shown  and it was the only place in New York you could see anything like it.

title: The New York I trnes
description: Wantagh's Glen Flaherty bobbling ball at the Bethpage 20

title: Ansonia Wins 36th On 2Minute Drill
description: Sandy Osiecki completed four passes in a 54yard touchdown drive in the last two minutes of play yesterday as Ansonia rallied to defeat Naugatuck, 147, for its 36th consecutive victory.

title: Catalogue Shopping on the Rise
description: Buying by catalogue used to bring to mind the backwoods, but no more. Customers are not only ordering household staples by mail, they are also leafing through an outpouring of expensively printed catalogues for everything from sable coats to diamond bracelets. The mailorder business is putting on the dog.

title: EEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
description: ART (GR 37014) Fri. Sat. Bread and Chocolate 1. 3, 5. 7.9, 11. Sun. 1:50.4.6,8, 10.

title: Doctor Linked to Cyanide Potion Acclaimed Hero 10 Months Ago
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. The physician who reportedly the cyanide punch that killed as many 400 members of an American cult weekend, had become something of a local celebrity 10 months ago.

title: Black Film Show Relives Jazz and Tap
description: Remember Tip, Tap and Toe, and Buck and Bubbles, and the Nicholas Brothers and Miller and Rhodes and Bill (Bojangles) Robinson?

title: Around the Nation
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 23 (UPI) Pennsylvania State Representative Frank Meluskey, a 26yearold Democrat from Bethlehem, died while on a Thanksgiving vacation, throwing the precarious political balance of the Pennsylvania Legislature into confusion once again.

title: Giving All 4 Acts of Man and Superman
description: By any measure, even a Shavian one, the role of Jack Tanner in Man and Superman is long, difficult and exhausting, made doubly so in Stephen Porter's version of the play, which begins previews tonight at the Circle in the Square on Broadway. In a full version, such as the one staged last year at the Shaw Festival in Niagara on the Lake, it would run more than five hours.

title: Theater and Art Are on Henry St. Bill
description: A cornucopia of events is scheduled this weekend at the Henry Street Settlement. 466 Grand Street.

title: Japan, East Germany Win Gold Medals in Judo Event
description: TOKYO, Nov. 23 (AP)  Japan and East Germany won gold medals today in the first two individual events opening the fourday International Judo Championship.

title: Iceland Struggling With Inflation And Fear of Irreparable Damage
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Nov. 20  Iceland is now a country where people pay for icecream cones with checks, buy slice of ham for $1.70, and can sell their rusted twoyearold cars at double what they paid for them new.

title: Barringer Routs Rival
description: Norm Granger ran 83 yards for one score, Keith Hunter returned an interception 85 yards for another and Tim Brooks added two more scores yesterday as Barringer trounced East Orange, 370, before 8,000 fans. This was the 82d game of New Jersey's longestrunning Thanksgiving rivalry, which East Orange now leads, 39358.

title: IN THE NATION Africans Lose A Friend
description: JOHANNESBURG  On one of his frequent trips to Africa, Senator Dick Clark of Iowa was aboard a commercial flight that stopped in Kinshasa, Zaire. Armed soldiers came aboard to remove him from the plane.

title: 2 Children Are Killed In a Fire
description: A fire on Thanksgiving eve that killed two small girls and their 55yearold grandfather was started accidentally when the children were left alone with candles burning in their apartment at 409 West 39th Street, fire marshals said yesterday.

title: Wheelchair Games Led By U. S.
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 23 (AP) Athletes from the United States continued to dominate the sixth PanAmerican Wheelchair Games in the swimming and basketball competition today.

title: Silver Ice Scores
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 23 (AP)  Silver Ice won her third stakes race of the year by a halflength over Trim the Sail today in the $34,350 First Lady Handicap at Laurel Race Course.

title: News Summary
description: The Cairo newspaper AI Ahram published what it said was the text of the peace treaty negotiated earlier with Israel. The preamable descibed the peace treaty as an essential step  in the search for a comprehensive settlement of the Mideast conflict in all its aspects. This significant allusion was the linkage that Egypt has sought between a treaty and movement toward Palestinian selfgoverment. [Al :6]

title: Britain Reviving Rhodesian Effort
description: LONDON, Nov. 23  Prime Minister James Callaghan announced today that he would begin a new attempt, with the support of President Carter; to bring peace to Rhodesia.

title: Susan E. Bertelmann Is Wed To Dr. Ian B. Fries, Surgeon
description: Susan Edith Bertelmann, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Bertelmann of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Ian Blair Fries, son of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Harman Fries of Brooklyn. The Rev. Myron McNight Sibley, a Methodist minister, performed the ceremony at the home of the bridegroom's brother and sisterinlaw, Dr. and Mrs. Brant Fries of Guilford, Conn., professors at Yale University.

title: Where to Go and Hear A Boweryphone Quartet
description: Pieces of plumbing, discarded wine bottles, empty cat food cans  you might call them the stuff of music. These and other found objects will be played by four musicians tonight and tomorrow at 8 P.M. in a program based on poems by hospitalized children. The concert will be offered at the Alternative Center For International Arts, 28 East Fourth Street, and the sounds will be definitely eerie.

title: U.S.Led Mediators Urge Full Plebiscite in Nicaragua
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Nov. 23 In n final effort to avert a new wave of v:0lence here, a United Statesled mediation, team has proposed a nationwide plebiscite to determine whether the beseiged Government of President Anastasjo Somoza Debayle should remain in office.

title: Peace Corps Head Wants to Stay
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 Dr. Carolyn Payton, Director of the Peace Corps, issued a statement today denying that she had resigned and saying she did not want to step down.

title: Deaths Distract Guyana From Its Economic Woes
description: Christopher Nascimento's main concern two weeks ago, like that of many of Guyana's leaders, was to justify to the World Bank the need for a $1 billion loan to build a hydroelectric plant that could help solve his nation's economic crisis.

title: Japan Hoping to Widen Trade With China
description: TOKYO, Nov. 23  The excitement generated among Japanese traders here by last month's visit of Teng Hsiao.ping, China's Deputy Prime Minister, has continued unabated as Japah looks to newly reaffirmed diplomatic ties with its ancient neighbor to open up a vast new market in China.

title: Deaths
description: ARANOWDorothy. Temple B'Nal ShoIons of Rockville Centre records with profound sorrow the passing of the wife of its esteemed member, George Aranow. Services Sunday at 10:30AM at Gutterman's, Rockville Centre.

title: Mr. Lincroft Triumphs
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 24  Mr. Lincroft, a 4yearold bay colt owned by Virginia Corcoran and trained by William J. Corcoran, closed quickly on the outside and won the $55,800 Cliff Hanger Handicap for Jerseybred horses tonight at the Meadowlands.

title: Grass on Men, Women and Flounder
description: Canter Grass's new novel, The Flounder, is not about fish, but about women, men and the state of the world. Because women, men and the state of the world are all controversial, suddenly his book has stirred up strong feelings, especially in the feminist community.

title: About New York
description: The Federal customs agents impounded the suspect cargo soon after was unloaded at Kennedy International Airport, acting quickly to impound the stuff before it could hit the streets where middleclass addicts were fairly slavering.

title: Mayor Wants New Team to Run City's Hospitals
description: Joseph T. Lynaugh finally resigned yesterday as president of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation.

title: Alaskan Cape Holds a Natural Archive
description: CAPE KRUSENSTERN, Alaska  To the untrained eye, Cape Krusenstern looks from the air simply like another of the many lonely beaches on Alaska's northwestern coast, its pristine solitude altered only by occasional remnants of seasonal Eskimo fishing shelters.

title: Television
description: 5:30(2)Stanley Siegel (R)

title: A College in Search of a Home
description: The campus of Manhattan Community College, a twoyear division of City University, is spread over blocks along Broadway and Seventh Avenue in New York City's rundown entertainment district. The 9,000 students, most of them training for careers in health or business, have no auditorium and no lecture halls; next door to one building is a massage parlor. Because such disordered conditions, the school's accreditation is in danger.

title: Mack of Rams to Retire
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Tom Mack, the Los Angeles Rams offensive lineman who has been picked for the Pro Bowl 10 times in 12 years, has decided to retire after this season, his 13th in the National Football League. Mack will play his 181st consecutive game Sunday when the Rams meet the Browns at Cleveland Stadium.

title: Beverly Marie Vaughn Married
description: In Sacred Heart Roman Catholic Church in Tampa, Fla., yesterday evening, Beverly Marie Vaughn, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Vaughn of Brandon, Fla., became the bride of William Moulton Graves Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Graves of Old Greenwich, Conn., and Grand Isle, Vt. Msgr. Frank M. Mouch performed the ceremony, The Rev. James C. Lara, a Roman Catholic priest, and the Rev. Arnold Wettstein, an Episcopal priest, assisted.

title: Indiana Rites Planned For Jones and Family
description: RICHMOND, Ind., Nov. 24 (UPI) A funeral home here will handle memorial rites for the Rev. Jim Jones, his wife, Marceline, and two of their adopted children, Lew and Agnes.

title: Folksbiene Theater Enacts Aleichem's The Inheritors
description: All of us, as heirs to the wit and chuchma of Sholem Aleichem, should be delighted to hear that The Inheritors, an adaptation of one of the master storyteller's short novels, is there for us to share in its original tongue, Yiddish, these weekends at the Folksbiene Theater, which is comfortably ensconced at 123 East 55th Street.THE INHERITORS by Sholem Alelchem. Adapted and directed by Jakub Rotbaum; setting and costumes by Jadwiga Przeradzka; hair designs by Nick DILeo; stage manager, Marvin Schwartz. Presented by the Folksbiene Playhouse, under the auspices of the Workmen's Circle and the Labor Zionist Alliance. At In East 55th Street.

title: Around the Nation
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 24 (AP) Censorship in public schools is on the rise, with schools in a survey saying they ban books ranging from The Diary of Anne Frank to dictionaries, a national teachers group reports.

title: Old Rivals in Big 10 Showdown
description: Despite the most substantial threat to the MichiganOhio State dominance of the Big Ten Conference in 10 years, the Wolverines and Buckeyes will meet once again today for the league title and the annual trip to the Rose Bowl. Michigan, which put down Purdue's surprising firstplace challenge a week ago, is a slight favorite to win at Columbus, Ohio, and make its third straight appearance in the Rose Bowl.

title: WILLIAM ASHTON TUCKER
description: William Ashton Tucker, a retired vice president of the J. Henry Schrmipr Rank

title: Cabinet Is Revamped By Trudeau in a Move To Improve Economy
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 24 Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau responded today to popular dissatisfaction with the state of the Canadian economy by shuffling his Cabinet to give priority to industrial development. which has been laggine.

title: Mugged Tenant Is Upheld in Suit
description: PASSAIC, N.J., Nov. 24  An appellate court has sustained a $25,000 damage award against the landlord of a Passaic apartment building who was held negligent in the mugging of a woman tenant five years ago because he had failed to install a lock on the building's front door.

title: A Possible Remedy for Thinking That Leads Youth
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.In light of the cult tragedy in Guyana, I am reminded that the almost desperate effort to understand cults in the United States has ignored a fundamental flaw in our educational system that renders young people so vulnerable to these irrational movements.

title: WARREN WEAVER, 84, IS DEAD AFTER FALL
description: Educator Known for Achievements in Many Fields, Was Active in Research in 2 Wars.

title: Sports Today
description: Los Angeles Times 500 NASCAR stockcar race, at Ontario, Calif. Seventh segment in a taped series of the world's strongest men competition will also be shown. (Television Channel 2, 4;30 P.M.)

title: The Unlikely Beginning Of the Right to Life Party
description: MERRICK, L.I., Nov. 22  Abortion a terrible thing, someone in the book discussion group at Diane Arrigan's house said one day, and the other women there agreed that something ought to be done.

title: Solomon Says Pullout Of American Airlines Is Not Very Important
description: New York City's top economicdevelop. ment official said yesterday that the decision of American Airlines to move its corporate headquarters, along with 1,300 jobs, from Manhattan to the DallasFort Worth Airport was a minor blow to New York's prestige and not very important to the city s overall economic health.

title: Unflappable American Ambassador to Guyana
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24  At 6:20 P.M. last Saturday, Ashley Hewitt, the director of the State Department's Office of Caribbean Affairs, received an urgent phone call at home from the United States Ambassador in Guyana.

title: Nicaraguans Reject U.S. Proposal
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Nov. 24President Anastasio Somoza Debayle and his powerful opposition tonight both rejected an American proposal for a nationwide plebiscite here to decide whether the embattled Nicaraguan ruler should remain in power.

title: Dividends
description: FRIDAY, NOV. 24, 1978

title: U.S. Auto Sales Show Increase Over Imports
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) Auto manufacturers in the United States are recovering some of the sales they lost to the Germans and Japanese in this country, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Celtics Turn Back Knicks, 109 to 98
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29 The Boston Celtics halted the Knicks fivegame winning streak, 10998, tonight at the Boston Garden, and the biggest.hand in the victory belonged to Earl Williams.

title: McEnroe Loses To Fleming In Semifinals.
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, Nov. 24 (AP) Peter Fleming of the United States eliminated topseeded John McEnroe, 64, 61, today and entered the final of a $50,000 international indoor tennis tournament here.

title: 100,000 See Christmas Lights
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 24 (AP) An estimated 100,000 people turned out to see 152,000 Christmas lights turned on as the Country Club Plaza opened its Yule season. Spokesmen for the Country Club Plaza say it is the world's oldest shopping center. The colored lights outline the Spanish architecture of the buildings.

title: True or False: There's Something West of the Hudson
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill.Not long ago the New York Board of Trade unveiled a publicrelations campaign it called Project Appleseed. Its purpose is to convince the rest of America that New Yorkers are just folks, too.

title: Miss Austin Gains Final
description: TOKYO, Nov. 24 (AP)  Tracy Austin and Martina Navratilova gained tomorrow's final of a tennis tournament here today. Miss Austin, utilizing her speed, beat a fellow American, Kathy May, 63, 62 and Miss Navratilova, displaying powerful serves, defeated Virginia Ruzici of Rumania, 64, 63.

title: Breakaway Bishop Says He's Loyalist
description: WEST ORANGE, N.J., Nov. 21  The consecration here of a downtoearth, tobaccochewing secessionist parish priest as a bishop has exacerbated a dispute among American Episcopalians, but the Bishop insists that we didn't leave the Episcopal Church, they left us.

title: Cavaliers 104, Pacers 98
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 24 (AP) Terry Furlow, a reserve, scored 25 points as the Cleveland Cavaliers ended an eightgame losing streak tonight with a 10498 victory over the Indiana Pacers.

title: 21 Sue in Scaffold Accident
description: ST. MARYS, W.Va., Nov. 24 (UPI) Twentyone relatives of construction workers who died in the Willow Island scaffolding disaster have filed civil suits in Pleasants County Circuit Court, court records showed today. Included in the total were 11 plaintiffs who filed suits in the last two weeks. seeking $85 million from the companies involving in building the cooling tower at the Monongahela Power Company plant near. Fiftyone workers fell to their deaths April 27 when a scaffolding peeled away from the top of the tower.

title: United Press Internadonal
description: AFTERMATH OF EXPLOSION: A utilities department employee in Wilmer, Tex., searching remains of house yesterday after gas explosion destroyed the residence In the Dallas suburb. One oerson was seriously injured.

title: VANCE SAYS ISRAEL AND EGYPTIANS NEED TO CONTINUE TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that the acceptance by Israel of the draft text of a peace treaty with Egypt was insufficient in itself to permit the conclusion of negotiations.

title: Curb on Child TV Ads Is Assailed
description: ASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  The National Association of Broadcasters urged. Government regulators today to abandon proposed restrictions on television advertising that is directed at children.

title: Scholastic Team A Brotherly Act
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Nov. 24 (AP)  Seven sets of brothers plan to travel to Seattle tomorrow to play for Lewis and Clark against Snohomish in the Washington state AAA high school football semifinals.

title: Queen Elizabeth II Trip Canceled
description: BOSTON, Nov. 24 (AP)  Some 1,900 people set to sail on the Queen Elizabeth II to the Caribbean a week from Sunday will have to choose another travel plan becaase the ship is still under repair in England. Crimson Travel, the agency sponsoring the trip, canceled the trip this week after Cunard Lines in New York said that tne giant luxury liner would not be ready in time to sail. The ship was battered by heavy seas in a storm this summer.

title: Bullets 113, Lakers 103
description: LANDOVER, Md., Nov. 24 (AP) Mitch Kupchak scored 32 points and had 17 rebounds to lead the streaking Washington Bullets to a 113103 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers tonight.

title: Lock Haven Gains Final
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., Nov. 24 (AP)  Mike Bobby posted a shutout and Scott Cardin booted in the lone tally today as the defending champion Lock Haven State defeated Cortland State, 10, in a semifinal match of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division III soccer tournament. The championship game tomorrow pits Lock Haven against Washington University, which beat North Adams State, 10, earlier today on a goal by Ahmed Boudhane.

title: ComicBook Fans Gather for Creation 79
description: Swarms of tykes  little tycoons, every one of them  are underfoot this weekend at New York's comicbook convention. Wheeling, dealing and reeling from the adventures of comicbook heroes, they are setting new record prices for old comic books, trampling President Carter's inflation guidelines beneath tiny toes.

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times in the last week.

title: Bell Aide to Hear Protests By MexicanAmericans
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 24  The Justice Department, concerned over a growing conviction among MexicanAmericans that the Carta: Administration is insensitive to their civil liberties, will dispatch Benjamin R. Civiletti, the Deputy Attorney General, on a tour of the Southwest that it hopes will provide reassurances of good faith and bring about understanding of the limits of Federal jurisdiction.

title: Arabs Growing Optimism on Dollar Expected to Bring OilPrice Restraint
description: KUWAIT, Nov. 22  The president of the Central Bank of Kuwait, Hamza Abbas Hussein, has just emerged from a 7:30 A.M. reserve management session in the twoyearold building near the teeming bazaar of this oilrich emirate.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TODAY, Nov. 25

title: National G.O.P. Joins With Bank In Promotion of Visa Credit Card
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24  Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company and the Republican National Committee will begin jointly promoting credit cards in New York State next year, with the Republicans getting a finder's fee of $2.50 for every new Visa card issued under the Program.

title: Jankowski Is Heartened By CBS's Ratings Gains
description: A month ago, there was reason to doubt that the CBS management team installed last fall in a sweeping reorganization of the company would survive much past its first anniversary on Nov. 17.

title: Books of The Times Complexity of Phenomenal
description: When I was a teenager, I went to see a Picasso retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art. I was unfamiliar with 20thcentury painting and, defensive in my ignorance, I laughed at the works on the walls. Yet I was impressed with the people in the museum  it attracted a betterlooking crowd in those days  and they seemed to be stimulated by Picasso.

title: U.S. Steel Will Raise Prices 3.2%
description: The United States Steel Corporation announced yesterday that it would raise prices Jan. 1 on threefourths of its steel products by an average of 3.2 percent, an amount so far within the Carter Administration's antiinflation guidelines.

title: Flood Water Rising in Leningrad
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 24 (Reuters)  Tens of thousands of people have been mobilized in Leningrad to erect flood barriers around monuments and national treasures after a week of high tides and gales, the newspaper Izvestia reported today.

title: Bridge:
description: DENVER, Nov. 24  One of New Yorks brightest stars, David Berkowitz, celebrated his 29th birthday by winning the blue ribbon pair championship here last night at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals. His partner was Ron Andersen, who captured the McKenney Trophy last year with a record total of more than 2,000 master points.

title: U.S. SAYS GUYANA TOLL HAS NEARLY DOUBLED; DEATHS IN JUNGLE COMMUNE COULD REACH 780
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 24Almost twice as many adherents of the People's Temple died in the cult's jungle commune as the number initially reported by Guyanese authorities, United States officials said today.

title: Events and Openings
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Ver. tli's Aida, 2; Smetana's The Bartered Bride, 8.

title: Draths
description: GREENGLICKMae, beloved wife of Isidor, mother of Alfred and the late Harold Green, grandmother of Richard, Ronald, Andrew, Ellen, Michael and sister of Celia Buchalter, Lou Smith and the late Meyer and Ben Smith. Died suddenly October 28, 1978. Served for many years on the Board of Directors of the Sol and Regina Rubel Ladies Society, a charitable organization. She will be missed by her family and many friends.

title: Fame Comes, Again, to Alberta Hunter
description: By day the prowls the meat department at Macy's, inspecting veal chops and spareribs, lugging a shopping bag and shuffling along on feet that move as though they hurt. She likes to ride the city s buses, too: a tiny old lady with a woolen cap pulled down over her ears and a faraway look on her face.

title: Peking Poster Praises 2 Aides Mao Purged
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 24  A poster put up in Peking today praised two senior Communist leadlers purged by Mao Tsetung many yc rs ago and heaped scorn on two former heads of the security apparatus who were close to Mao.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: Hundreds of millions of people have seen the photographic or televised image of Nguyen Ngoc Loan shooting a Vietcong suspect after the U.S. Embassy in Saigon had been attacked and resecured during the Tet offensive of 1968. It was the most memorable image I have of the 1960's.

title: Building Snag Delays Albany Effort to Ease
description: Construction delays caused by the bankruptcy of the general contractor working on a major new prison have impeded New York State's efforts to relieve seriousovercrowding in its prison system.

title: Egypt's Printing of Peace Treaty Text Seen as a Move to Calm Arab Foes
description: CAIRO, Nov. 24  The surprise publication this morning in Cairo of the text of a draft peace treaty between Egypt and Israel was intended, some Cairobased analysts concluded, to demonstrate to Arab critics that Egypt was not negotiating a separate peace.

title: Deaths
description: MURPHYJames F. On Friday, No vember 24, 1978. Beloved husband of the fate Margaret M. (nee O'Brien). Devoted father of Rosemarie M. Co dus, James F., Jr., John J. and Ed ward H. Murphy. Brother of Rose, William D. and Edward H. Murphy. Also survived by 14 grandchildren. Reposing at the Mackin Mortuary, 52 Clinton Ave., Rockville Centre, N.Y. Mass of the Resurrection S1 Agnes Cathedral, Monday, November 27, 10AM. Interment Cemetery or the Holy Rood. Westbury, N.Y. Family will recelve friends 25: 79PM.

title: SAMUEL SEILER
description: Samuel Seiler, a founder and former president of the New York State Caterers Association, died in his sleep yesterday at his home at 610 Waring Avenue, the Bronx. He was 92 years old.

title: Republican Hopes in Mississippi Raised by Election
