title: ART Engaging Construction
description: YONKERS MANY of us can see a sculpture in the round, simply give it a cursory glance and walk away, and hardly become involved. Even if we do give a more sustained study, our involvement with it is primarily visual. But is difficult not to become involved in the work of Robert Stackhouse and involved on more levels than just the visual one.

title: Fiction Roundup
description: There is no more precise cartographer of a special world than Louis Auchincloss. But in the first pages of this novel, set in the 1930's during the first Roosevelt Administration, he almost seems to be parodying himself and all those subtle scenes by which  in previous books  he has revealed that world to us. Consider Miss Caroline Bayard, descendant of Peter Stuyvesant, in colloquy with her sister, Mrs. Bayard Jones, during a call on Miss Dolly Chadbourne.

title: Paula Kravitz Plans June Bridal
description: Paula Kravitz, an Ade1phi University alumna who expects to receive a master's in public administration next month from the University of Pittsburgh, and David Dambroff, who is with the New York law firm of Segan, Culhane, Nemerov & Geen, plan to be married in June. Mr. and Mrs. Wallace Kravitz of Syosset, L.I., parents of the bridetobe, have announced the engagement. The prospective bridegroom, who has degrees from the University of Denver and the Western New England Law School, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan Dambroff of Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Sammy's Run Awes Schulberg
description: WESTHAMPTON THIRTYSEVEN years after Budd Schulberg fired the starting gun for Sammy Glick's ruthless race toward success, Penguin Books has released a paperback version of What Makes SaMmy Run? And today, looking back, Mr. Schulberg is amazed at the twist in the road taken by his now legendary id boy. In 1978, it seems, Sammy has become a role model for some people who want to succeed.

title: Author's Query
description: For a biography of the American photographer, Alice Boughton (18661943 ), I would he grateful for any letters, photographs, recollections or other pertinent documents.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 9:30 A.M. (Channel 4) The Health Field: MI about plastic surgery.

title: Cache And Carry
description: THE first thing to do is to find hiding place. That is of primary importance because, the police have told us once, they have told us a dozen times  each time they have come to ask us if we saw anything unusual on the day a neighbor's home was robbed.

title: GARDENING
description: MENTION cactuses to nongardener and he is likely to say, Oh, yes, those are the plants that never need to be watered.

title: Ann Compton Bride of Dr. William Hughes
description: Ann Woodruff Compton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles E. Compton of Glencoe, Ill., was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. William Stevenson Hughes, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph F. Hughes of Haverford, Pa.

title: SPORTS
description: NEXT to the Russian superheavyweight Vasily Alexeev, Rich Seibert of East Meadow looks as if he overdid the Scarsdale diet. But the 17yearold Seibert  A.A.U. weightlifter of the year in 1977 and the national champion in the 132pound class in this year's Junior Olympics  obviously casts a big shadow in the iron game.

title: New Jersey/ This Week
description: BLOOMFIELD (Bloomfield College, Franklin and Fremont Streets)  A View from the Bridge, in an Actor's CafeTheater production. Thursday through Saturday, 8:30 P.M. (through Dec. 16). $3.50$5.50; students and tne elderly, $2.50$4.50. (201) 4297662.

title: Engagements
description: Mr Mrs John E. Palmer of Barrie, Ontario, Canada are pleased to announce the engagement of their daughter, Donna Lynne, to Mr. David P. Cole of Stamford, Conn. Miss Palmer Is a registered nurse and is living In Toronto, Ontario. Mr. Cole Is Vice President Personnel for C. A. Parshall, Inc.. 76 Madison Ave. NYC. The wedding Is Planned for May and will take place in Barrie, Ontario after which the couple will reside In Stamford.

title: THE MARKETS
description: Rising interest rates traditionally have proved bugaboo for the stock market. But last Friday, with rates climbing on two key fronts, the stock market moved higher. It thus indicated once again that the familiar rules for predicting stock prices, at least on a shortterm basis, have flown out the window 1978. Friday's modest 3point rise in the Ddw Jones industrial average marked the sixth advance in the last seven trading sessions, a welcome development indeed in the wake of October's disastrous slide. Furthermore, for the 23rd time in the last 27 years, thu Dow Jones industrial average posted a gain in the day following the Thanksgiving holiday.

title: Reassurances About New Insurance
description: SOME day in the near future, plan to start my own lifeinsurance company in New Jersey. But since that field is already crowded with regular institutions, my company will be different.

title: Is the Party Over?
description: TIME was when Americans would assert a party affiliation (I am a Republican) as easily as they would disclose their religion. Notables printed their party in Who's Who; newspapers named their loyalty on their mastheads. Through a party one became political, You chose or inherited an allegiance, after which you voted that ticket.

title: A Characteristic Figure
description: THE best poems of Anne Sexton embody her talent for focus and authority, hammering home to the reader, however clumsily, the shape and conviction of an emotion. The emotion is not usually far from a feeling of outraged self disgust, arrestingly conveyed by a series images and narrative declarations, some more incisive than others, but sometimes memorable the aggregate:

title: For Gentlemen Only
description: One thing the visitor to England sometimes has difficulty grasping is that when the natives talk of public schools they mean, in fact, private schools. Ninetyfive percent of

title: U.S. Park To Get Guns Of Revolutionary War
description: VALLEY FORGE, Pa., Nov. 25 (AP)One of the country's largest private collections of Revolutionary War weapons, including muskets, rifles, swords and cannons, has been acquired by the National Park Service for the Valley Forge National Historic Park.

title: U.S. WEIGHING CURBS ON LEADED CAS USE
description: DETROIT, Nov. 25The Federal Government is seriously considering imposing a variety of financial and legal penalties on the use of leaded gasoline, as means of discouraging its use in cars that require the higherpriced unleaded gasoline for proper functioning of pollution control equipment.

title: Man Dies in Parking Lot Fracas
description: EPHRATA, Pa., Nov. 25 (UPI)  Den. nis Martin, 30 years old, of East Earl, was shot to death and another man was wounded early today in an exchange of gunfire in the parking lot of AmVets Post 136 in thiS Lancaster County community. David Loran. 19, of Reamstovm was shot in the hip with a small caliber weapon, the police said. They said they had found a shotgun near Mr. Martin. Neighbors told the police that they heard three or four shots exchanged among a group of five or six people who had been arguing.

title: The Poet and the Personality
description: W.B. YEATS once wrote that the intellect of man is forced to choose/ Perfection of the life, or of the work. I am not sure that the choice is available, or that the relation between life and work can be negotiated as a choice between ideal perfections. Life is a more capacious term than work, because it includes work as one of its constituents.

title: Other World Events
description: The plight of 2,500 Vietnamese refugees crammed aboard the freighter Hai Hong in diplomatic limbo off Malaysia was eclipsed last week by the death of 200 other refugees. The dead were aboard a fishing boat, also refused permission land by Malaysia, that hit a sandbar and capsized after being towed out to sea. As many as 30 other refugeeladen vessels are reported to be approaching Malaysia, which already has given temporary shelter to more than 35,000 Vietnamese.

title: S.I. Pilot, Missing Two Months, Found Dead in Tennessee Woods
description: LINDEN, Tenn., Nov. 25 (UPI)  A 19yearold New York City pilot missing for more than two months on a crosscountry flight has been found dead, strapped in the seat of his wrecked singleengine plane.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NORMAN, Okla., Nov. 25 (AP) Greg Roberts, the quick Oklahoma offensive guard, was named today winner of the Outland Award. The award is given by the Football Writers Association of America to the outstanding interior lineman in collegiate football.

title: N. C. Thorne Is the Fianc Of Miss Yates
description: Mr. and Mrs. Douglas Thomas Yates of New Ynrk and Islip, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Margaret Ann Yates, to Nathan Comstock Thorne, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Wooster Thorne Jr. of Oakland, Calif. Plans have been made for a wedding next April.

title: A.T.&T. Keeps the Operating Companies Plugged In
description: OMAHA, Neb.  Conversation, bits and snatches of it, bubbled through the room. About 25 operators were seated at their stations, offering assistance, calling out instructions  drivingly busy.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: The Duarte (Calif.) Rotary Club had but 12 enrolled members early this year, but three were women and Rotary International said either the women went or the club went. The club went. Since its formation in 1902, Rotary International had restricted full'. fledged membership to men.

title: Dr. Peter J. Conroy Marries Pamela Yu
description: Pamela Yu, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. A. Tobey Yu of Smoke Rise, Kinnelon, N.J., was married there yesterday evening to Dr. Peter J. Conroy, son of Mr. and Mrs. James M. Conroy of Runcorn, England. The Rev. Edward Johnston, a Methodist minister, performed the ceremony in Smoke Rise Community Church.

title: IN THE NATION Democracy In Africa
description: GABARONE, Botswana  It was scene familiar in the west but rare in Africa. The bewigged speaker of the house rapped his gavel, the 32 members settled into their seats, and the fifth session of the freely elected parliament of the Republic of Botswana made ready to hear the opening speech by President Sir Seretse Khama.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: The big hit of Mirrors and Windows, last summer's survey of recent American photography at the Museum of Modern Art, was an unknown photographer named Sheila Metzner, who is currently having her first solo exhibition at Daniel Wolf, Inc., 30 West 57th Street, through Dec. 9. The reason for her success is easy to see. After the pseudodocumentaries, the jokes and the Rohrschachlike exercises in sellexpression that dominated Mirrors and Windows, Sheila Metzner's unaffected portrait of an appealing child gave writers and picture editors, as well as the general public, something they could truly enthuse about.

title: Colombian President Steps Up Army's Role In Anticrime Efforts
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Nov. 24  The new Government of President Julio Cesar Turbay Ayala in Colombia, one of Latin America's few democracies, has greatly increased the role of the military in repressing political violence, drug traffic and general lawlessness.

title: The Big Bang andLther Starts
description: ROBERT JASTROW is not one to mince words. He says it all in his title. The astronomers have replaced the priests as the official answerers of the great question: Where did everything (including all of us) come from? The scientists answer, curiously enough, turns out to be very close to that of the priests. In Professor Jastrow's words, The details differ, but the essential elements in the astronomical and biblical accounts of Genesis are the same: the chain of events leading to man commenced suddenly and sharply at a definite moment in time, in a flash of light and energy. Professor Jastrow's scientific credentials are impeccable: he is on the faculties of both Columbia University and Dartmouth College and he is the founder and director of NASA's Goddard Institute for Space Studies. He also knows how to write for laymen; an earlier book, Red Giants and White Dwarfs, sold 400,000 copies.

title: INTERVIEW
description: JERSEY CITY TWO years after his return from Paraguay, where, as a member of the Franciscan Order, he was instrumental in organizing a diocese, Auxiliary Bishop Jerome A. Pechillo, Roman Catholic Vicar of Hudson County, still feels like a missionary.

title: Baby Born in School And Left in Shoe Box
description: BAIRD, Tex., Nov. 25 (AP) A newborn baby boy found in a shoe box beside a garbage collection area was reported in good condition in a local hospital. The baby was born in the girl's dressing room at Baird High School, the authorities said.

title: RUDA CHALLENGED AS JAPAN'S PREMIER
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25 Masayoshi Ohira, conservative leader who is viewed as moderate, appears to be ahead of Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda in a party struggle for the prime ministership.

title: SPOTLIGHT A Life Spent on One Problem
description: PITTSBURGH  When Herbert A. Simon accepts the 1978 Nobel Prize in Stockholm on Dec. 10, it will be for his work in economics. There is no Nobel for psychology, or for computer science, or for public administration.

title: POLICE ARE CALLING ON PSYCHICS FOR AID
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 25  After two years of extensive investigation, the police in South Gate, Calif., had failed to solve the sex murders of three youths. Exasperated, they turned to a local psychic, who saw a face in a vision and helped a police artist construct a drawine. A few weeks later. policemen using the drawing arrested an acquaintance of one of the boys.

title: LONG ISLAND JOURNAL
description: LOCUST VALLEY has the distinction of being the only school district on the Island to have required four elections before approving its budget.

title: It Reminds Phil Bieber
description: Probably it was the recent ringer case  the one in which Cinzano. good horse from South America, ran and won under the name of Lebon, dead South American who couldn't beat a fat man when he was alive probably it was this that reminded Phil Bieber of some earlier imports from South America. He writes:

title: The Family That Sticks Together.
description: IF ONE were to make a study of the migratory patterns of metropolitan New Yorkers over the age of 52, one trend would be striking. Rather than move to Florida, many. such people move a little less south, specifically to adult developments along the U.S. 9 corridor.

title: Another Mark on Newark's Shield
description: NEWARK THIS city, which became a laboratory model for urban problems following race riots in 1967, is facing a new crisis of confidence in the wake of a budget squeeze that has resulted in the mailing of layoff notices to 450 of the 5,000 munirinal PmnInvRes.

title: Helen Ellsworth Bride Of Anthony E. Scoville
description: Helen S. Ellsworth and Anthony E. Scoville were married yesterday afternoon at St. John's Episcopal Church in Salisbury, Conn., by the Rev. James W. Hyde.

title: Father of American Art
description: FROM a modest start in Colonial America, Benjamin West (17381820) parlayed artistic talent. intelligence, an appealing personality and a gift for oneupmanship into a long reign as the most powerful and influential figure in English art at the end of the 18th century. Ever alert to the primary intellectual and esthetic currents of his day, West as a young artist was in the vanguard of NeuClassicism and subsequently shifted gears to become a pioneer Romantic. He was perhaps the first great American expatriate, anticipating Henry James and John Singer Sargent by a century.

title: FOOD
description: AFTER a summer and autumn of freshly caught bluefish at the Jersey Shore, you can have too much of a good thing. As I overheard the wife of a weekend angler say:

title: HAVING A BABY AFTER 35
description: This is not going to be one of those articles with a lot of mushy parts about childbirth  partly because what you are reading is being written by a woman who is nine days away from her delivery date. Nine more days. There was a period during my pregnancy when the main thing my friends said to me was, You don't look it, but that time has passed. I am bulging, laden, sloggy, logy, swaybacked, winded; the soles of my feet are numb from the extra weight ; my idea of heaven, at this point, would be a night spent sleeping on my stomach. How do you feel about your wife's body? my husband was asked in our Lamaze class. I like it, he said, but I won't be sorry when she gets her old one back.

title: HOME CLINIC How to Keep Heating Costs Down as the Bills Go Up
description: THE coming of cold weather marks the unwelcome arrival of steadily increasing fuel bills once more. Although there is not much the individual homeowner can do about the increasing cost of oil, gas and electricity, there are a number of steps that can be taken to reduce the amount of heating fuel consumed (heating accounts for the largest percentage of the annual energy requirements of most homes in this area).

title: Health
description: June Kahn, whose infected molar has been hurting her so badly she has eaten scarcely any solid food for days, is about to have her tooth extracted.

title: World News Briefs
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 25 (AP)  Iranian soldiers will mercilessly quell antiGovernment street protests that opposition leaders say are planned for next month, a highranking army officer said today.

title: NEW JERSEY JOURNAL
description: VOTING by absentee ballot is coming under scrutiny in New Jersey. Several state agencies and one private organization are investigating allegations of abuse.

title: SHOP TALK
description: THE Americana Mall on Northern Boulevard in Manhasset is a shopper's paradise where you can find a little bit of Paris at the Yves Saint Laurent shop and bit of New York at a branch of Brentano, plus a lot of everything else in between.

title: BRIDGE
description: Longdistance runners and bridgeplayers often betray inexperience in similar fashion. They set off at a great rate, run out of steam at some intermediate point, and achieve a poor result. In both fields a star performer can speed up at the finish because he did not act impatiently at the start.

title: Weary and Numb U.S. Soldiers Finish With Bodies
description: TIMEHRI AIRPORT, Guyana, Nov. 25 They brought in what they said was the last of the bodies from the People's Temple this afternoon and the soldiers of the graves registration team cheered. They clapped their bright orange rubber gloves in applause and shook hands with with each other and ripped blue masks off their faces. Some of them skipped on the runway.

title: CAMERA
description: There were no dramaticc innovations in optics or emulsions unveiled at Photokina, the biennial world's fair of photography, which took place in Cologne, Germany in September, but the growing importance of electronics in photographic equipment was amply evident.

title: J.H. Whitehouse to Wed Miriam, Josephson
description: Dr. and Mrs. Neil David Josephson of Vernon, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miriam Deborah Josephson, to Jonathan Hall Whitehouse, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold Alden Whitehouse of Cape Porpoise, Me.

title: New Drug Found for Treatment Of Glaucoma in Its Early Stages
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 24 (UPI)  Physicians at the University of Pittsburgh's Health Center are using a new drug to treat early stages of glaucoma, a debilitating eye disease that is the second leading cause of blindness in the United States among people over 40 years old.

title: Potential Fire Hazards Are Cited In Recall of Thermostat Devices
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)  The Consumer Product, Safety Commission has announced that it is recalling about 20,000 Fuel Sentry thermostat controls that are believed to pose fire hazards.

title: Coal Company Will Pay 78 Women Denied Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP)  A Pittsburgh coal company has agreed to pay $370,000 to 78 women who wery denied jobs at its mines because of sex discrimination, according to the Department of Interior.

title: Mary Hsu Married To Charles K. Yue
description: Mary Jane Barbara Hsu, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert H. Hsu of Glen Cove, L.I., was married there yesterday to Charles Kaukong Yue of Chicago, son of Dalia N.Y. Yue of Hong Kong and the late C.K. Yue. The ceremony was performed in St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Brendan P. Riordan.

title: Soccer Referee Is Slain
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 25 (AP)  A spectator knifed the referee to death after a soccer match at Bosanski Milosevac, near Modrica in central Yugoslavia, the Belgrade newspaper Vecernje Novosti reported today. The reteree was stabbed during a melee touched off by a dozen fans of the visiting Krecnjak team and some players who did not like the referee's decision to expel two Krecnjak players during the game, according to the paper. The referee was not identified.

title: WHY THE JAILING OF FARBER TERRIFIES ME
description: M.A. Farber of The New York Times has now been freed from Bergen County's Hackensack jail. For a total of nearly six weeks he sat in a cell block adjacent to a man who had allegedly murdered his own mother and facing an accused German sodomist awaiting deportation. Farber was there simply for practising the reporter's calling charged with both civil and criminal contempt of court for protecting the honor and tradition of that calling.

title: STAMPS
description: The last postal item for the year from the United States  barring an unexpected but always possible surprise play by the Postal Service is an item of some 17 million. This is the number of 13cent Liberty.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: What Women Are and Aren't
description: To the Sports Editor: Susan C. Zucker (Chauvinism Still the Greatest Foe of Women Athletes, Nov. 19) is hopelessly juvenile in her attitude toward women's sports. Like many, she insists on comparing them to men's in an overcompetitive effort to show that women are equal to or superior to men.

title: Verbal Constructs
description: ANY reader familiar with the critical pronouncements of Susan Sontag in Against Interpretation and Styles of Radical Will (especially the essay on The Aesthetics of Silence) will be prepared for the fact that her short stories would not have been accepted as such by Poe, Maupassant, Hemingway, Joyce (at least the Joyce of Dubliners), Chekhov, Lawrence or even Kafka. On the other hand. they are not quite the autonomous and selfsufficient verbal constructs that her esthetic position would seem to advocate. They are chockfull of reference to the exhausted world we inhabit; they abound in meaning  meaning that calls not for interpretation but for small, repeated sighs of recognition. All of them bear the impress of an active, questing intelligence that can apply language with neurosurgical skill to isolate and cut away the necrotic tissues of our collective modern consciousness. Some are decidedly more successful than others. Project for a Trip to China is an autobiographical reverie that is well enough written in the selfcatechising mode Miss Sontag uses in several pieces, but it is so reso!utely unfictional that I can see no reason for its inclusion in this collection. American Spirits (the erotic career of Miss Flatface, a young woman of irreproachable white Protestant ancestry) and Doctor Jekyll (an eccentric updating of the Stevenson tale) are both fables in which the demonstration of theme becomes much too mechanical  as it does in Baby (the wellmeant mutilation of a male child by its parents), where the pilingon of psychological clichs of a Southern California variety amounts finally to overkill. But only one story, Old Complaints Revisited, is, in my opinion, a nearly total failure  a tedious allegory on the subject of being Jewish that perversely calls attention to its own dullness.

title: Dingoes, Wagtails
description: Judith Wright is an Australian poet, author of 10 books of verse from which the present selection has been made. Assuming that American readers need help with work that conies out of an unfamiliar country, she provides an introduction telling us

title: The Global Film: Will It Play in Uruguay?
description: 0 n Nov. 10, Richard Burton, Roger Moore, Richard Harris, Hardy Krueger and the rest of The Wild Geese flapped their way into 450 theaters across America. Critics were not especially kind to the film. a sanguinary tale of mercenaries taking on an African dictator. But then The Wild Geese, despite its largescale opening in this country, wasn't necessarily made for American audiences.

title: Text of Annex of Peace Treaty
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 25 Following is the text of the draft of Annex III of the Treaty of Peace between the Arab Republic of Egypt and the State of Israel, as published today by the Israeli Foreign Ministry; COOPERATION FOR DEVELOPMENT AND GOOD NEIGHBORLY RELATIONS.

title: Chief Justice on Coast Suggests Investigation On Handling of Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 25  The way the California Supreme Court handled case involving mandatory prison terms should be investigated by the California Commission on Judicial Performance, Chief Justice Rose E. Bird wrote last niRht to the commission chairman.

title: The Alvin Ailey BlendBallet Modern and Broadway
description: T wentieth anniversary? It feels more like our 100th! A lean and chiseled Alvin Ailey sank into his chair, playing his reallife role of weary company director with huge enjoyment. Nothing would be ready on time.

title: U.S. ACTS TO SETTLE DAMWILDLIFE ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 The Interior Department acted this week to comply with new amendments to the Endangered Species Preservation Act, which requires a speedy decision on whether work on two large dams should be completed, even though one may be threatening the existence of the whooping crane and the other may be threatening the snail darter.

title: Caryn R. Steinfeld Is Betrothed to Richard Paul Swanson
description: Mr. and Mrs. Julian S. Steinfeld of Englewood Cliffs, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Caryn R. Steinfeld, to Richard Paul Swanson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward S. Swanson of New Canaan, Conn.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: IF an air of heightened excitement pervades the premises of Harper and Row this Tuesday, the,re is a reason. For on that day the paperback rights to the still unpublished Linda Goodman's Love Signs will go on the auction block. So? What's so enticing about the paperback rights to a popular book on astrology? Well, it needs no stellar configuration to answer that one. Consider the evidence.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: Today  Boulder Brook, Mamaroneck Rd., Scarsdale. N.Y. Amateurowner, suitable and local working hunters; Open jumpers. 8:30 A.M.

title: Picture Credits
description: 27UNITED PRESS INTE RNATIONAL

title: ART
description: GREENPORT'S lively Cultural Resource Center, operating since the summer of 1977 on combination of CETA financing, village good will and the perseverance of its energetic staff, is opening new art gallery in its building on South Street, just a few steps off Main. The center is housed in the former home of Greenport's Eagle Hose Company, No.1, a mid19thcentury edifice that has also served as the Town Hall.

title: Headliners
description: Perhaps because public and private scandals in Britain are usually wrapped in a blanket of propriety and strict libel laws, British political misdeeds, like British murders, tend to appear unusually titillating. Such was the case last week when Jeremy Thorpe, once leader of the Liberal Party, went before a magistrates court to determine if he must stand trial in conspiracy to murder Norman Scott, a former male model who claims to have once been his lover. Mr. Thorpe is accused of having paid $20,000 in 1975 to have Mr. Scott killed, after trying to persuade political associates to do the job. According to prosecution witnesses, Mr. Scott had for many years been threatening to reveal a homosexual relationship with the Liberal leader, and Mr. Thorpe was desperate to get rid him. The murder plot reportedly went awry when the wouldbe killer's gun jammed. Mr. Thorpe has denied all charges, well as Mr. Scott's claims. Whether or not the case goes trial, and whatever the verdict in such a trial, Mr Thorpe's oncebrilliant career seems to have been destroyed, and with it the recent hopes of the Liberal Party to return as a significant political force.

title: The World
description: Israel and Egypt remain out of sync, looking to the United States again to orchestrate accord. Last week, the Israeli Cabinet approved a compromise treaty proposed by Washington and accepted by Egypt two weeks earlier. Trouble is, Egypt has other conditions that Israel categorically rejects.

title: Gallup Poll Indicates President Wasn't Helped or Hurt by Voting
description: The latest measure of President Carter's popularity indicates that the Nov. state and Congressional elections neither helped nor hurt him, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: II
description: II

title: State Panel Urges Rise In Pay for Legislature And for the Judiciary
description: A New York State commission has recommended that members of the State Senate and Assembly vote themselves pay increase of $5,500 a year, effective in the new session of the Legislature, and that salaries of the judiciary be increased by 25 percent.

title: NEW LAWS ALLOWING CONTROL OVER DYING
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 25 More and more states will permit dying individuals to control their final medical care, and more and more courts are expected to intervene in the care of unconscious or incompetent dying persons, according to speakers at a conference attended by 350 health professionals, lawyers and clergymen from North America, Europe, Israel and Japan.

title: Robin Schmidt Sets May Bridal
description: Mr. and Mrs. Louis E. Schmidt of Ruxton, Md., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Robin Christine Schmidt, to Peter Joseph Higgins, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter J. Higgins of Larchmont, N.Y. A May wedding is planned.

title: Connecticut /This Week
description: AVON  The Art of Giving, the Giiiing of Art, Christmas sale of juried crafts, through Jan. 3, Farmington Valley Arts Center, Tuesday through Saturday 11 to 4, Sunday 1 to 4. Telephone 6781867.

title: Miss Youdin, a Student, Married to Richard Gill
description: Elizabeth Ann Youdin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard J. Youdin of Southbury, Conn., was married yesterday to Richard James Gill of Washington. The Rev. Charles C. Rother, Methodist minister, performed the ceremony at the Washington Hotel.

title: Participation in Athletics: Is It Worth All the Suffering?
description: When Joe Namath played game after game for the New York Jets despite great pain and the risk of more severe injury to his knees, and when Willis Reed led the Knicks to victory over the Los Angeles Lakers with his right hip numbed with painkiller in 1970, these players were judged to be courageous by most of their peers and a majority of their fans.

title: Saved by Sentiment
description: TED SOLOTAROFF'S taste in fiction has proved to he something of a national re source. Many of us were alerted to the great interest and power of the con??? rary short story in the late 1960's by Mr. Solot proff's New American Review (later American Review).

title: Applied PsychologyNot New; City Eleven Taught by Coach
description: Psychiatrists and psychologists seem to have become part of lockerroom paraphernalia. Their purpose is to raise the athlete to a serene state of gentle reason approximating that of normal men, a task to tax wizard.

title: Notes: More European Visitors Find the United States a Bargain
description: It all seemed so reassuring. On the Rue St. Michel in Paris, a reasonably good pricefixed meal could be bought for $1.20 (napkins were 3 cents extra): near the Hilton arcade in Berlin you could buy Swiss watches for well under $75; there was a shop on the Rossio in Lisbon where handsome fishermen's sweaters were sold for $5 and, in Reykjavik, stores sold pure wool scarves for a dollar. In Venice, they felt you had not bargained enough if you paid more than $1.50 for a red goblet fired with gold. And in Florence, the same amount of money would buy you not only a bistecca fiorentina but also the wine, pasta and dolce, too.

title: Marine Fisheries Council Is Taking Shape
description: IF A bill due to be released by a Senate committee next month is enacted into law, New Jersey restaurant owners no longer will have to buy New Jersey lobsters and fish from New York and Philadelphia markets.

title: BowlBound Rutgers Is Upset by Colgate
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Nov. 25 Colgate gained sweet revenge for the second straight year against Rutgers today when the Red Raiders upset the Scarlet Knights, 149, and tarnished the Knights image just three weeks before they play in their first bowl game.

title: Traffic Safety Agency Suggests Regulations to Control Mopeds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI) Sales of motorized bicycles are booming, and the Government has decided that the mopeds need to be regulated more closely.

title: A Peek at Gertrude V. Whitney's Studio
description: THE space  approximately 60 feet long by 40 wide by 20 high  is as generously and beautifully proportioned as that of any studio anywhere. Of the major areas in the building, the studio itself is the only bare and purely functional one. The entrance vestibule is about to.

title: THE LOOK OF MIKE
description: If dancers are the athletes of the gods, New York is clearly the Olympics. What was once there, literally, for the taking, in the days when balletomanes wandered into the City Center without benefit of tickets after the first intermission, now demands exhausting effort and planning. The astonishing abundance of dance in New York has been thoroughly delighted in and as thoroughly documented in recent years. But two current exhibitions show that interest in the dance is now turning up in places where leg warmers are not standard gear.

title: A Tuition Increase, But a Gradual One
description: FORT LEE WIDESPREAD confusion exists over the tuition policy adopted by the State Board of Higher Education at its November meeting.

title: Damaged People
description: THIS brief novel is really a kind of extended dream, although there's nothing dreamy about the precision and clarity of the writing. Its narrator, Jack; is a 15yearold English boy so sunk in selfloathing that there are long stretches when he can't even be bothered to bathe or brush his teeth. Jack's father is a crabbed, oppressive man whose greatest priae is a tightly constructed garden of plaster, plastic, rocks and widely spaced tulips; his mother is not much more than a shadow, and their neighborhood is a wasteland of abandoned prefabs. Life here seems smothered, flattened. For Jack, his two sisters and his little brother, the only pleasures are those that erupt beneath a rigid surface: some rather joyless sexual games and a few stolen moments of willful disobedience. The Cement Garden describes the process that steadily isolates these four children, until they're so absolutely alone and so at odds with the rest of the world that there is no way of returning to normal life. First their father dies, and then their mother. The loss of their mother leaves them without relatives; so to avoid being separated they keep her death a secret and bury her in a trunkful of wet cement in the basement. From then on, it's all regression and decay. Garbage spills across the kitchen floor, food rots and flies swarm. The cement in the basement develops a crack and the presence of the body becomes increasingly obvious. Tom, the little brother, first transforms himself into a girl and then Into a baby in a crib, and Jack and his older sister develop a sexual relationship that makes them seem, paradoxically, almost as infantile as Tom. Even the neighborhood grows starker, as the prefabs crumble and fall away. By the end, we're left with tour stripped, empty characters and not a shred of hope.

title: 3 in Family Die in Air Crash
description: HAZLETON, Pa., Nov. 24 (UPI)  An Air Force officer and his wife and daughter were killed yesterday in the crash of their light plane in fog and rainy weather. The crash occurred at 11 A.M. on Devils Mountain near the Schuylkill County town of Lofty. The victims were identified as Lieut. Col. Wayne Kanouse, 44 years old; his wife, Vivienne, 48, and their daughter, Lisa, 10.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: EAST BRUNSWICK IUSED to feel sorry for those of my friends whose children were away at college. How lonely they must be! What were the poor dears doing with themselves while rattling around in their empty houses?

title: 2 More Candidates Are Proposed for the Bronx Borough Presidency
description: The field of candidates for Bronx Bor t Ough President grew more crowded last week as two new names were put forward  State Housing Commissioner Victor Marrero and AsseMblyman Vincent A. Marchiselli.

title: GARDENING Winter's Living Sculpture
description: THIS is the time of year when the shapes and sizes of trees in a home landscape become important. Flamboyant flower colors have faded. Only the green velvet of the lawn remains. Trees stand out in their elegance or ugliness, whatever the case may be.

title: An Ambassador of Letters
description: IN the 1930's Stephen Spender was called the Shelley of his generation and the Rupert Brooke of the Depression. Neither remark can have pleased him much, but each got the essential genealogy right: Mr. Spender belongs to that line of romantic poets who believed that the times demanded something more than individualism. Shelley wrote revolutionary tracts and Brooke joined the Fabians; and Mr. Spender, through a long creative life, has been a politically engaged writer. Yet in spite of his political commitments, he has remained what he always was  a romantic individualist, valuing personal freedom and artistic creation, and seeking a Good Society in which individuals might flourish. The company he has kept has been mainly liberal/left, but his party is really the Poets Party; he has more in common with the poets who influenced his youth  Yeats and Lawrence and Eliot  than with the ideologues of the New Left.

title: Sammy Glick's Modern Success Alarms Writer Who Created Him in the 40's
description: WESTHAMPTON, L.I.  Thirtyseven years after Budd Schulberg fired the starting gun for Sammy Glick's ruthless race toward success, Penguin Books has released a paperback version of What Makes Sammy. Run? And today, looking back, Mr. Schulberg is amazed at the twist in the road taken by his nowlegendary id boy. In 1978, it seems, Sammy has become a role model for some people who want to succeed.

title: St. John's Five Wins 4th Lapchick Crown
description: St. John's University won its Joe Lapchick Memorial basketball tournament last night in Alumni Hall, beating Wagner College of Staten Island, 10891, on the 22point shooting of Rudy Wright and the 20point effort of Ron Plair.

title: A CORRECTION
description: Due to a typographical error last week, the asking price for a recently sold house at 560 Pequot Road in Southport was incorrectly given as $169,900. It should have read $240,000.

title: A Cottage in Corsica Was a Blissful Home Save for the Warnings
description: When the overnight steamer from the French Riviera docks at lie Rousse in Corsica the natives do not even look up from their cafe con leche and rolls. As for anyone wanting to pick up a little change carrying a passenger's bags, forget it. My wife and I lugged ours across the square, past the sidewalk cafes with their late dawdlers and to the hotel. If the crazy Americans wanted to visit their town, that was all right with the inhabitants, but let them handle their own problems, and luggage.

title: Barbara J. Smith Married To J.A. Spitzer in Darien
description: Barbara Joslyn Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joslyn A. Smith of New Cannan, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon to Joseph A. Spitzer, son of Dr. and Mrs. Maurice G. Spitzer of North Adams, Mass. The Rev. Charles C. Smith, minister of the Congregational Church of New Canaan, performed the ceremony at Meadowlands in Darien, Conn.

title: Nannette Ingrao Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph A. Ingrao of Bronxville, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nannette Ingrao, to William H. Conners, son of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene P. Conners of St. Paul. A wedding is planned for June.

title: CALENDAR
description: Today. Danbury Dealers Show. Amber Room. Stacey,Road. 10 A.M. to 5 P.M. Take exit 6 from 184. A new show.

title: Beauty
description: IT's not stretching a point to say there's 110 such thing as being unattractive any more. Modern medicine, particularly in the areas of plastic surgery and orthodontics, has made it possible, for almost everyone to look his or her best.

title: Topics
description: How can a boy confined to a bed or wheelchair fulfill the requirements for winning a Boy Scout badge for camping or swimming? The answer, of course, is that he can't. Despite this, in 1975, a small group of handicapped boys in Toms River, N.J., were certified for the Eagle Scout award, Scouting's ultimate rank. But then the national organization took back the awards.

title: Doubling of Speed Limit Is Cited As Texas Freight Train Derails
description: AMARILLO, Tex., Nov. 25 (AP)  A freight train that derailed and burst into flames near Canyon, Tex., was going twice the speed limit on a curve at the time of the wreck, Santa Fe Railroad officials said today.

title: Michigan Boy, 5, Shot to Death; His 8YearOld Cousin Confesses
description: SAGINAW, Mich., Nov. 25 (AP)  A 5yearold Saginaw boy was found shot to death yesterday afternoon and an 8yearold cousin said he did it, the police reported.

title: Owners of 30 Historic Bergen Homes
description: RIDGEWQ0D THE owners of 30 historic homes that are architecturally unique to North Jersey have banded together to help one another preserve their residences for posterity.

title: By Death Possessed
description: The horror! The horror! That is what Mr. Kurtz, the civilized man dying in the jungle, tells the narrator of Joseph Conrad's Heart of Darkness. Conrad's hero, dreading the truth about the human heart, avoids learning what the horror in the jungle had been. But that was in the 1900's, when news traveled slowly.

title: Undercover Task: A Family Survives
description: PATERSON STORIES about undercover police officers make exciting television fare in which the danger is simulated and the entire episode lasts about an hour. In contrast, the first major undercover assignment ever undertaken by the New Jersey state police lasted two and a half years, and the daily tension profoundly affected the lives not only of the officers involved, but their families as well.

title: Births
description: Mr. and Mrs. Stephen J. Dannls loyfully announce the birth of Seth Michael's and Adam Matthew's sister Ariel Meredith, born on November 1st, 1978.

title: Gaylen duB. Kemp And Jeffrey Baxter To Marry Dec. 30
description: Dr. and Mrs. Walter Wyckoff Kemp of Stamford, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Gaylen du Bois Kemp, to Jeffrey Clafiin Baxter, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick A. Baxter of Katonah, N.Y. A Dec. 30 wedding is planned.

title: Coastal Area Management vs. the EcoGoths
description: THE effective shelving of the key elements of the Coastal Area Management bill for Connecticut in this year's session of the General Assembly may not be total tragedy  but only if the legitimate concerns of some legislators are corrected and if the legislature that takes office in January passes the measure quickly, before the ecoGoths tear apart the shoreline in their effort to make the biggest buck while the situation is still relatively lax.

title: Around the Nation
description: MIAMI, Nov. 25 (AP)  A Coast Guard cutter searched off the Florida coast today for three of 12 crewmen tossed into the sea when their life raft capsized.

title: THEATER MAILBAG
description: To the Editor: Twentyfive years ago tomorrow Eugene O'Neill died in Boston hotel room. A few days earlier he muttered to his wife, Carlotta: Born in a hotel room  and God damn it  died in a hotel room. The statement captures his tone of voice, reveals the pressure of despair behind that voice, and reminds us of the agony of his major characters, in all of whom he lived.

title: Algiers Is Calm Awaiting Word Of Boumediene
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 25  A striking surface mood of calm and normality hangs over Algiers as its citizens, only thinly informed, wait out the long agony of President Houari Boumediene, who has been in a coma for a week suffering from a rare blood disease.

title: Egypt to Urge Carter To Revive Peace Talk; Sadat Meets Senators
description: CAIRO, Nov. 26 (AP)  Egypt will ask President Carter to seek a resumption of the Middle East peace talks, Prime Minister Mustafa Khalil said today.

title: Yeiterday s Weather al 1 P M National Oceanic and Annosphenc AdmonislratiOn/UP1
description: Broken stratocumulus clouds are present from the lake region through most of Northeast and are due to cold, unstable air passing over hilly terrain. Multilayered clouds cover much of the Southern Plains States as a storm system develops over the Texas Panhandle. Patchy cirroform clouds and fair weather stretch along the Pacific Coast.

At 24, Jose Pepe Lopez surely one of the youngest restaurant owners in New Jersey, just as his establishment is one of the newest additions to the SpanishPortuguese enclave within Newark's Ironbound District.

She will make her Broadway debut at the Shubert Theater for a onenightonly performance. The special concert is produced by Joseph Papp, who ventured into a New Jazz Series this year at the Public Theater.

description: A chart accompanying the article, Whither the Small Depositor? Nov. 19, detailed the market share of four New York banks in the consumer checking account business. It was in error. The correct chart appears below:

title: Busing Row in Los Angeles Symbolizes a Wider Dispute
description: Do minority students learn better in desegregated schools? What happens to them after they leave school? Do whites leave neighborhoods after desegregation begins? What happens when some school systems, like Los Angeles last week, consider uniting city and suburb in a single integregation plan?

description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 25  The wave of Vietnamese refugees now inundating the east coast of Malaysia and southernmost Thailand contains a majority of ethnic Chinese and they are fleeing in most cases with the knowledge of Vietnam's authorities.

title: FourStringed FirstGraders
description: Traditionally, public schools do not offer their students instrumental study until the fourth grade. But in the Bedford Central School District some years ago we were really desperate about our string situation, recalls Franklyn Saslow, the district's music coordinator, and felt we had to build up from the bottom.

title: Robinson Crusoe Returns
description: MARTINSVILLE. Va., Nov. 25 (UPI)  After a family quarrel, 62yearold Haden Andrews took to the woods and survived two severe winters in a cardboard box. This Thanksgiving he was back in society, giving thanks that he was still alive. Last January, his hideaway was discovered by two local men, and they coaxed him out of his Robinson Crusoe existence. He now lives in a boarding house and holds down a fulltime job as a custodian at a local furniture plant.

title: NEW PEKING POSTERS ASK FOR DEMOCRACY AND PRAISE THE U.S.
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 25  The wallposter campaign in Peking moved today from criticism of Mao Tsetung to demands for democracy, as an acerbic broadside compared China unfavorably with the United States. Another poster challenged the way Hua Kuofeng was appointed Prime Minister in 1976.

title: Dr. Nancy Epstein Is Bride
description: Dr. Nancy Epstein, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Epstein of Old Westbury, L.1., was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Don Hood, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Hood of North Merrick, L.I. Judge MarieLouise Nickerson of the District Court in Mineola, L.I., performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents. The couple have previously been married and divorced. The bride is a neurosurgical resident at New York University, and her husband is a professor of psychology at Columbia University.

title: GARDENING
description: THE current crop of campaigns to reduce government expenditures and thereby cut property taxes would seem to be beneficial to most serious gardeners, since they are propertytax payers. However, they may suffer more than benefit from the austerity movement.

description: Your headline, Fairfield County House Prices Decline, [Nov. 12] would have made more sense had it read House Prices Seek Reasonable Levels.

title: The Nation
description: President Carter's younger brother answered a $300,000 question last week, but at least as interesting was the White House comment. You can't depend on Billy as a good source in a case like this, Jody Powell, the President's press secretary, said.

title: See Jack (Kemp) run.
description: Now don't get him wrong. Congressman Jack Kemp of Buffalo, sponsor of the controversial and, in some circles, famous KempRoth tax cut bill, says he can barely save a dime on his $57,500 Congressional salary. I personally haven't been able to put much away in eight years. Says his pert wife Joanne: We don't really live very high. We don't go out for dinner. I don't know how people are making it.

title: Strict A.H.S.A Rules Control Drug Abuse
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 25  About two decades ago, horseshow officials and exhibitors began to worry about the proliferation of drugs at equestrian events.

title: Other Regional Events
description: After a police dog named Brandy sniffed out 13 sticks of dynamite hidden in a lunch box in a West Side garage, F.B.I. agents and New York City detectives last week arrested three Serbians, a priest, the operator of the garage and a machinist. They were charged with conspiring, along with two men named in an Illinois Federal court complaint, to bomb the Yugoslav consulate in Chicago. Authorities said their evidence included recorded conversations about bomb attacks on Yugoslav diplomatic missions and residences. A defense lawyer described the three as staunch antiCommunists. By most accounts, the arrests marked one of the first such actions in this country directed agaist Serbian opponents of Yugoslavia's Communist government.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: IF an air of heightened excitement pervades the premises of Harper and Row this Tuesday, there is a reason. For on that day the paperback rights to the still unpublished Linda Goodman's Love Signs will go on the auction block. So? What's so Frith-ing about the paperback rights to a popular book on astrology? Well, it needs no stellar configuration to answer that one. Consider the evidence.

title: How to Keep Heating Costs Down as the Bills Go Up
description: THE coming of cold weather marks the unwelcome arrival of steadily increasing fuel bills once more. Although there is not much the individual homeowner can do about the increasing cost of oil, as and electricity. there are a number of steps that can be taken to reduce the amount of heating fuel consumed (heating accounts for the largest percentage of the annual energy requirements of most homes in this area).

title: A Horse Fancier Retains Zeal at 93
description: GLADSTONE IN THE early years of this century, when the horse was still king and fancy carriages were thrones of the wealthy, Ted Williams was a top courtier at many an American palace.

title: Unrest in Nearby Iran Frightening Saudi Arabians
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia  The strikes and violent demonstrations that have shaken the regime of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahievi in nearby Iran are frighten. ing this kingdom where rapid economic progress has also come into conflict with conservative religious traditions.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  Some very odd things have been happening recently in the conduct of relations between nations. For one thing, there has been a decline in manners. For another, a confusion of responsibility and authority. Some examples:

title: It's All in My Imagination
description: TO look at the paintings of Frank Nicolet is to see the work of two artists, one sighted, the other blind. The 91yearold painter lost his vision more than a decade ago, yet has continued to pursue his art, drawing from an inward vision of remembered beauty.

title: Times Opens 67th Yearly Drive For New York's Neediest Cases
description: The 67th annual appeal for The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund will open next Sunday. The appeal traditionally begins on the third Sunday before Christmas.

title: ANEW BATTLE FOR GUERNICA
description: Several years before his death in 1973, Pablo Picasso was ruminating over the fate of what some experts consider his greatest work, Guernica, the vast mural commissioned in 1936 by the embattled Second Republic at the beginning of the Spanish Civil War. The mural was finally painted in a frenzy of creativity in 1937 after Hitler's bombers, in support of Generalissimo Francisco Franco's advancing armies, razed the historic Basque village of Guernica.

title: Shaping Up for Next Spring
description: The to designers in Milan, Paris and New York have shown their spring 1979 collections  the clothes that will be in stores starting in January  and it is clear that this fall's big switch from loose and layered to broadshouldered and slimhipped is just a beginning. Right around the corner are clothes that emphatically point up a woman's body and natural curves. Shoulders are still emphasized, but so are breasts, waists, hips and legs. Clothes are clinging closer; skirts are getting skimpier and shorter; pants are even tighter and worn with high heels, and waistlines are being hugged in with belts or with darts and seaming. Nothing a woman wears has been left untouched by the new fashion wavefrom dippy, tipped hats to pretty, obvious jewelry, to delicate, saucy shoes. Even the colors for next spring are sunnier, and combined in unusual ways. The words that come to mind to describe these new clothes are flirtatious, feminine and sexy. And lighthearted, too, for in many of the new designs there is definitely a dash of humor, a sense that these are clothes not to be taken deadly seriously. Of course, as always, the range of interpretation of this new figureemphasizing silhouette spans the spectrum, going anywhere from the spirited inventive designs of Perry Ellis, to the subtle, Sybaritic designs of Calvin Klein or Giorgio Armani, to the almost outrageous inventions of Claude Montana or Karl Lagerfeld. But, for the woman who is interested in fashion, nothing is going to look deader or limper next spring than last spring's voluminous figNo doubt there will be some carping that these new clothes make women look like sex objects. While it is true that men are going to have a delightful time observing women in their new curvy clothes, it is also true that women who love to look like women are going to have a marvelous time wearing them.

title: GUYANA TOLL IS RAISED TO AT LEAST 900 BY U.S., WITH 260 CHILDREN AMONG VICTIMS AT COLONY
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 25The number of bodies at the People's Temple commune climbed to more than 900 today, United States officials reported, and there were indications that the toll might go still higher.

title: THE DAZZLE OF THE DIAGHILEV ERA
description: No dance company left as remarkable a legacy as did the Ballets Russes of Serge Diaghilev. Certainly in the United States ballet would not be what it is today had it not been for the genius of that monocled impresario from Russia, for some of the great dancers and choreographers in his companyMichel Fokine, George Balanchine, Adolf BoIm later settled here, developing new generations of dancers and often new approaches to dance. From Diaghilev I learned to be an artist, declared Balanchine, who, as director of the New York City Ballet, has himself revolutionized ballet.

title: Lobbyists for Equal Rights Amendment Focus on 4 States
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla.  On the wall State Senator Vernon C. Holloway's of. Tice is a sign that reads: Do something. Lead, follow or get out of the way.

title: Sadat to Tell Carter Egypt's Stand on Peace Talks
description: CAIRO, Nov. 26  President Anwar elSadat said today that he would send President Carter a formal explanation on Tuesday of Egypt's position on its stalled peace negotiations with Israel.

title: Norway's 40% Purchase Of Volvo Appears Close
description: STOCKHOLM  Several months behind schedule, Volvo and the Norwegian Government appear to be close to a final agreement on Norway's purchase of 40 percent of the Swedish auto maker.

title: HackHack HaaaackH ackkkkkk
description: WALLINGFORD, Conn.Recently I was asked to write a history of smoking. How. could I do such a thing? Merely writing about this most foul and therefore mysterious of all human activities confers on it a status I would rather deny.

title: For Films Word of Mouth Means Success
description: LoS ANUELFS IN Wesivirotycl en a recent Friday night, lines snaked around 3 of the 17 theaters like crepepaper streamers. Magic, Midnight Express and Lord of the Rings were  at least for the moment  boxoffice winners.

title: ESSAY Here's to Media Wars
description: WASHINGTON  When the TimeLife empire (sales: $1.2 billion) dedares war on the Washington PolNewsweek empire (sales: $436 million), that's news.

title: The Renaissance Band Of New York Performs
description: THE eight centuries or so of music written before the Baroque age is a closed book to most concertgoers, so the New York Renaissance Band could perhaps be forgiven for the sweepingly generalized nature of its program Saturday nipht in Alice Tully Hall.

title: Peking Power Fight: Discontent Disclosed
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 26 Whatever the outcome of the current power struggle in Peking, the sudden outburst of wall posters in the Chinese capital over the last week has revealed the existence of deep popular resentment against the widespread political persecutions of the last decade and a strong desire for democracy in China.

title: Buffalo Gets 27 In 4th Period
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y., Nov. 26 It all fell apart today for the Giants. A 27point Buffalo blitz in the final quarter gave the lowly Bills a 4117 victory after the Giants new offense had opened a 177 lead late in the third quarter with Joe Pisarcik passing for more than 200 yards.

title: 1% Prime Hurts Bond Prices
description: Fixed income securities dropped sharply late last week in the wake of news that major banks had raised their prime rates to 11 percent, the highest since October 1974. The relatively few traders and analysts wno were at work Friday predicted that the downward trend in prices would must likely continue this week.

title: The Media and the Goats
description: Western diplomats are congratulating themselves on having turned a dangerous international declaration on the obligations of the press into an incomprehensible hodgepodge of slogans and prescriptions. The great compromise declaration of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization now stands adopted, a triumph of obfuscation. If it is no longer a clear and present threat to news agencies, remains in language and spirit an affront to the very idea of communication. The world deserves to know that the Americans who accepted it as the least offensive document they could write with 145 other nations were not speaking for the free press of the United States.

title: L.I..R.R. Links Main Problems To Fund Lack
description: During the morning rush hour, when the Long Island Rail Road is straining to move 55,000 people into Manhattan's Penn Station, a breakdown of only one train between Jamaica and New York can cause serious delays for all the trains hehinci it.

title: Machine Tool Orders Up 73%
description: Itle Ievel 01 Orders for Macnmc tools, considered an important economic indicator, soared 73 percent last month to a record $414 million from $240 million in October 1977, according to the figures releUsed yesterday by the National Machine Tool Builders Association. The trade group's statistics also showed that last month's orders were 24 percent above the September 1978 level.

title: Runaway Train Derails After Chase of 35 Miles
description: PURCELL, Okla., Nov. 26 (AP) runaway Santa Fe locomotive roared 35 miles through three cities today as the police raced to block railroad crossings and tried to board the train, the highway patrol said.

title: Connors Winner Of Final in Japan
description: TOKYO, Nov. 26 (AP)  1: tnmy Connors beat Hie Nastase, 62, 64, today and captured the men's singles title in a $12.5,000 tennis tournament.

title: Boycotts Set in 3 Latin Countries
description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 26  The interAmerican tradeunion organization declared a shipping boycott today against Chile, Nicaragua and Cuba in retaliation for what members called repression of labor rights in those countries.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Prelude for Recorder. Lute and Viola da Gamha, Hotteterre; PipperrnintGet, Severac; Fourth Concert in 13 flat, Rarneau; Sonata in G, Beethoven; Sinfonia in D, Portugal; Guitar Sonata in D, Albeniz.

title: On Guitar: forma Kaukonen Goes It Alone in Blues Program
description: JORMA KAUKONEN's reach exceeded his grasp in his performance at the Palladium on Saturday night. Mr. Kaukonen, formerly lead guitarist with the Jefferson Airplane, and more recently the front man for Hot Tuna, had elected to go it alone, first in a solo acoustic set and then in an amplified performance accompanied only by his own electric guitar and a drummer. It was not a wise choice, but perhaps it was an inevitable one.

title: Show Pays Tribute To Dorothy Fields
description: CAN you read the song titles I Can't Give You Anything But Love and On the Sunny Side of the Street without singing them and most of the words that follow? Certainly this is a sign of a song's memorability and of a lyricist's musicality. Dorothy Fields, who wrote the lyrics for those two songs  and for some 400 others  during her 46year career as lyricist and librettist, was not as famous as the songs that she created.

title: Foreign Visitors to U.S. Up 7% Over Six Months
description: WASNINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP)  Lower air fares and a cheaper dollar are bringing record numbers of tourists to the United States this year, the United States Travel Service says.

title: Essex Chief, at 26, Holds New Power
description: NEWARK, Nov. 24A makeshift sign pasted on the door of Room 504 in the Hall of Records here proclaims it to be the office of Peter Shapiro, the Essex County Executive. inside, a young man in shirtsleeves discusses with equally young aides the task of runnine New Jersey's lareest county.

title: Ballet Dancer On a Ball Field
description: I KEEP watching for some really new departure on a pro football field. Say a referee were to intercept a pass. There he goes, streaking downfield; no one is sure whether to tackle him; now we know there is something funny about the officiating in the meantime I enjoy watching Lynn Swann, who will be on television for the Pittsburgh Steelers against the San Francisco 49ers tonight, dance with the ball.

title: Chess:
description: James Tarjan, a Los Angeles grandmaster, was the biggest point gainer for the United States team in the World Chess Olympiad in Buenos Aires. Playing Board 5, Tarjan won the gold medal for the best individual result with score of 9,1

title: Begin Is Said to Favor Not Resuming Peace Talks Now
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 26  Prime Minister Menachem Begin was reported to have told the Israeli Cabinet today that he favors not sending Israel's chief negotiators back to the EgyptianIsraeli peace talks in Washington for the time being.

description: Pat Williams, the general manager of the Philadelphia 76ers, was there: so was Dick McGuire, the Knicks chief scout. They were at St. John's Joe Lapchick Memorial tournament Saturday night because the college basketball season was under way. Other pro scouts were scattered all over the country, scrutinizing this year's crop of collegiate players.

title: UkrainianAmericans Rally Near Soviet U.N. Mission
description: With national banners and protest signs aloft, 2,000 shouting and singing UkrainianAmericans and their supporters staged a protest yesterday near the Soviet Mission on East 67th Street to demand the decolonization of the Soviet Russian Empire.

title: Immigration Chief Says Efforts Are Hampered by Lack of Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (UPI)  The controversial chief of the Immigration and Naturalization Service said today that the Administration's antiinflation program had hampered his agency's drive to stem the flow of illegal aliens.

title: Notes on People
description: One could not properly can it a reunion, but there certainly were old times to be discussed when Richard M. Nixon met for 90 minutes in Paris yesterday with Gen. Alexander M. Haig, supreme commander of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. As White House chief of staff Generai mug piayed a pivotal role in persuading the former President to resign four years ago. We did some reminiscing and exKhalid Returning Home.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: What A Summer, the 5yearold daughter of What Luck, was beaten in the $54,000 Sport Page Handicap by Ardboe Stable's Topsider at Aqueduct yesterday after a nosetonose duel down the stretch. Harbor View's Affiliate was third in the sixfurlong event.

title: Andrew Wilson Tarkington, 67; Was ExHead of Continental Oil
description: Andrew Wilson Tarkington, the former president and chief executive officer of the Continental Oil Company, died Friday in Austin, Tex. He was 67 years old.

title: New Musical to Feature Songs of Harry Warren
description: A new musical, Lullaby of Broadway, based on the songs of Harry Warren, is planned to open in New York next spring, and will include, in addition to the title song, many of Mr. Warren's other hits.

title: Chirac Injures a Leg in Crash
description: Prance, Nov. a (Reuters)ormer Prime Minister Jacques Chirac of France suffered leg injuries in a car rash early today near this town in southwest France, the police said. According to first reports, Mr. Chirac, who is Mayor Nils, was taken to a hospital with 1,w;pected broken leg.

title: Arafat Gives His Terms For Recognition of Israel
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 26 (AP)  An American Congressman reported today that Yasir Arafat, leader of the Palesjine Liberation Organization, was willing to renounce violence and grant de facto recognition to Israel if an independent Palestinian state was established.

title: Sweeping RighttoLife Goals Set As Movement Gains New Power
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 21  The national righttolife movement, which emerged from the elections this year as potent, controversial force in American politics, has set an ambitious agenda for 1980 and beyond.

title: TwoDay Search Fails to Locate 2 L.I. Men Missing off Montauk
description: By sunset yesterday, a twoday andsea search by the Coast Guard had found no trace of two fishermen and t heir i boat reported missing off Montauk, L.I., since Fridav evening. Three heliconters and two planes, flying 13 missions, joined a Coast Guard vessel in the search for the men, William Goldstein, 10 years old, and Mike Garling Jr.. 19. both residents of Brookhaven, L.I.

title: Gaudiest Game In 50 Years
description: NOTRE Dame and Southern California have met at football 50 times, and now they might as well knock it off. No use trying. If they played another 50 years, they could not match the gaudy theatrics of Saturday's fourth quarter.

title: Piano: Perahia Presents A Concert at Tully Hall
description: THE world is filled with talented pianists who for one reason or another do not know how to give recitals that seize the imagination and hold it. Murray Perahia is anotner anti rarer sort of artist The 31yearold New Yorker, now resident of London, has for years been able to create the mood of anticipation and suppressed excitement that sets audiences on the edge of their seats and in recent years he has been emerging as a pianist of unusual distinction and individuality.

title: Peking and Hong Kong Setting Up Joint Ventures
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 26  In one of the sharpest departures yet from orthodox Communist policy, China has arranged with a number of Chinese businessmen in Hong Kong to set up.what amount to jointventure factories inside China, using foreign technology and equipment but Chinese labor.

title: Robinson Engineers Victory
description: MIAMI, Nov. 26  The Jets completed a twogame sweep of the Miami Dolphins today, their first since the 1969 season, with a 2413 victory before a crowd of 49,255 in the Orange Bowl.

title: 7th Avenue Tames the Leather Look
description: Leather moves in and nut of fashion with some regularity. In the winter, things like sheepskin coats appear; suede jackets turn up periodically in the sorin2 and tall. There are also specialinterest leathers, such as the black jackets decorated with nailheads affected by the British rockers in the 1960's and by Hell's Angels and other motorcycle gangs in this country.

title: Levitt's Aide Taught City Fiscal Discipline
description: Perhaps the man most responsible for helping to bring a sense of fiscal discipline to Yonkers's chaotic finances in the last three years was John J. Feeney, a former deputy state comptroller.

description: When officials in Newark learned that the city had lost $10 million in expected Federal aid for the coming year, they began making plans to lay off 450 city employees on Jan. I, even though they will have enough money in budget surplus to make up most of the Shortfall.

title: A TIP at Last
description: When President Carter announced his new antiinflation strategy last month, its most innovative idea was buried near the end of his speech, almost as an afterthought. That was an unfortunate way to introduce the nation to its first attempt at a Taxbased Income Policy  TIP. The policy is not as trivial as it was made to sound. Without wide acceptance of TIP by the nation's work force, the President's wageprice guideposts would be in jeopardy.

title: Advertising
description: To help it reach its goal of S9 billion in gross revenues from residential longdistance phone calls next year, the mighty Bell System will prime the pump with $30 million worth of advertising, twothirds of which will go into network television. And on top of that will be $30 million or more in advertising running locally and sponsored by the 23 operating companies that make up the system.

title: Seven Top Candidates for the Heisman Trophy
description: VOTING for the 44th Heisman Trophy has been completed, and tomorrow morning at the Downtown Athletic Club in New York one of the nearly 35,000 young men who play football at a fouryear college will be named the winner of that award, as the outstanding college football player of the United States fnr 1978.

title: How New York Almost Lost the Amex
description: Shortly after 10 A.M. on Nov. 2, Governor Carey, Mayor Koch and a dozen of New York's senior business leaders gathered in the 13thfloor board room of the American Stock Exchange, at 86 Trinity Place, for a short ceremony and a long sigh of relief.

title: Newark Is Said to Face Tax Rises and Layoffs
description: Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson of Newark said yesterday that residents faced higher 1979 property taxes and the layoffs of 450 municipal workers and as many as 1,000 teachers because of the loss of $10.5 million in expected Federal money.

title: New Orleans Klan Rallies Early, Missing Irate Blacks
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 26  The Ku Klux Klan marched today through the French Quarter and rallied around a controversial monument to white supremacy, without encountering blacks who had planned to protest their parade.

title: Jones and 3 in Family Are to Be Buried at Sea
description: RICHMOND, Ind., Nov. 26 The remains of the Rev. Jim Jones, his wife and at least two of their children will be buried at sea after cremation at Dover, Del., in accordance with the wishes of his wife's family.

title: Holiday Sales Gain Expected
description: Shoppers throughout the nation thronged stores over the weekend as the Christmas buying season got under way. Amid the bustle and bells, however, there was an aura of concern among merchants about just how good retail sales would be in a period of continuing inflation, considerable talk of recession and increased regional unemployment.

title: Laura Ellen Levine Wed To Dr. Richard M. Ketai
description: Laura Ellen Levine, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Julian Levine of Stamford, coml., was married yesterday to Dr. Richard Mark Ketai, son of Dr. and Mrs. Norbert Ketai of Southfield. Mirh The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Stephen Pearce at Temple Sinai in Stamford.

title: A Second Guyana Cult Is Focus of Dispute
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 26When discussions at last turn away from what will probably enter history simply as Jonestown, increasingly they tend to focus on a group of black converts to Judaism that is led by a former civil rights activist and fugitive from justice who calls himself Rabbi Edward Emmanuel Washington. though he was born David Hill in Nashville, Ark., nearly 50 years ago.

title: 9 New Yorkers Learn Nothing of Kin in Sect
description: DOVER AIR FORCE BASE. Del,, Nov. 26 (UPI)  Nine members of family that had driven here from New York were unable to find out from the Government whether six relatives had died at the People's Temple commune, in Guyana. The nine returned home today.

title: Arrest of 15 on West Bank Raises Crackdown Issue
description: RAMALLAH, IsraelOccupied West Bank, Nov. 26  The recent arrest or detention of 15 West Bank residents opposed to the Camp David accords has raised the question of whether the Israeli military administration is cracking down on Palestinian Arabs opposed to a transitional civilautonomy plan for the West Bank and Gaza.

title: Rangers Rout Capitals
description: In the middle of last night's (14 hockey triumph by the Rangers over the Washington Capitals the scores began coming so fast it seemed like basketball game. New York was leading, 31, after one period at Madison Square Garden when the switch came.

title: L. P. WEICKER DIES; EXSQUIBB DIRECTOR
description: Lowell Palmer Weicker Sr. former president of E. R. Squibb & Sons and 13igelowSanford. died Saturday at his residence in the Stanhope Hotel, at Fifth Avenue and 81st Steeet in Manhattan, following a long illness. Mr. Weicker, the father of Lowell P. Welcher 1r., Republican United States Senator from Connecticut, was 75 years old.

title: Dividends
description: Mass Mutual M&F

title: 1100 B.C. Village Reported
description: LEWISTON, Idaho, Nov. 26 (AP) Yhe remains of an Indian village that Boise State University scientists have found six miles from here could be one of the oldest in the Northwest, according to a university researcher, Y. Keueth Amee.

title: Martin Catherwood, State Commissioner And a Labor Arbiter
description: Martin Paul Catherwood, who served from 1958 to 1971 as the New York State Industrial Commissioner, died Thankgiving Day at his home in Ithaca, N.Y. He was 74 years old.

title: L.I.R.R.'s New Head Says He can Be Moving Force
description: The Long Island Rail Road, which has had three presidents in the last three years and has been the source of commuters complaints and comedians jokes for decades, is struggling again to meet its timetables and provide good service.

title: News Summary
description: The final count of the dead found in the People's Temple commune in Guyana is 909, according to American officials. The final shipment of 183 bodies were sent home to the United States, while the 200 members of the recovery crew started back to their military bases in the Panama Canal Zone and the United States. The survivors of the mass suicide and killings are being held by Guyana pending a criminal investigation. [Page Al, Column 6.]

title: 70 Survivors From Guyana Due in U.S. Tomorrow
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., Nov. 26  The survivors of the Guyana mass suicide and killings are expected to arrive.in Charleston Tuesday and will promptly undergo interviews by the Federal Bureau of Investigation about the possibility of involvement in the assassination of Representative Leo J. Ryan.

title: The New York Times /D. Gorton
description: The West Side Madrigalists filled the halls of Brooklyn's Unitaritan Church of Monroe Place to songs of Christmas from ages past. They were, from left, Edgar Dittemore, Darrell Lauer, John Broome, Priscilla Magdano and Judith Otten.

title: The Bern String Quartet Plays a Varied Program
description: TWO seasons ago the Bern String Quartet played some 20thcentury music in New York and made a splendid impression scratching its way through Heinz Holliger's frantic String Quartet.

title: The City
description: New York State's Health Department has revoked the license of Bronx funeral director and fined or reprimanded seven others in the state. Health Commissioner Robe P. Whalen said $8,250 in fines had been levied.

title: A Boxer's Unlikely Road Leads Him to a Title
description: ELEVEN kids, all crowded into three rooms, the boys on bunk beds on one side, the girls on the other. The tough, vibrant mother, her hair bleached copper, her voice a cymbal. The father. who lost a lea for PARIS.

title: Falcons Stay in Contention
description: Thanks to their second miracle finish in three weeks  both at the expense of the New Orleans Saints  the Atlanta Falcons remain in contention for the National Conference's Western Division championship in the National Football League.

title: Alaskans Rally in Campaign for Private Land Ownership
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 24  Nearly 20 years after Alaska won statehood, there is a strong feeling among many of its residents that it is still being treated like Federal fiefdom.

title: FILM SAID TO SHOW OSWALD HAD HELP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  A sevensecond film was shown to a crowded room of journalists and assassination buffs here today, purporting to show the presence of more than one person in the windows of the sixth floor of the Texas School Book Depository building in Dallas minutes before President John F. Kennedy was killed by shots fired from the vicinity of the.

title: TEN IS SAID TO ASK REVERSAL OF RULING PURGING HIM IN 76
description: TOKYO, Nov. 26  Teng Hsiaoping, Deputy Prime Minister of China, told visiting Japanese politician today in Peking that the time had come to correct action taken by the Chinese Politburo after the Tien An Men Square incident of April 1976, according to Japanese press reports from Peking. Mr. Teng had been purged in that action.

title: Mario Baeza Weds Wanda C. Williams
