description: ABELSONIda Beloved wife of the late Irving, devoted mother of Rosalind Goldsmith and David, loving grandmother and adored greatgrandmother. Services Wed. 12 Noon Boulevard Park West, 1450 Broadway, Hewlett, LI.

title: Syrian Chief to Visit Hungary
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 27 (AP) Syria's President, Hafez alAssad, is re ported to be planning a trip to Hungary and possibly the Soviet Union this week to discuss differences with Moscow about weapons supplies.

title: G.M. Avoids Strike
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27 (AP)  A strike. threatened by 5,000 workers at a Cadillac body plant, was averted today. The General Motors Corporation and a United Automobile Workers local reached agreement about 20 minutes before the strike deadline. The dispute involved changes in assembly line speeds as a result of new body styles on some 1979 Cadillacs.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Court Rule Gives NewCar Buyers Added Protection
description: Purchasers of new automobiles received fresh protection yesterday against lastminute increases in the price or cuts in tradein allowance as a result of a decision by the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn.

title: N.F.L. 's Playoff Jigsaw: 17 Remain Contenders
description: Because 17 of the 28 teams continue as plausible contenders for the 10 positions, the playoff situation in the National Football League defies conclusive analysis with three weeks to go in the regular season.

title: New York Team Captures U.S. Table Tennis Title
description: A team New Yorkers won the United States open table tennis team title at Detroit over the weekend, competing against more than 80 other teams. The winning team members included David Philip of Brooklyn, Roger Sverdlik of Rockville Centre, L.I., and Tim Scott and Eric Boggan, both of Merrick, L.I.

title: Jazz: The Songs of Betty Carter
description: BETTY CARTER may justifiably be called, as Joseph Papp said in introducing her at her concert on Sunday evening at the Shubert Theater, the greatest jazz singer in the world.

title: RAY'S BROTHERS TIED TO A POSSIBLE PLOT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP)  The House Select Committee on Assassinations indicated yesterday that it has found evidence showing that James Earl Ray's two brothers may have been involved in the murder of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Bridge:
description: DENVER, Nov. 17  An overwhelming victory for an Aces team ended 10 days of play at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals here last night.

title: U.S. REPORTED SET TO BORROW MARKS WORTH $1.25 BILLION
description: PARIS, Nov. 27  The United States Treasury will borrow 2.5 billion to 3 billion West German marks, worth $1.25 billion to $1.5 billion, in the West German capital market next month as part of President Carter's latest plan to defend the dollar, an authoritative monetary source disclosed tonight.

title: Kennedy Proposes a Black Man And a Jewish Woman as Judges
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27  Senator Edward M. Kennedy recommended today that a black man and a Jewish woman be nominated as United States District Court judges here.

title: Recouping Democracy in Bolivia?
description: After seven military coups since 1964, Bolivians can at least count on variety from their insurgent generals. Some have taken power in the name of the left, others of the right, and still others in the name of nationalism. Last week's coup, however, may hold out the hope of something more lasting. Its authors have announced they are taking charge temporarily with the purpose of creating the Bolivia that was dreamt of by generations of Bolivians. That is as uninformative as it is unobjectionable; still, the new coup appears to have been bloodless and it promises to hasten, rather than delay, democratic elections.

title: Obituary 2 -- No Title
description: PATRICK J. KNICKERBOCKER

title: Walton Drives Road To Total Recovery
description: Bill Walton drove 132 miles from his home in San Diego to the Los Angeles Rams football training camp in Long Beach, Calif., yesterday. There, the controversial Portland Trail Blazer center, worked out under the guidance of Bill Tuthill, the Rams trainer, as part of the rehabilitation program for the left foot he injured in a basketball game last Feb. 28 against the Philadelphia 76ers. He makes the 264mile round trip every day.

title: Egypt Reportedly Offering Concessions
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 27 (AP)An Israeli report from Cairo indicated today that Egypt is offering two concessions in exchange for acceptance by Israel of a timetable for Palestinian selfrule in the Gaza Strip and the West Bank.

title: Corporations Report Their Quarterly Sales and Earnings Results
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, ( A ) the American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Topics Where Credit Is Due
description: The jokes have started to fly about the new scheme of the Republican National Committee and Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company. The bank will offer specially designated Visa credit cards to 600,000 New York Republicans. For every member who accepts, the bank gets a customer with estimable credit standing  and the party gets $2.50. In other words, says one wiseacre, You scratch my bank and... Deficit financing, exclaims a Democratic wit; so much for the Republicans being the payasyougo party. Others gibe about a plastic party and cardcarrying Republicans.

title: Stunned Crowd Gathers Near Scene of 2 Slayings
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 27  The day was clear and fresh, with just a touch of fall in the air. In the first mo ments after 11 A.M. here yesterday, there were mostly pigeons and sea mills in attendance outside City Hall.

title: Science Watch
description: A powerful growthstimulating substance has been discovered in mother's milk. According to a report in the current issue of the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, the substance is present in highest concentration immediately after a woman gives birth and remains in the milk for at least six months after delivery.

title: Talkingg Businessl With
description: Some Wall Street figures dispute the expectation ?? G. William Miller, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, that there will not he a return to selective credit controls. They feel that certain kinds of loans regarded as unproductive and inflationary  particularly loans to finance takeovers  may soon be restricted.

title: State's Codes Cited
description: A spokesman for New York State's Division of Housing and Community Renewal said yesterday that the state had buildingconstruction and fireprevention codes covering hotels but that it was up to local governments to decide whether to adopt and enforce them.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: ??Morgam S?? th?? ??Gold?? ?? ??osing time in ?? banking ??terday, the latter named 11 ?? ??tners, bringing to 61 the ?? ??ple entitled to ?? of the ?? ?? Sachs corporate pie.

title: Michaels Still Mum on Playoff Chances
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 27  Neither rain nor snow nor flush of victory could stay the New York Jets from completing three laps around their training field today at Hofstra University.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Family Fighting Red Tape to Get The Body of Slain Security Guard
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)  The family of a security guard shot to death two weeks ago is battling red tape to have him buried, but officials say that that cannot be done without the approval of the victim's wife, who is charged in the shooting.

title: Rockefeller Opens a 'small Business
description: Without fanfare or flourish, Manhattan's newest mailorder catalogue store opened yesterday at 48 East 57th Street, and its proprietor, former Vice President Nelson A. Rockefeller, made a brief appearance to sec how things were going.

title: Lady Rothemere: It's Been Jolly Hard, but I'd Do It All Again
description: A couple of years ago, a bouncy bundle from Britain landed on the tarmac of the New World. Almost before anyone could spell Patricia Harmsworth, she unveiled a Fifth Avenue apartment that looked like an English country house, a wardrobe that made the sophisticated quiver and a personality that effervesced at the best parties all over the Upper East Side. One could say that she bubbled, but better not, because her nickname is Bubbles, and she hates it.

title: Pennsylvania Passes Law To Aid Horse Breeders
description: Gov. Milton J. Shapp signed into law yesterday legislation intended to benefit Pennsylvania's thoroughbred breeding industry.

title: Met Gets First Tut Pieces
description: A portion of the ancient treasures taken from King Tutankhamen's tomb was delivered last night, amid great secrecy, to the Metropolitan Museum, where 1.3 million visitors are expected to see them when they go on display from Dec. 20 through April 15.

title: Judy Garland Auction Fetches $250,000
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Nov. 28 Judy Garland's 7iron golf club sold for $150, her reading glasses for $300 and her 1953 MercedesBenz for $60,000 in a grueling, oneday auction yesterday in the Grand Ballroom of the Beverly Wilshire Hotel.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Cavaliers 112, Hawks 98
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Nov. 28 (AP) Campy Russell scored 14 of his gamehigh 26 points in the fourth quarter and led the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 11298 victory over the Atlanta Hawks tonight in a foulmarred game.

title: The End of Sparky's Affair
description: In nine seasons under the management of Sparky Anderson, the Cincinnati Reds won five championships in the National League West, four National League pennants and two World Series, ran second three times and finished off the board once.

title: Parent Church Is Chagrined By Evolution of Jones's Cult
description: Although under scrutiny by his denomination since 1979, the Rev. Jim Jones was a minister in good standing at the time of his death, and his closest survivor will be eligible for a church pension, according to officials of the Christian Church (Disciples of Christ).

title: Critic's Notebook: Ballet As a Cuban Showcase
description: EVEN the dance critics are asked by fans for autographs in Havana. Or so they were if they were Americans attending the recent sixth International Ballet Festival organized by Alicia Alonso, the prima ballerina and cofounder of the National Ballet of Cuba.

title: Kheel to Aid in Postal Grievances
description: Theodore W. Kheel, the lawyer and tabor mediator, agreed yesterday to help resolve snagged grievance procedures involving postal workers who were discharged for striking illegally last July.

title: LongTerm Bell Bonds Yield 9.16%
description: A Bell System bond issue was priced yesterday to give investors a yield of 9.16 percent, the highest for a longterm tripleA telephone company bond issue in three years, but it failed to attract much interest from investors. The results of this corporate financiong seemed to indicate that longterm bond yields are headed higher.

title: Peking Throng of 10,000 Cheers Speakers Demanding Democracy
description: PEKING, Nov. 28 (Reuters)  About 10,000 Chinese gathered in downtown Peking tonight to listen to speakers near the display of wall posters. The crowd then moved to Tien An Men Square and gathered round the Martyrs' Monument, a war memorial.

title: Airline Traffic Rose in Month
description: Domestic and international airline traffic in October increased 16.7 percent over the same month last year, the Air Transport Association reported yesterday. For the first 10 months of 1978, scheduled airline traffic was up 18 percent from the same period last year.

title: Concert: Philadelphians
description: LAST season in one of his concerts here with the Phladelphia Orchestra, Riccardo Muti conducted Prokofiev's Ivan the Terrible, an eveninglong dramatic choral work drawn from the Eisenstein film of the same name.

title: Carter to Attend Function to Help Beame Pay Debt
description: President Carter, repaying an old political debt, has agreed to be the main attraction at a fundraising event next Tuesday for former Mayor Abraham D. Beame. Mr. Beame has left the city's fiscal problems behind him, but not a $321,000 debt from his losing primary campaign last year.

title: Worker Says That Davis Wanted Entry to a Safe
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 28  An employee of T. Cullen Davis, the industrialist, testified today that Mr. Davis called her at home early on Aug. 20, apparently from his Fort Worth office, seeking the combination to the company safe.

title: U.S. Sailor Wins Title
description: MANZANILLO, Mexico, Nov. 28 (AP)  John Bertland of the United States won the world Olympic Finn class sailing championship yesterday with 47.7 points at this Pacific Coast resort. Joaquin Blanco of Spain, the 1977 world champion, was second with 59 points. Americans finished third and fourth with Carl Bucham collecting 61 points and Louis Mody getting 67.7.

title: Shipping Fleet Up 3%
description: LONDON, Nov. 28 (AP)  The world merchant shipping fleet increased only 3 percent this year to 406 million gross tons, Lloyd's Register of Shipping Statistical Tables reported today. It was the smallest rise since 1968. This year's total tonnage was 406 million tons in 69,020 ships, up from a 1977 total of 394 million tons in 67,945 ships. The Greek fleet expanded the most, by 4.4 million tons.

title: The Good Kitchens Of Old San Juan
description: SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO When one dines for pleasure in Puerto Rico one is reminded of the proverbial gentleman who gave himself repetitive blows on the head: It felt so good when he stopped. A hit farfetched, perhaps, but it is true that some of the bestknown restaurants on the island are mesmerizingly awful. And when you do find that exception, a laudable kitchen and interesting surroundings, it does, indeed, seem like finding gold in the dross.

title: Rome, OTB President, Seeks Abolition of N.Y.R.A.
description: Bernard Rome, the president of the New York City Otftrack Betting Corporation, recommended the abolition of the New York Racing Association yesterday, calling it a pretense to a business, a sham and a failure.

title: 6 City Workers Awarded $5,000 for Public Service
description: The parks of central Harlem are the best maintained of any in the city and for that reason Joseph Cuomo is $5,000 richer today.

title: 2 East Germans Flee in Plane
description: HANOVER, West Germany, Nov. 28 (Reuters)  An East German married couple escaped to West Germany today in a twoseater plane, the federal frontier police said. The two, each of whdm is 27 years old, flew beneath East German radar control and landed in Bad Lauterbach, 60 miles south of Hanover, informed sources said.

title: Dallmayr: The Best Munching in Munich
description: MUNICH, WEST GERMANY Nothing mirrors quite so precisely the personality of a European city as its food shops. And, as Fauchon could exist only in Paris, so could Dallinayr exist only in Munich, where it is as much a cultural institution as the opera and Oktoberfest.

title: Business In Quebec Is Debated
description: OTTAWA. Nov. 28  At least 42 companies have moved completely or partly out of Quebec since the Parti Quebecois came to power at the end of 1976, with a direct loss of 5,500 jobs and an indirect loss of 10,000 others, according to a report issued by the provincial Liberal Party.

title: U.S. Austerity: Reaction Mixed
description: PARIS, Nov. 28  Western Europe and Japan are officially pleased with, but privately worried about, President Carter's latest economic austerity package, designed to slow America's inflation rate and strengthen the ailing dollar.

title: U.S. Offers New Cyprus Plan in an Effort to Revive Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  The United States has proposed a 12point plan for negotiating a solution to the Cyprus dispute, including creation of a federal government with separate Greek and Turkish regions and the return to Greek Cypriots of significant territory seized by Turkish military forces in 1974.

title: Madrid Education Aide Abducted From Home in the Basque Area
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain, Nov. 28 (AP)  Two masked men believed to be Basque separatists kidnapped the representative of the Madrid Government's Education Ministry today. his family reported.

title: Canadiens Win, 30; Lemaire Gets 350th
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 28 (AP) Jacques Lemaire set up two scores by Guy Lafleur, then put the 350th goal of his National Hockey League career into an empty net with six seconds remaining tonight as the Montreal Canadiens recorded a 30 triumph over the Philadelphia EIvers.

title: Bulls 124, Suns 112
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 28 (AP)  Artis Gilmore had 28 points and 17 rebounds while Mickey Johnson and Reggie Theus clicked for 27 points each tonight to lead the Chicago Bulls to a 124112 victory over the Phoenix Suns.

title: Latin, and Other Lessons
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif. I think we became good friends somewhere between a noun clause and a prepositional phrase. He had white hair, watery blue eyes, a pendulous belly and clothes recycled to a state of total disrepute.

title: Pinochet Is Planning To Circumvent Curbs On Chilean Exports
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 28  President Augusto Pinochet said today that Chile would have to adopt imaginative solutions to circumvent a shipping boycott threatened by Western Hemisphere trade unions led by the A.F.L.C.I.O. He termed such a boycott a serious matter for his military Government.

title: Young Lords Gained Prominence in 1969
description: They were latecomers to the radical arena of the 1960's and their period of active confrontation was brief, but from the summer of 1969, when they triggered a garbage riot, in East Harlem, until their notoriety began to fade a year or two later, the Puerto Rican youths who call themselves the Young Lords were New York City's most active and lionized revolutionaries.

title: Rally by Wisconsin Beats St. John's, 7368
description: Claude Gregory and Wes Matthews combined for 34 points last night as Wisconsin squandered a 16point lead and then rallied from a 7point deficit to defeat St. John's, 7368, at Alumni Hall in Hillcrest. Queens.

title: A New Disneyland In Japan Is Planned
description: TOKYO, Nov. 28 (Reuters)  Walt Disney Productions has reached a tentative agreement to help build Tokyo Disneyland, an amusement park intended to be twice as large as its counterpart in California.

title: Piano: Gutierrez Recital
description: PERHAPS Horacio Gutierrez had to labor as much as any other pianist to acquire his dazzling technical equipment, but there is no evidence of struggle in his playing now. The Cubanborn graduate of the Juilliard School put on an impressive display of keyboard fluency in his Carnegie Hall recital Monday night, taking on an oldfashioned virtuoso's program and dispatching it with disconcerting ease.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 29, 1978

title: Letters
description: The effect of the debilitated alcoholic on plans to revitalize Times Square brings into focus one of today's major public policy issues  the development of human service programs which balance society's rights with the rights of the individual.

title: Bonn Army Chief Quits; Defense Aide Concerned
description: BONN, Nov. 28 (AP)  The Chief of Staff of the West German armed forces, Gen. Harald Wust, resigned today after maintaining that his basis of trust had been undermined, Defense Minister Hans Apel said.

title: Around the Nation
description: NEWARK, Nov. 28 (AP)  The Army must surrender films and recordings of atomic bomb tests 25 years ago so that a 47yearold cancer victim who says he was forced to witness a blast can compile evidence in his $13 million negligence suit, a Federal judge has ruled.

title: Baker Urges Republican Governors To Build Party's Strength for 1980
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Nov. 28 Howard H. Baker Jr., the Senate minority leader, said today that President Carter could get more Republican support for a new strategic arms treaty if he improved the nation's defenses by supporting the B1 bomber, the MX missile and the Navy's shipbuilding program.

title: Sports Today
description: Southampton at L.I.U.. 8 P.M.; Wagner at Princeton, 8 P.M.; Columbia at Rutgers, 8 P.M.; Stony Brook at Queens. 8 P.M.

title: Skid Row Slayer Eludes the Police in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 28  By day, this city's Skid Row is an innocuouslooking if seedy section of pawn shops, tattoo parlors, cheap lunch stands and porno movie houses. A besotted, bloodynosed Indian lurching from an alley can be the most outlandish sight a passerby glimpses.

title: Moody Blues Off Record
description: THE Moody Blues, who are touring again after a fiveyear hiatus, were at Madison Square Garden Monday night, and it was evident that they had been missed. Even though the quintet's live sound fell far short of the orchestral richness of its recordings  Days of Future Past, which the group recorded in 1969 with the London Symphony, was a landmark album in the development of symphonic rock  its fans were entranced.

title: Futures Agency Rebuffs Treasury and she Fed
description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission dismissed yesterday efforts by the Treasury and Federal Reserve to halt or slow the proliferation of futures trading in Government financial instruments. The agency announced it would continue to process new cotnracts proposed by a number of exchanges.

title: Cult Leader Is Said to Have Reneged on College Education Promises
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 28  The Rev. Jim Jones of the People's Temple promised churchsubsidized college educations to the children of families who joined his group, but a former member said that college students affiliated with the temple had been required to pay their own educational expenses in addition to donating a portion of their incomes to the church.

title: Hudson's Bay Mails Offer for Simpsons
description: The Hudson's Bay Company said it had mailed its formal offer for all the shares of Simpsons Ltd. The offer, subject to 60 percent acceptance, expires Dec.19.

title: Deaths
description: Aikenhead, M.

title: GeorgiaPacific's Report Is Qualified
description: The GeorgiaPacific Corporation said it had been told by its independent public accountants that the previously issued unqualified report on its 1977 financial statement would now be qualified, pending the ultimate outcome of certain litigation.

title: Private Lives
description: SO she is going, our Maggie, off to tend bar and write songs. And we gathered the other night to partake  not, one hopes, for the last time  of her libidinal gusto, her fierce cheer, her wise womanliness. And I said something. because I always say something; it is my compulsion at farewell parties to inflict upon my friends bromides of a mournful sort. I suppose my friends have so far tolerated this behavior because (1) I am usually brief; (2) I can be counted on to be mushy, and (3) they are kind to harmless cranks.

title: 2 Worlds of Dance Of Suzushi Hanayagi
description: WITH her round face and glasses, her cropped hair and shyly matteroffact demeanor, Suzushi Hanayagi could almost be taken for a nanny. New Yorkers will see her transformed, however, on stage at Japan House today and tomorrow in a recital with the Koto player Fusako Yoshida.

title: GUIDELINE ON WAGES MAY BE SOFTENED, PANEL'S CHIEF SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  Barry P. Bosworth, the chief administrator of President Carter's wageprice guidelines program, said today that the Administration was considering some softening of the pay standard with respect to fringe benefits and some tightening of the profitmargin test for companies' prices.

title: Beating a Maoist Dog
description: Mao Tsetung firmly preached that spontaneous tendencies toward capitalism were inevitable even in wellestablished, wellpoliced Communist state like China; that unless ideological backsliding was ruthlessly resisted, it could lead to capitalist restoration. His quest for doctrinal purity culminated in the Chinese Cultural Revolution, an assault on the hierarchy and bureaucracy of his own Communist Party. Bombard the Command Post! read many of the wall posters at the start of that long political civil war.

title: Careers
description: WHERE are the women? For every five men in the labor force today, there are two women at work, according to a new study by the Conference Board, a major research organization.

title: TV RATINGS
description: Following are the top 15 national television shows of the past week (Monday, Nov 20. to Sunday, Nov 26); listed according to their rank in the ratings compiled by the A C.Nielsen Company A rating is a percentage of the total number of United States households with television sets

title: Market Place
description: WHEN an aggressive company such as Pillsbury acquires another growing concern such as Green Giant, you might expect investors to rejoice.

title: Deadline Extended On Track Payment
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., Nov. 28  The Bank of New Jersey today indefinitely extended the Dec. 20 deadline on which the rest of the property purchase price of $15.7 million for Garden State Park race track was due from a syndicate headed by Edward H. Ellis Jr.

title: Civilians Patrol Area in Newark To Deter Crime
description: NEWARK, Nov. 28  At about 8 o'clos:k each evening seven cars, each carrying three civilians, pull away from 647 North Seventh Street to watch for muggers or other criminals on the streets of the North Ward, escort the elderly or help disabled motorists and accident victims.

title: Macy's Finds Sales Strong This Season
description: November business at R. H. Macy & Company has been good, and the company expects the current Christmas season also to be a good one after record seasons in the prior two years, Donald B. Smiley, chairman, said here yesterday after the annual meeting.

title: Entertainment Events
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Smetana's The Bartered Bride. 8.

title: Locomotive Kills 5 in Bremen
description: BREMEN, West Germany, Nov. 28 (AP)  Five railway workers were killed and a sixth seriously injured when a locomotive ploughed into them near Bremen yesterday, the Government railway office reported. Several hours earlier, a bus driver and two of nis passengers were killed in Dortmund, 100 miles south of Bremen, when a container truck hit a bridge and smashed into a city bus, the police reported.

title: Advertising
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., Nov. 28 Frank Stanton, president of Simmons, a market research bureau, knows how it feels to be in the lions' den. Everyone seemed to be snapping at him today as he bravely held down his seat on a panel with the topic Update on Syndicated Magazine Audience Research.

title: Notes on People
description: At a Plaza Hotel luncheon yesterday, there were accolades, a $10,000 prize, and some goodnatured jibes for John Chancellor of NBC, Walter Cronkite of CBS and Barbara Walters of ABC, winners of this year's Hubert H. Humphrey Freedom Prize of the AntiDefamation League of B'nai B'rith. The three were honored for their interviews during last year's crucial Middle East peace initiative with the Israeli and Egyptian heads of state, and among the 250 guests at yesteday's luncheon were the Israeli Ambassador to the United States, Simcha Dinitz, and Ambassador Ashrof Ghorbal of Egypt.

title: 20,000 South Africa Blacks Fight Regime's Effort to Uproot Them
description: CAPE TOWN, Nov. 23  Peter Mpumelelo paced disconsolately in the sand, using a hammer claw to wrench nails from the twisted pile of timbers and corrugated iron that had been his family's home.

title: Pianist: Robert Goldsand
description: IF ROBERT GOLDSAND celebrated the 50th anniversary of his American debut last season, that was not a signal that he was through with the concert platform. On Monday night, the 67yearold pianist was back, giving a recital in Alice Tully Hall, building his program around dances for the keyboard.

title: Best Buys
description: COOKS gearing up for holiday baking had better also gird themselves for that egg, butter, flour and sugar shopping trip. There's no getting around it, those sugar cookies, puddings and pies are going to cost more this year.

title: 2 DEATHS MOURNED BY SAN FRANCISCANS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 28  Women gathered in small groups in the Italian neighborhood of North Beach here today, and some of them cried. Some of the men, commiserating as they drank wine in the small bars there, pressed each other's hands in gestures of reassurance.

title: Firestone Considering Merger Bid
description: The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company and the BorgWarner Corporation Announced late yesterday that they had agreed to consider a merger of the two giant companies

title: Chess:
description: It's the unheard melodies that leave one wondering. That is why it is often difficult to judge ari opening innovation omits first appearance  a single game can show only one concrete course devolving from the innovation, but its value depends upon how well it can stand up against all attempts at refutation.

title: U.S. May Seek Funds From Cult
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)  The State Department said today it may attempt to recover millions of dollars in cash and property found at the site where more than 900 members of Rev. Jim Jones's religious cult died in Guyana. If the money is recovered, it would be used to pay for returning the bodies to the United States.

title: Q&A
description: Q. Are there any uses for pomegranates, other than drinking the juice from the seeds?

title: Coastal States Gas Calls Suit Baseless
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 28  The Coastal States Gas Corporation today described a shareholder's suit against the company as simply without merit. The suit, for more than $10 million, alleges improper crude oil brokerage payments.

title: Bhutto's Lifeand Pakistan's Futurein the Hands of Eight Judges
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan  As former Prime Minister Zulfikar All Bhutto nears the end of his long court battle to save himself from the gallows, Pakistan is coming to what many here regard as a crucial turn in its 31year history.

title: Occidental Is Studied By S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  The Securities and Exchange Commission has begun a wideranging investigation into the accuracy of statements made in the last four years by the Occidental Petroleum Corporation, the nation's 10thlargest petroleum company.

title: Anderson Dismissed As Manager of Reds
description: The Big Red Machine came to a dramatic turn yesterday when the Cincinnati Reds dismissed Sparky Anderson as manager of a team that won four National League pennants this decade.

title: Connecticut Democrats Oust Kennelly as House Chief
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 28  House Democrats tonight ousted their twoterm Speaker, James J. Kennelly, and chose instead to give the top leadership position to a young liberal attorney from Stamford, Ernest N. Abate.

title: Thriving, Surprising Hudson Valley Wine
description: ONLY a handful of New Yorkers are aware that there is a thriving little wine region an hour's drive north of the city. Come to think of it, it may be just as well so few people do know. The vine yards are beautiful, the winemakers are friendly and hospitable and the wines are good and getting better.

title: WASHINGTON
description: President. Carter now seems to be moving toward a national consumer boycott of companies that do not comply with his wage and price guidelines.

title: Food Gifts for Christmas
description: WITH Christmas a mere three andahalf weeks away and patience already wearing thin, most of us are in search of quick and easy solutions to giftgiving problems. It will probably be no sur prise to learn that, as far as we are concerned, the most obvious  and satisfying  answer to that problem is food. Surely there is some delectable morsel to delight everyone on every gift list, whether it is a $3 jar of rosered strawberry jam or a 14ounce $200 tin of mildly saline, crystal gray beluga caviar, or any of the hams, cookies, herbs, coffees. chutneys and nocolates that fall somewhere in between. The following offerings include food gifts at every price and for every palate, save only those with predelictions for foods that are fast, instant or in any way convenienced. When sending food gifts, be sure that perishables are so marked and will not be set on hot radiators or in overheated living rooms. and in order to get full value for your money, avoid prepackaged gift sets, unless they allow a choice of components and are packed to order. If you buy prepackaged sets, you will invariably get a few things you do not like or which are of inferior quality.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: One cannot help but admire those children of the American dream who thrive on advocacy of The System's destruction one day and on its exploitation the next.

title: FOES OF TITO IN U.S. A WORRY TO POLICE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  A murder in Glendale, Calif., last week has heightened tension in the Federal Bureau of Investigation and several major police departments over the growing violence in the YugoslavAmerican community, according to Federal and state sources. Tomorrow, a Yugoslav national holiday, may be one focal point for violence in the struggle of groups here that oppose the Government of President Tito.

title: Many German Steel Plants Idle
description: BONN, Nov. 28  West German steelworkers went on strike today for the first time in 50 years, closing several segments of the industry in a fight for a 35hour week that could have wide repercussions not only in Germany but also throughout Europe.

title: Italian, 17, Surprise Ski Victor
description: STELVIO, Italy, Nov. 28 (AP)  Maria Rosa Quario, an Italian teenager, upset heavily favored French and Austrians to win the women's special slalom of the World Series ski competition today for her first major victory. The race, the opening event of the women's ski season, marked important triumph for the underdog Italian team, which placed six among the to 10 finishers.

title: The Peace Card
description: TURIN, ItalyThe Chinese are not anxious to normalize relations with the Eurocommunists. Although 16 years have gone by since Chairman Mao dedicated to Comrade Palmiro Togliatti a famous editorial in The People's Daily on the sins of revisionism (one of the worst being flirtation with the Yugoslav renegades), Mao's successors are still in no hurry to make peace with Enrico Berlinguer, the Italian party chief, even though they have become great friends with Belgrade. As Premier Hua Kuofeng explained to Marshal Tito in their August talks in Yugoslavia, the Chinese still consider Eurocommunists revisionists as well as much too proSoviet. While Mr. Berlinguer, if he asked to visit Peking, would no longer be told no, he would still apparently have to make the first step (which he is in no hurry to do, not to displease the Russians).

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Le Chant de Roxanne, Szymanowski; La Valse, Ravel: Aria from Mignon, Thomas; Divertimento da Gunera. Bononcini; King Stephen Overture. Beethoven; Excerpt from El Amor Brujo, Falla.

title: The Region
description: HARTFORD  The president of a Connecticut construction company and two other men were killed when a twinengine AeroStar plane crashed immediately after takeoff from Brainard Field here yesterday. The plane, bound for Newburgh, N.Y., had just left the runway when it fell to the ground and exploded. The cause of the crash was not immediately determined. Witnesses said the engine appeared to have failed.

title: Veto of Smoking Curb Is Sustained in Illinois
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Nov. 28  State representatives today sustained Gov. James R. Thompson's veto of a bill that would have prohibited smoking in designated areas of public facilities. The vote was 81 to 47 to override, short of the required total.

title: A Barbara Walters Special on ABCTV Tonight
description: WELL, at least she's a good interviewer, is what people are apt to say in defense of Barbara Walters, However, this judgment is not borne out in the course of her latest special, which will be seen from 9 to 10 o'clock tonight on Channel 7. Miss Walters talks to Alan Alda, Diana Ross, Steve Martin and King Hussein and Queen Noor of Jordan without evident rapport or spontaneity.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: A photograph in Sports Monday on Nov. 27 was identified as that of Charles White, Heisman Trophy candidate from the University of Southern California. It was in fact Charlie White, formerly of the New York Jets.

title: VIETNAM EXPANDING DRIVE IN CAMBODIA
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 28  Vietnamese troops have greatly enlarged the area in Cambodia that they occupied earlier this year, informed sources reported today.

title: Amex Triples Quarter Profit
description: The American Stock Exchange reported yesterday that its thirdquarter profit had more than tripled, to $736,000 compared with $226,000 in the corresponding three months last year.

title: Police Call Two on the Carpet
description: Two Parks Department employees were arrested early yesterday and charged with stealing a 400pound roll of carpeting from a Queens warehouse and fleeing with it in their green city van.

title: More Am for Pan Am
description: Released from Federal protective custody, the nation's airlines are busy gearing for the insecure world of competition. Many see merger as the answer: the consolidation of routes, fleets and terminals may be the surest means to survive and profit in an unregulated market. The Civil Aeronautics Board, which retains some authority over the airlines for several more years, must now decide whether the mergers will foil or advance the goals of deregulation.

title: Area's Prices Still Going Up
description: For the first quarteryear in more than a decade, consumer prices rose faster in the country as a whole than in the New York metropolitan area, the latest Federal inflation figures showed yesterday.

title: Once Again the Libraries Have to Reduce Services
description: New York City's nearly 200 public library branches, which had recovered from some of the cutbacks prompted by the city's fiscal difficulties, over the last four years, now face a new threat  still shorter hours in many branches and further reductions id the number of library professionals.

title: Shell Denies Charges On Unleaded Fuel
description: The Shell Oil Company yesterday denied charges that are being investigated by the Federal Trade Commission  charges that the company is not letting many of its dealers purchase unleaded gasoline unless they also buy leaded fuel.

title: EMIL LUSARDI
description: Emil Lusardi, who began as an usher at Madison Square Garden 18 years ago and rose to chief usher and event coordinator, died at New Rochelle Hospital Monday night after a short illness. He was 54 years old.

title: COURT BACKS CITIES ON WIDENING POWER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  The Supreme Court ruled today that a city can constitutionally exert governmental powers over residents beyond its boundaries, even if those residents cannot vote in the city's elections.

title: Economic Scene
description: IF recession comes in 1979, as so many economists now expect, one of its unhappiest consequences will be a sharp increase in unemployment among young people, especially blacks. It has become conventional to regard youth unemployment and minority unemployment as a structural problem and to attribute it to high turnover rates among the young  that is, to their frequent shifts into and out of jobs.

title: World News Briefs
description: TOKYO, Nov. 28 (Reuters)  Masayoshi Ohira, who is due to become Japan's next prime minister as a result of having won a vote for his party's presidency, said today that friendship with the United States would remain the cornerstone of Japan's foreign policy.

title: U.S. Studies Sanctions as a Path to a Free Namibia
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  The Carter Administration, as part of a drive to persuade South Africa to cooperate with the United Nations plan for SouthWest Africa, is studying a wide range of possible sanctions against the Pretoria Government. United States officials said today.

title: Leaders of Drug Unit At Lincoln Removed On Orders From Koch
description: Mayor Koch yesterday ordered the leaders of a controversial drugdetoxification program evicted from Lincoln Hospital in the South Bronx and last night the city's hospital chief carried out the order as policemen stood by with sledgehammers, crowbars and wire cutters.

title: F.T.C. MOVES TO END BAN ON DOCTOR ADS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  In a case that may eventually affect doctors' fees all over the country, the Federal Trade Commission will announce tomorrow an administrative law judge's decision that the American Medical Association should cease and desist from prohibiting advertising by physicians.

title: Ashland Oil Loses A Round on Tosco
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 28 (AP)  The Ashland Oil Corporation has lost a round in its attempt to acquire the Tosco Corporation.

title: Marshall Appoints Randle Head Football Coach
description: HUNTINGTON, W.Va., Nov. 28 (AP)  Sonny Randle, a former pro football wide receiver and coach at the University of Virginia and East Carolina, was named Marshall University's head football coach today.

title: Pacing Star Syndicated
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 28 (AP) Falcon Almahurst, the fastest 3yearold pacer on record, has been syndicated for a recordtying $3.6 million, Charles D. Hill, his owner, said today.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: ILEFT my midtown office late in the evening to catch a train at Penn Station, writes Joseph Stern. Since I had plenty of time, I decided to walk, going straight down Seventh Avenue. As I approached 41st Street I was somewhat apprehensive about the loiterers and drunks that appeared in the neighborhood, but I was feeling quite jaunty and just kept stepping briskly.

title: Books of The Times
description: JOHN UPDIKE has taken a holiday in The Coup, and who can blame him? He has been writing careful novels, short stories and essays, almost without interruption, for half his lifetime. In 1973, he traveled as a rulbright lecturer in Africa, and apparently he has decided to amuse himself with some sardonic anthropology.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Silver futures dropped sharply yesterday, with the price impetus coming from two basic economic factors lower gold prices and the belief that the United States trade deficit for October would show an improvement.

title: Robert Hill, ExEnvoy, Dies at 61
description: LITTLETON, N.H., Nov. 28 (AP) Robert C. Hill, who had served as United States ambassador to five countries, died today at his home after being stricken with a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: Pravda Asserts the Dead Were Striving for Justice
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (AP)  The Soviet Union's leading newspaper says that the members of the People's Temple were American dissidents whose mass suicide has cast a shadow on the prestige of the United States and the American way of life.

title: U.S. Sees Improvement on Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (Reuters) The State Department said today that there had been a positive development in the human rights situation in China and it expressed the hope that there would be further improvement.

title: Deaths
description: AIKENHEADMabelle D. of Summit, N.J., formerly of Brooklyn, on Nov. 27, 1978, wife of the late Richard C. Aikenhead, mother of Richard C. Aikenhead of Summit, grandmother of Elaine & Bruce Aikenhead. Funeral service & interment private.

title: The Stage: Porno Stars
description: I'VE DONE everything at least once and tried everything at least twice, says one character in Porno Stars At Home. Now if he tried it at least twice he must have done it at least twice.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, Nov. 28, 1978

title: Stock Prices Tumble Nearly 10 Points
description: Stock prices weakened in the final two hours of trading yesterday to send the Dow Jones industrial average down nearly 10 points to hover just above the critical 800 zone.

title: Sims of Oklahoma Is Heilman Winner
description: Billy Sims, the strong and fast Oklahoma University tailback who led the nation in rushing and scoring, was named winner of the 44th annual Reisman Trophy yesterday as the outstanding college football player for 1978.

title: Nestl Reports Sales Drop
description: VEVEY, Switzerland, Nov. 28 (UPI)  The Nestl Company said today its sales fell 7.6 percent in the first 10 months of 1978 because of the rise in value of the Swiss franc. Worldwide sales of the Swiss concern totaled $9 billion in the year through Oct. 31, compared with $10 billion in the similar period a year ago. The company said the drop in sales was directly linked to the fact that 90 percent of its activities took place in countries where currencies had depreciated in relation to the Swiss franc.

title: Technology
description: SINCE the oil embargo of 1973, both the United States Government and the private sector have on one level or another been seeking alternate sources of energy. But there has never been anything approaching an overall strategic plan to develop them. Instead, almost wally nilly, first one potential resource, say shale oil, receives all the attention, only to be replaced in the spotlight by another, say coal gasification.

title: Mexico's Rich Families Live Lavishly but Vigilantly
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 28  Bernardo Garza Sada frequently sends his private jet to Houston to buy delicacies for his dinner table. Mario Vazquez Rana has platoon of armed bodyguards inside and outside his home, while Octaviano Longoria has the reputation of giving the best society bashes in town.

title: Bridge:
description: The Fall National Championships played in Denver during the last 10 days will long be remembered by those present for a series of bizarre tragedies, in which three of the country's bestknown bridge personalities were afflicted by personal misfortunes that could be considered unique.

title: Deaths
description: 5AMSKINJack. Beloved husband of Florence, devoted tether of Arlene and Irwin Schneider, Stephen and Marilyn Samskin. Loving grandfather of live. Adored soninlaw of Leah Rumack. Dear brother of Betty Gerson and Marlene Sprung. Services at BoulevardPark West 1450 Broadway, Hewlett, today at 10AM.

title: New Aberdeen Line
description: The Aberdeen Manufacturing Corporation announced it had entered the kitchen accessory field with a broad line of designcoordinated items, including oven mitts, pot holders, placemats, towels, appliance covers, dish cloths and aprons. Aberdeen is a leading producer of curtains, draperies, bedspreads, garden umbrellas and outdoor aluminum furniture

title: F.B.I. Says Hidden Leak Is Found in Suffolk Sewer
description: BABYLON, L.I. Nov. 28  The Federal Bureau of Investigation said yesterday that it had found a serious defect in a major part of ,Suffolk County's controversial Southwest Sewer District project and that the faulty workmanship had been deliberately concealed.

title: Fire Officer Charged with Bribery
description: An acting Fire Department lieutenant accused of selling the right test answers. to the wrong man was arraigned yesterday in Criminal Court in Brooklyn on charges of receiving a bribe.

title: New York Acts to Cut Flood of False Alarms Over Fire Voice Boxes
description: Because of a sharp rise in malicious false alarms, many attributed to schoolchildren, Mayor Koch announced yesterday a 30day experiment starting Monday under which the Fire Department will not respond to voicebox alarms from 3 P.M. to 5 P.M. on school days unless dispatchers receive a voice response from the sender.

title: 2 Plead Guilty In Cable Case
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 28 (AP)  A former assistant manager of an Anchorage telephone utility and an Alaskan agent for a Japanese corporation have pleaded guilty to fraud and bribery charges in an alleged scheme involving $8.8 million in cable contracts.

title: Brooklyn's Merchants To Help Ease Tension
description: Downtown Brooklyn merchants and a coalition of Brooklyn community leaders announced yesterday that they would devote $115,000 to the establishMont of new social and economic programs in art effort to develop a better relationship between tho borough's business community and its residents.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: EARNINGS
description: The HewlettPackard Company chalked up a 58 percent gain in net income in its fourth fiscal quarter on a salesgain of 36 percent, the maker of precision electronic equipment reported yesterday. The annual figures set records with increases of 26 percent in earnings and 27 percent in sales.

title: Iran Acts to Prevent Riots During Moslem Holy Month
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 28  The military Government, in an attempt to head off violent demonstrations against the rule of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, announced a total ban today. on all processions in any form during the Moslem holy month beginning next Saturday.

title: Hughes's Successor Steps Down
description: When Howard Hughes died in April 1976, his handpicked successor, Lawrence A. Hyland, now 81 years old, became president of the Hughes Aircraft Company. In 1977, he became its chairman. Yesterday, Mr. Hyland stepped aside to become chairman of the executive committee of the board of directors in. what the company calls a orderly transition to assure continuity and stability in management.

title: An Herb Garden On the Windowsill
description: ALONG with the cooking renaissance of the past decade, there has been a real revival in this country, of the use of fresh, savory herbs. The biggest problem now seems to be where to get them when you need them. The solution? Grow your own.

title: U.S. Destroying Squatter Shacks On Fire Island
description: LONG COVE, Fire Island, Nov. 28  A light rain was falling this morning as the jaws of a wrecking machine began biting into some of the tarandasbestos shingled shacks that for 20odd years were the summer homes for a handful of families on this remote stretch of dunes on Fire Island.

title: Africans Warn Press at U.N. to Shun Namibia Trip
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 28 Three African diplomats urged United Nations correspondents today to stay out of SouthWest Africa during elections there next month, insisting that their presence would help legitimize what they called a sham election aimed at installing a puppet regime in the territory.

title: Jazz 107, 76ers 103
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 28 (AP) Pete Marovich scored 32 points and Truck Robinson got 30 points and 22 rebounds to lead the New Orleans Jazz to a 107103 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers before a National Basketball Association singlegame regularseason record crowd of 35,139 tonight.

title: Personal Health
description: ADVERTISERS made it known as the heartbreak disease, and indeed for many of the eight million victims of psoriasis, it is a heartbreak and then some. At its least, this persistently recurring skin disorder is frustrating, uncomfortable and unsightly. At its worst, it is a humiliating, disfiguring and sometimes crippling problem that can turn its victims into unemployable recluses.

title: Bucks 117, Nuggets 100
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 28 (AP)  The Milwaukee Bucks, sparked by the firstquarter heroics of Brian Winters and Kevin Restani, ran off 15 straight points to pull ahead for good tonight in a 117100 victory over the Denver Nuggets.

title: Trash Collectors Seek Pay Raises
description: The city faces the prospect of pileups of trash and garbage and dirty linen if new contracts for private sanitation workers and laundry employees are not worked out by midnight tomorrow.

title: U.S. Warns G.E. and Hitachi
description: The Department of Justice said yesterday that it would sue the General Electric Company and Hitachi Ltd. on antitrust grounds if the two electronics giants went ahead with plans for a jointly owned corporation to produce television sets in the United States.

title: Political Balance Tips Again
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 28 A surprise victory today for a Republican legislator in a vote recount in a rural western Pennsylvania district has resolved a question that has been open since election day by putting the State House of Representatives back under Republican control.

title: Richard Kelton, Actor, Dies Working on Film
description: DENVER, Nov. 28 (AP)  Richard Kelton, an actor, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, while filming the NBCTV series Centennial on a ranch south of here.

title: Oklahoma's Battering Ram
description: Man in the News

title: Pedrozo Outpoints Solis, Retains Flyweight Title
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Nov. 28 (AP) Eusebio Pedroza of Panama retained his World Boxing Association junior flyweight crown last night by outpointing Enrique Solis of Puerto Rico in 15 round. The decision was unanimous. It was the Panamanian's second defense of his title.

title: Teaching Blacks
description: SYRACUSE, N.Y.The American school system fails to realize the learning potential of black students.

title: Another Iacocca Man Quits Ford
description: Another protg of Lee A. Iacocca the former Ford Motor Company president, is leaving the No. 2 auto maker. Walter T. Murphy, 63, executive director of Ford's public relations staff, will clean out his desk Friday and retire formally on April 1. Taking over Mr. Murphy's slot will be William Sheehan, onetime televison news impresario, who joined Ford this summer as general public relations manager.

title: Strict Rules Urged for Food Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  In a move Aimed at changing the way Americans learn about what they eat, the staff of the Federal Trade Commission today proposed a series of stringent rules governing food advertisements.

title: Federal Agencies Creating a Plan For Inquiries Into Assassinations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  Contingency plans for investigating future political assassinations and for protecting and analyzing evidence involved in them are being formulated by agencies of the Federal Government, according to sources familiar with the present situation.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: A Gem of a Bracelet

title: Doctor Sees Danger in Cult Survivors' Deep Despair
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 28  A New Jersey psychiatrist who specializes in treating former cult members said today that many surviving members of the People's Temple were suffering from severe depression which, if not treated, could lead to suicide.

title: BODIES SAID TO POSE NO RISK TO PUBLIC
description: DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del., Nov. 28  Dr. Ernest S. Tierkel, Delaware's chief disease control expert, said today that there was no public health threat to Americans from the badly decomposed bodies of the 912 people who died in the murders and suicides in Guyana almost two weeks ago.

title: Photos Help in Search For Suspect in Murder Of Mount Sinai Nurse
description: With the distribution of hundreds more pictures to police officers on the street and in patrol cars, the New York City homicide detectives stepped up their hunt yesterday for a convicted killer they believe murdered a 25yearold nurse in an abandoned 102d Street tenement last Friday.

title: Britain Will Penalize Ford on Wage Issue
description: LONDON, Nov. 28  The British Gorvernment carrying out its threats, said this afternoon that it had reluctantly decided to impose sanctums against the Ford Motor Company Ltd. for granting its workers a 16.8 percent wage increase, more than triple the official 5 percent guideline.

title: TrafficArea Rule Is Disputed at Air Crash Hearing
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 28  An airtraffic controller took issue today with suggestions that he had violated a key rule in directing a Pacific Southwest Airlines jet shortly before it collided with a small plane here Sept. 25.

title: Kenai to Buy Stock
description: The Kenai Corporation said its directors had authorized the company to repurchase from time to time up to 150,000of its own common shares on the open market or in privately negotiated transactions. There are about 2.27 million Kenai common snares outstana ing. The stock acquired will be used for employee benefit plans. Kenai, a diversified energy company, is primarily engaged in contract drilling and in the exploration and operation of oil and gas properties.

title: Secret Service Checking Reports That Cult Planned to Kill Officials
description: WASHINGTON, Nov 28 (Reuters) The Secret Service said tonight that it was looking into unconfirmed reports that members of the People's Temple cult planned to assassinate high ranking United States officials, possibly including President Carter.

title: White Motor Settling Suit
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 28 (AP)  The White Motor Corporation has announced a settlement valued at $15.8 million of a lawsuit by StudebakerWorthington Inc. stemming from White's purchase of Alco Engines from Studebaker in 1969.

title: Secretary Kreps in India
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 28  Juanita M. Kreps, the Secretary of Commerce, arrived here today on a fourday trade promotion visit. She told reporters that President Carter had asked to explore ways of increasing commerce with India. Trade between the two countries totals more than $1.5 billion a year, with the balance slightly in India's favor. India's share in the total rade of the United States is only 0.53 percent.

title: New Jersey Township Offers Bond
description: In an effort to sell more taxexempt bonds to moderateincome investors, East Brunswick Township in New Jersey plans to offer today $500,000 of bonds directly to buyers in denominations as small as $100  well under the $5,000 customary minimum. The issue also comes in $200, $500 and $1,000 blocks.

title: Deaths
description: DOUGLASSMrs. Lillian F, of 320 Jolia Circle North, St. Petersburg Beach, died Wednesday, November 22, 1978 in Florida. Formerly of Stamford, Conn, and New York City, Mrs. Douglass was retired General Agent and Chairman of the Board of General International Insurance Associates, St. Petersburg Beach.

title: About Myasthenia Gravis
description: What is myasthenia gravis? It is a chronic neuromuscular disease, apparently resulting from a defect in the transmission of nerve impulses to voluntary muscles. It is believed to be an autoimmune disease  the result of a patient's own immunological system turning against his or her own muscles. In mild cases, the weakness usually involves the muscles of eye movement, eyelids and facial expression. In more advanced cases, it may affect the muscles of the limbs and those controlling breathing, chewing and swallowing.

title: Senate's Only Woman Defies Stereotypes
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Nov. 28  Nancy Landon Kassebaum plans to go to Washington sometime next month to be sworn in as the junior Republican Senator from Kansas and get a leg up on the seniority ladder.

title: U.S. Efforts At Japan Sales
description: American companies are beginning at last to make an effort to export to Japan, Frank A. Weil, Assistant Secretary of Commerce, said yesterday in reporting what he called the very real success of a 100member United States trade mission that recently visited Japan.

title: The Story Behind A Remarkable Cure
description: San Francisco PHYLLIS BEAULIEU went home to die in October of 1976. Afflicted with myasthenia gravis, the grim, paralyzing disease that killed Aristotle Onassis, she had spent three terrifying years deteriorating in San Francisco hospitals until the doctors told her there was nothing more they could do for her.

title: 2 Are Held After Police Locate Elderly Patients
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 28 (AP)  The operators of a nursing home from which 36 elderly residents had been secretly removed were arrested by the police today. Many of the missing patients had been moved to an unlicensed, virtually unsupervised boarding home, described by the authorities as inhumane.

title: TV: Barvshnficov on a Balanchine Bill
description: CHOREOGRAPHY by Batanchine, Part 3, which can be seen on Channel 13 tonight at 9 o'clock, has several formidable assets. The two featured George Balanchine pieces are Cha conne (1976) and Prodigal Son (1929). Mikhail Baryshnikov, who joined the New York City Ballet in June, dances the lead in Prodigal Son for the first time. And the program itself represents the most successful hour yet produced for the distinguished Dance in America series.

title: Deaths
description: GOLDGRAN  Suzana. Beloved mother of Tema. Adored daughter of Toni Schwartz. Services Wednesday. 1:45PM at Schwartz Brothers Forest Park Chapels. Queens Blvd. at 76 Rd, Forest Hills.

title: Mexico Oil stressed In U.S. Energy Flans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  Quietly, Mexican oil has begun to figure prominently in the energy calculations of United States officials, especially as they project the nation's consumer, industrial and strategic needs into the longterm future.

title: Reporters Promised Police Protection
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 28  The South African police commander in SouthWest Africa, J.H. Verster, said today that journalists who have gathered in the territory for the election there next week would be provided with adequate police protection against threats of assassination.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: THERE is one sort of cookery which, when done, is exceptionally tasty. and hasty to boot. The foods are cooked en brochette (as even American menus have it or on skewers.

title: Welfare Cost Is Not Set, Aide to Carter Declares
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  Stuart E. Eizenstat, chief domestic adviser to President Carter, said today that no final decisions had been reached on the cost of a new welfare program the President will propose early next year.

title: 'stocking Lady Still Keeps Tight Schedule
description: When you refuse to give up a career at the age of 84, you have to be in love with your work, or just plain dedicated. For 49 years, Jessie Zimmer has been both.

title: Tribe Chairman Is Fined $150
description: PHOENIX, Nov. 28 (AP)  The chairman of the Hopi Indian tribe, charged Sept. 19 with soliciting an act of prostitution from an undercover Phoenix policewoman, has been allowed to plead guilty to a lesser charge. The chairman, Abbott Sekaquaptewa, 48 years old, pleaded guilty yesterday to a charge of disorderly conduct and was fined $150. The court also agreed to expunge the offense from his record.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: John Cole's Striper, a Story of Fish and Man, (AtlanticLittle Brown, 269 pages, illustrated, $10) is a splendid tribute to a magnificent fish.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: If Ray Kurshan is any example, one of the best routes to success in the computer business is a good course in accounting. Mr. Kurshan is a C.P.A. At the age of 54; he is also chairman and president of Management Assistance Inc., a company that was virtually out of business six years ago. Under his tutelage, Management Assistance has become a textbook turnaround case.

title: Rev. John F. Donovan, A Maryknoll Vicar, 71
description: The Rev. John F. Donovan, former vicargeneral of the Maryknoll Fathers in Maryknoll, N. Y., died yesterday in Hong Kong, where he was preparing a history of the Roman Catholic Church in southern China. He was 71 years old.

title: Slaton, Brewer Pitcher, Signs LongTerm Contract
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 28 (AP)  Jim Slaton, 28yearold pitcher, agreed today to a multiyear contract with the Milwaukee Brewers. The terms were not disclosed.

title: Monsanto Pricing
description: The Monsanto Textiles Company, a unit of the Monsanto Company, said it had raised prices for continuous filament polyester feeder yarns by 5 cents a pound, effective with shipments next January. The move follows recent similar price actions by E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company and the Celanese Corporation.

title: Players Plead for Coach
description: STILLWATER, Okla., Nov. 28 (UPI)  Oklahoma State football players asked school officials today to rescind the dismissal of Coach Jim Stanley and his staff.

title: Inflation Chief Is Appalled
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  Inflation, as measured by the rise in consumer prices, again reached doubledigit levels last month, with the price tags on basic necessities such as food, shelter and medical care accelerating most sharply, the Government reported today.

title: Criticism Rises On Plan to Aid Relief Housing
description: An experimental program to get New York City landlords to schedule housing improvements by assuring them that they will get rents from their welfare clients has run into opposition from the regional chief of the Federal Department of Health, Education and Welfare, and from a number of civic groups.

title: John Anderson, Executive Head Of Tea Council of U.S.A., at 57
description: John M. Anderson, executive director of the Tea Council of the U.S.A., died Sunday at Mount Sinai Hospital after a brief illness. A resident of New York and Cape Cod, Mass., he was 57 years old.

title: Newark's Lawless Lawmen
description: The Newark policemen who last week damaged 50 patrol cars, disrupted the city's traffic, conducted a mass sick out and distributed leaflets warning downtown shoppers to leave before dark and if attacked, scream loud, were serving neither their city's cause nor their own.

title: Deaths
description: BOCKEdith. 95 years of age. Beloved mother of Ann Posnack & Mark. Cherished grandmother of Alan Posnack & Dianne Stern. Dear great grandmother of 4. Services Wednesday. November 29, at Noon, Nassau North Chapel in Great Neck.

title: Former Policeman Is Indicted For Possession of Explosives
description: Michael J. Morphis, a 36yearold former police officer, was indicted yesterday for the illegal possession of dynamite, blasting caps, riot gas and smoke grenades that he kept on the roof and in his basement apartment at 150 East 27th Street. He was the building's superintendent.

title: Shopping Around
description: Following are addresses and telephone numbers of the shops carrying gift suggestions.

title: Letters to Dad: Portrait Of Cult's Faith and Fear
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 28 The letters to Dad read like notes from the heart of darkness.

title: Seven SteelHauling Rigs Are Hit By Shots on Pennsylvania Roads
description: Seven more steelhauling rigs were struck by gunshots on Pennsylvania highways yesterday as the violent strike by independent steelhaulers continued. Some frightened drivers are now refusing to goon the road.

title: Prices Off; New Issues Sell Slowly
description: Prices declined and interest rates rose in the credit markets yesterday as the Government reported that consumer prices continued to rise at nearly a doubledigit annual rate in October.

title: Real Estate
description: ROSELAND, N.J. AS a boy growing up in New Jersey, Peter Segal drank Becker's milk. Who knew then that in his mid30's he would be in the building business  with his father, two uncles, a brother and a cousin, Segals all putting up a sizable rental apartment project on 36 acres that were once part of the Becker dairy farm?

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THE LADDER Four successful Women will discuss their careers tonight at 7 at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A., near Lexington Avenue. The panel consists of Elaine Kaufman, the restaurateur; Ellen Beckwith of the Johnson & Higgins Insurance Company, Christine Millen of Price Waterhouse and Marcia O'Bannon of the New York Stock Exchange. Other prominent women in business, advertising and finance will continue the series on the next two Wednesdays, same time.

title: CHARLES LEE BLANTON Jr.
description: SIKESTON, Mo., Nov. 27 (AP) Charles Lee Blanton Jr., publisher of The Daily Standard and chairman of the board of the Sikeston Publishing Company, died Thursday at the age of 79.

title: U. of Connecticut Rolls Up 12%
description: STORRS, Conn., Nov 28 (AP)  The University of Connecticut branches, which have been plagued by a decrease in new students over the last five years, enrolled 12.2 percent more freshmen and transfer students this fall, new figures from the university admissions office show. Over the last five years, enrollment at the branches has declined an average of 14 percent. For the 197879 school year, 1,417 freshmen and transfer students are enrolled, compared with 1,262 last year.

title: The City
description: Despite the insistance of parents that cancercausing asbestos be removed from two Harlem school buildings, an official of the Board of Education recommended yesterday that the asbestos remain and that a new layer of reinforced acoustical tile be installed to contain it.

title: Bullets Trounce Knicks, 133106, for 8th Straight
description: The Washington Bullets looked entirely like the defending National Basketball Association champions last night as they ran away from the Knicks.

title: Arrest Near Madras Brings Riot
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 28 (AP)  Policemen arrested four people for breaking the state prohibition law in a suburb of Madras, in southern India, and a mob attacked the police station where they were held today. No casualties were reported. Madras is the capital of Tamil Nadu, a dry state that has the stiffest penalties in India for prohibition offenses.

title: Homemade Presents Are What's Cooking
description: Few holiday gifts are as welcome as food. And a food basket, filled with assorted offerings, gives cooks a perfect chance to display their culinary talents.

title: Nominee for ArmsControl Panel Picks Fellow ExSoldier for Staff
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  Lieut. Gen. George M. Seignious, the Carter Administration's new director of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency, has selected another retired military officer for a highlevel post in the department, officials said today.

title: ExAide Held in Moscone Killing Ran as a Crusader Against Crime
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 28  He was elected last year to the San Francisco Board of Supervisors on a tough lawandorder platform, but today Dan White sits in the city jail, charged with the murder of San Francisco Mayor George Moscone and Supervisor Harvey Milk.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: SOMETIMES its a smack, sometimes it's a swipe, and sometimes it's a complete miss. It's an undisciplined, imprecise art. It's sloppy. It is, of course, the thing to do.

title: Boumediene Is Believed Near Death
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 28  The condition of President Houari Boumediene worsened sharply today, and Algerian officials expressed concern that he might die at any moment.

title: U.S. and China Begin Discussion On Communication Satellite Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) American and Chinese technical officials began discussions today on a plan to let China buy an American communications satellite.

title: Amtrak Shows New TrackLaying System
description: ABERDEEN, Md., Nov. 28  It is Amtrak's monster on wheels and it has taken the star role in the rebuilding of the WashingtonNew YorkBoston rail corridor by devouring old track and spitting out new strips of smooth welded rail and concrete ties, all in the same operation.

title: U.S. Aides See a Possible Bloc Crisis Over Rumania
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  American officials said today that they viewed Rumania's refusal to join the six other Warsaw Pact countries in raising military expenditures as possibly the beginning of a crisis in the Soviet bloc.

title: Mayors Appear Resigned to Urban Program Cuts
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 28  President Carter's speech here yesterday, in which he warned of less Federal aid to the nation's cities, appears to have been greeted with resignation by most of the 4,000 mayors and other municipal officials attending the annual convention of the National League of Cities.

title: 2 Oil Barges Go Aground Within 24 Hours
description: A huge oilbearing barge ran aground early yesterday on a rocky island in the East River, spilling 40,000 gallons of lightweight heating oil into the waters of Hell Gate near Gracie Mansion.

title: 60 Minutes Tops Ratings
description: Sunday's episode of 60 Minutes, the weekly CDS news magazine, was the most watched program in the country last week, the first time in the 10year history of the series that it ranked at the very top of the national Nielsen ratings. It was also the only nonfiction program of the 61 network programs that was aired in prime time during the week.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: A modification of the wage and price guidelines designed to curtail inflation is being considered by the Carter Administration said Barry P. Bosworth, director of the Council on Wage and Price stability. Softening of the pay standard with respect to fringe benefits and tightening of the profitmargin test of corporate price increases are in prospect, he suggested. [Page A1.]

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Nov. 28 (UPI)  Wendy Turnbull, the host country's No. 1 player, routed Monique Van Haver, 61, 6.1, as Australia shut out Belgium in openinground play of the $130,000 Federation Cup today, then was dropped for the next match.

title: Steel Imports for Year Likely to Top '77 Record
description: Imports of steel declined by 2.6 percent last month from yearearlier levels but continued at a pace that makes it virtually certain that imports by the end of the year will exceed the record amount of 1977.

title: Suffolk Downs Is Closed
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29 (AP) Thoroughbred racing was canceled after the second race at Suffolk Downs today because of unsafe track conditions caused by a quick thaw.

title: Economic Index Up In October
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The Commerce Department reported today a small increase in its composite index of leading indicators, signaling prospects for continued growth in the economy, in contrast to warnings by many private economists that a recession lies ahead.

title: Massachusetts 70, Harvard 65
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 29 (AP) Mark Haymom and Eric Williams scored 21 and 14 points, respectively. tonight to lead Massachusetts to a 7065 victory over Harvard in the opening game for both teams.

title: GARDENING
description: PAPERWHITE narcissus come just about as close to being instant as any flowers can be, Plant the bulbs and in four to six weeks, results. What faster way to brighten a gray wintry day?

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, NOV. 29, 1978

title: Bridge:
description: At the top level of tournament play allegiances change quite abruptly. Teams and partnerships dissolve and reform, leaving old allies as rivals and viceversa.

title: Soviet Reported to Lift Exit Ban On an American in Car Accident
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 29 (AP)  An American business representative, Leo Sonner, who was barred from leaving the Soviet Union after a traffic accident a month ago, is free to go now, informed sources said today.

title: 2 Wanted in Montreal Kidnapping In 1970 Plan Return From France
description: QUEBEC. Nov. 29 (Reuters)  A Canadian couple wanted for the kidnapping in. Montreal in 1970 of a British diplomat, James Cross. plan to return next month from exile in France. a spokesman for the Quebec Justice Ministry said oday.

title: Wage Plan Reports Ordered
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The Securities and Exchange Commission notified companies today that they would be required to disclose in public reports any significant impact that President Carter's wage and price guidelines might have on their businesses.

title: Stony Brook 91, Queens 84
description: Stony Brook defeated Queens College, 9184, at Queens FitzGerald Gym last night as Mel Walker showed the way with 19 points.

title: Met Sees Fiscal Stability
description: The Metropolitan Opera's administration, in an unusually optimistic though cautious mood, is reporting today that for the first time in many years the company is undeniably on the road to financial stability. Anthony A. Bliss, executive director, said it was now possible for the company to operate without being under the cloud of crisis and constant struggle that have been so much a part of the recent history of the company.

title: Maple Leafs 5, North Stars 3
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 29 (AP)  Lanny McDonald fired in two key goals and led the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 53 victory over the Minnesota North stars tonight.

title: Backgammon:
description: The North American Backgammon Championships, which started this month, is a special tournament limited to 16 of this country's best slavers. The eight preliminary rounds are now being played at different titles around the country. Final rounds will be played in Las Vegas nextweek, concurrently with the Plimpton Cup, an amateur tournament with more than 1,000 players.

title: TRADE DEFICIT IS UP AS U.S. IMPORTS RISE; DOLLAR, STOCKS OFF
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 The nation's trade deficit grew again in October as American exports declined and imports edged up to record levels, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Penguins 5, Capitals 3
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 29 (AP)  Lastperiod goals by Wayne Bianchin and Randy Carlyle helped the Pittsburgh Penguins halt a fourgame losing streak with a 53 victory over the Washington Capitals tonight.

title: 8 Food Places Cited as Violators Of New York City's Health Code
description: The New York City Department of Health yesterday cited eight food places as violators of the Health Code. It also announced that two food establishments that had been closed for violations were now open for after having corrected the defects. The following were named:

title: National Security Held No Basis for Mail Checks
description: A NEWARK, Nov. 29  A Federal judge ruled today that it was unconstitutional for investigative agencies to have citizens mail scrutinized in the name of national security.

title: SMITH ADMITS GUILT IN LAINFIRM FRAUD
description: Peter P. Smith 3d, who resigned in Au 1 gust as New York City's Commissioner of General Services, pleaded guilty yesterday to charges that he had defrauded a law firm when he worked for it a few years ago.

title: Connecticut Union Wins
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 29 (AP)  The Connecticut State Employees Association has won the right to represent 7,000 state clerical workers, while the question of which union will represent 2,500 social service workers remains unsettled, state labor officials said yesterday. In the social service unit, a runoff election will be held Dec. 13 and 14 between the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees, and the State Employees Association, the two top finishers in the election, officials said.

title: GISCARD NAMES AIDE AS FOREIGN MINISTER
description: PARIS, Nov. 29  President Valry Giscard d'Estaing appointed his closest aide, Jean FrancoisPoncet, Foreign Minister today, replacing Louis de Guiringaud.

title: Stoneware: A Craft From America's Past
description: WASHINGTON In the taverns and kitchens of early America, stoneware was the common container and dispenser.
