Before the advent of vacuum canning and refrigeration in the 19th century, distinctive gray or brown stoneware, often incised with blue cobaltoxide or purple manganese decoration, was used to store everything from butter and pickled oysters to cider and Holland gin.

title: Super Sonics 125, Nets 111
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 29 (AP)  Fred Brown, Seattle's sharpshooting sixth man, broke out of a fivegame scoring slump with 26 points to lead the SuperSonics to a 125111 victory over the New Jersey Nets tonight.

title: Market Place
description: WILL Montreal's Genstar Ltd., which is seeking new markets in this nation's Sun Belt, be satisfied with an equity interest in the similarly positioned Flintkote Company? Or will the Canadian buildings material company seek a merger somewhere down the line?

title: The Versatile American Trunk
description: THE trunk, utilitarian and mobile in stagecoach and steamship days, has become stationary and semidecorative, often with a function that early travelers wouldn't have dreamed of. These days, old trunks are transformed into bins for children's toys, units for a stereo, lockers for clothes out of season, card or coffee tables.

title: F.T.C. Charges BorgWarner
description: The Federal Trade Commission yesterday charged the BorgWarner Corporation and Robert Bosch GmBH, the West German carparts maker, with maintaining illegal interlocking directorates. Both compete in selling car parts, the agency said.

title: Federaticin Cup Postponed
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Nov. 29 (UPI)  Play in the second round of the $130,000 Federation Cup tennis tournament was abandoned today after a thunderstorm drenched the Kooyong Stadium grass courts.

title: Making Money on Green Thumbs
description: Americans are spending a lot of green to bring a little greenery into their lives. By one recent count, about $26 million was paid out in a year just for house plants and associated products. Consequently, a new breed of botanical entrepreneurs, not necessarily possessing green thumbs, is growing right along with the plant industry.

title: Teacher Union Seeks To Organize Workers In Health Professions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)  The American Federation of Teachers said today that it was starting a campaign to organize the nation's one million nurses and millions of other healthcare employees.

title: Ceausescu Seeks Support Of Party Against Moscow
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Nov. 29 President Nicolac Ceausescu convened a special session of the Communist Party's Central Committee today to gain backing for his defiance of the Soviet Union.

title: U.S. Army Prisoners in Germany Riot in Demand for More TV Sets
description: MANNHEIM, West Germany, Nov. 29 (UPI)  Inmates who wanted more television sets rioted in the United States Army prison here Monday night and were subdued by guards using fire hoses, an Army spokesman said today.

title: Calendar: Pottery and a Peek at Christmas
description: Pottery Show, Old Church Cultural Center, Demarest, N.J.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PERSPECTIVES An art display and sale today through Saturday at the Randall Galleries, 823 Madison Avenue, between 67th and 68th Streets, will benefit Freedomways Magazine, the major black quarterly. On view will be the works of 14 artists, among them Romare Bearden, Robert Gwathmay, Jacob Lawrence, Palmer Hayden and Elizabeth Catlett. The event's cochairmen are James Baldwin and Ruby Dee, both of whom have written for Freedomways, as have the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., Thurgood Marshall, Shirley Chisholm and Harry Belafonte.

title: Study Finds Use Of Drugs Moves To the Suburbs
description: A New York State study released yesterday showed that the greatest incidence of drug use in high schools was in the Buffalo area and on Long Island and that this was in line with a trend toward teenage drug use spreading from the inner city to the suburbs.

title: Duncan Stars as Rutgers Beats Columbia
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Nov. 29  Rutgers., which suddenly lost both its shooting ability and poise late in the first half, rediscovered them at the start of the second half and went on to defeat Columbia, 7063, tonight. And the Knights did it with a minimum of assistance from James Bailey.

title: Giants' Old And young In Disarray
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 29  John Mendenhall once, or twice, observed in anger about the Giants organization:

title: Times Declares Dividend
description: The New York Times Company declared yesterday a regular quarterly dividend of 20 cents a share on its Class A and Class B common stock, payable Dec. 26 to shareholders of record Dec. 8. The distribution will bring the publishing company's common stock payout for this year to a total of 77.5 cents, compared with 67,5 cents last year. The quarterly rate was raised from 17.5 cents to 20 cents a share last June.

title: Equity Library Theater Seeks Home
description: The Equity Library Theater, where ambitious, unpaid actors display their talents in revivals, has begun looking for a new home because the owners, of its West 103d Street quarters have declined to renew its lease beyond the spring.

title: Deaths
description: FILUMEdward Of Margate. Fla Be loved husband of Gertrude (Billie). Devoted father of Button, dear brolter of Lorraine Joosten & adored or are alter Services Friday fpm Parliside Chapel, 98o0 Queens Blvd, Irmo Park.

title: Neuroses Are Just No Fun Anymore
description: WHEN I was coming up, my friends and I went to psychoanalysts as one goes to graduate school. We learned to explicate our neuroses as if they were poems, delving into literature, anthropology and mythology in order to do justice to our symptoms. None of us thought of a cure, and I never heard of anyone who was cured. Psychoanalysts in those days were Europeans with classical educations and they respected our privacy.

title: $3 Million Award Is Overturned In a Suit Against Southwest Bell
description: SAN ANTONIO, Nov. 29 (AP)  A state appeals court today overturned a jury's $.3 million damage judgment against the Southwestern Bell Telephone Company in a case involving two executives who had allegedly been slandered by an internal investigation.

title: How California Has Become Home for a Plethora of Cults
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 29  In the thick catalogue of cults, sects and movements that dot the California landscape, the People's Temple fell somewhere between Werner Erhard's est and the Symbionese Liberation Army, somewhere between the Esalen Institute and the Manson family, somewhere amid the integral counseling centers, the lifecontext workshops and the plethora of obscure Asian religions.

title: Deaths
description: SILVERSTEINEtta. Beloved wife of the late Samuel. loving mother of Lucille. Alvin& Edythe. Dear sister of Beatrice, cher istv.1.1 grandmother Services held Wednesday November 29th. 1978.

title: Printer's Conviction As Insider Is Upheld
description: In a 2toI decision yesterday, a Federal appeals court upheld what is believed to be the first criminal prosecution for using inside information to buv or sell stocks.

title: Jahn, FastFood King, Buying Lums of Miami
description: Fredrich Jahn. an Austrian who based a fortune on broiled chickens in Europe, has purchased the Miamibased Lurns Inc. resturant chain from John Y. Brown Jr., who made a fortune frving chickens in this country.

title: Stenmark Prevails in Special Slalom
description: STELVIO, Italy, Nov. 29 (AP)  The World Cup champion, Ingemar Stenmark of Sweden, won the men's special slalom of the World Series ski competition today by recording a tworun time of 110.87 seconds.

title: Tax Free Bond Prices Decline
description: Taxexempt bond prices declined yesterday, their third substantial drop this week, as the market worked to absorb a large volume of housing authority securities. Late in the day. prices recovered some of their losses.

title: HighTech Or the
description: PLURALISM is the word in architecture and interior design today. Those who make taste tell us that there is room for every kind of taste, and books are published daily to prove it.

title: Special Privileges Aided Older Members' Survival
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 29 They were old and stiff in their movements. At Jonestown, they were known as seniors. They were not expected to work in the fields as the others were, and no one bothered them if they sometimes missed the nightly assemblies called by the Rev. Jim Jones.

title: Brazilian Opposition Picks Up Some Seats In Congressional Vote
description: BRASILIA, Nov, 30 (AP)  The opposition Brazilian Democratic Movement has apparently trimmed the percentage by which the military Government controls Congress. th As a result of the Nov. 15 el; ection, the opposition hopes for more influence in what has been a rubberstamp legislature.

title: Shinn Joins Board of Times Company
description: George L. Shinn, chairman of the First Boston Corporation, has been elected a director of The New York Times Company, the company announced yesterday. He will be nominated to a full oneyear term as a director at the publishing company's annual meeting scheduled for next April 24.

title: Housing Braces for a Downturn
description: The makings of a downturn in the housing industry have appeared, and with them, the first signs that the Carter Administration's program of economic restraints may be taking hold.

title: Design Notebook
description: IT was just about a year ago that the ornate top of 230 Park Avenue, the splendid tower that sits like an exclamation point in the middle of Park Avenue at 46th Street, turned a pinkish beige. It seemed, then, rather disturbing and unnecessary  the pyramidal top had always been green, the color of New York's old copper roofs, and the change appeared capricious and arbitrary.

title: City Bulldozers Destroy a Greenwich Village Mall
description: Concrete benches. potted spruce trees, shrubs and the rest of an $80,000 landscaped mall in Greenwich Village were demolished and carted off Tuesday and yesterday by crews from the city's Highways and Sanitation Departments.

title: GORDON L. BUTLER
description: Gordon L. Butler, president of the HoHoKus (N.J.) Inn, died Monday at Valley Hospital in Ridgewood, N.J., after a brief illness. He was 67 years old.

title: Rangers Set Back Flames, 53, For 7th Straight Road Victory
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 29  Just like good things, all bad things must come to an end, and tonight the Rangers ended a longstanding spell of injustice at the hands of the Atlanta Flames by beating them, 53.

title: Entertainment Events
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA. Lincoln C??er ver Ci?? Luisa Miller, 8

title: Post Suspends Sunday Paper After 8 Weeks
description: The New York Post announced yesterday that it would suspend publication of its eightweekold Sunday edition.

title: Deaths
description: FRIPPElizabeth, on Nov 29, 1978, of Bronxville, beloved wife of Frank G Fripp, devoted mother of William J Fripp II and Mrs John L. (Eli zabeth) Bennett, Jr Sister of William P. Jackson. Also survived by five grandchildren and one greatgrandchild. Private funeral services have been held.

title: Purchasers Hopeful on Economy
description: In its first report since President Carter's Nov. 1 announcement of his dollarrescue plan with its strong antiinflation emphasis, the National Association of Purchasing Management Inc. yesterday made light of recession fears and painted a generally bright economic picture for the fourth quarter and for 1979.

title: ESSAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The 8341 units  the 20,000man Praetorian guard in Peking that protects China's top leadership  must be terribly confused.

title: Seattle Slew Is Back in Clover
description: LEXINGTON, Ky, Nov. 29  Signs reading Welcome Home, Champ! were prominently displayed here today as Seattle Slew took up residence in the bluegrass country.

title: Clothespin Makers Back Proposed Import Quota
description: WILTON, Me., Nov. 29  Maine's clothespin manufacturers expressed hope today that President Carter would accept yesterday's recorrimbndation by the International Trade Commission for a fiveyear quota on imports of clothespins.

title: Robert Cohan's Myth Offered by IceDancing
description: JOHN CURRY's IceDancing is not the first dance company on ice that its original advertisements proclaimed, but on Tuesday night at the Felt Forum it finally started acting like a real dance company and took an artistic risk by presenting a piece that is anything but a crowdpleaser.

title: Home Beat
description: MONDAY'S snow, which turned New York into a sodden mess, came when the city was having a hard enough time just getting restarted after the long Thanksgiving holiday, never mind anybody trying to initiate new projects.

title: The New Realism on Welfare
description: The Carter Administration has finally concluded that its $20billion plan for'reforming the nation's welfare system was a utopian dream. Half the country seems unwilling to spend such sums no matter what the potential benefit. Most of the country feels it cannot afford them in any case. Yet much of the country continues to bear a disproportionate burden for what should always have been recognized as a national problem; wants relief, with or without reform.

title: Princeton 82, Wagner 65
description: PRINCETON. N.J., Nov. 29  After playing to a 3535 halftime tie, Princeton University outscored Wagner College, 163, in the first four minutes of the second half tonight before a crowd of 2,325 in Jadwin Gymnasium and went on to win, 8265.

title: WarnerLambert Elects New Leaders
description: Ward S Hagan has been elected chairman of the board of the WarnerLambert Company and Joseph D Williams has been elected president, effeclive Jan. 1. Mr. Hagan, who has been president and chief executive officer, succeeds E. Burke Giblin, who is retiring.

title: Michigan Bell Bonds Off Sharply
description: Bonds of the Michigan Bell Telephone Company that were snubbed by investors on Tuesday dropped sharply in price yesterday, raising their yield from 9.16 percent to 9.27 percent as the credit markets continued to slump.

title: A Correction
description: In The Home Section last week, a story about companies that rent party equipment and provide staff for parties had an incorrect telephone number listed for Taylor Maid Service. The company's bartenders, waitresses and waitresscooks can be booked by calling 8387171.

title: Disks: Many Sides of Charlie Parker in Two Sets
description: CHARLIE PARKER: The very Best of Bird. Warner Bros. 2WB 3198, two disks.

title: The Region
description: WHITE PLAINS  The Westchester Board of Legislators Budget Committee voted yesterday to add 19 positions to the $419 million county budget proposed by Alfred B. DelBello, the County Executive, for 1979.

title: 7 Elderly Survivors of Cult Are Returned From Guyana
description: Seven elderly and destitute members of the People's Temple in Guyana arrived last night at Kennedy International Airport in New York after a fivehour flight from Georgetown, Guyana.

title: Choreography Showcase Presents 6 New Dances
description: THE Choreographers Showcase programs at the American Theater Laboratory are designed to provide young choreographers with opportunities to present new works. Unfortunately, anyone who went to Tuesday's concert expecting youthful daring would have been disappointed at the tameness of the pieces.

title: Insurance Pressure on Elderly Laid To Concern CoFounded by Byrne
description: TRENTON Nov. 29  The Intercontinental Life Insurance Company, cofounded in 1964 by a group of politically wellconnected lawyers and New Jersey officials, has been pictured before a Congressional committee as one of several unscrupulous companies that prey on the fears of the elderly by pressuring them to buy unneeded health insurance.

title: Policy of Encouraging Policemen To Attend College Is Challenged
description: A detailed report by the National Advisory Commission on Higher Education for Police Officers raises serious doubts about the widespread policy of encouraging policemen and women to attend college.

title: Skiing Still on a Limited Basis in Northeast
description: Despite two snowstorms in recent days and periods of subfreezing weather suitable for, snowmaking, little more than a dozen ski areas in the Northeast are expected to be open for business this weekend.

title: Advertising
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., Nov. 29  To the crowd attending the annual meeting of the Association of National Advertisers  a target of much Government regulation and public criticism  any ray of hope is appreciated. And that was delivered here by Kenneth Schwartz, vice president and managing partner of the Opinion Research Corporation's public opinion index.

title: NBCTV Cancels Half Of Its Weekly Series
description: In one of the most drastic midseason revisions of a primetime program schedule since threenetwork competition began, NBCTV yesterday canceled more than half its regular weekly series and announced the nine new programs that will replace them during January and February.

title: John Elliott, Investment Adviser; Was Also Leader in Civic Affairs
description: John Elliott, a retired investment counselor who was active in the civic and business affairs of New York City for many years, died yesterday at his home on East 62d Street after a brief illness. He was 88 years old.

title: Soviet Leadership Worried Over China's Reemergence
description: MOSCOW. Nov. 29  Seldom in this decade has the Soviet leadership been so obviously worried about China Chairman Hua Kuoleng's opening to the industrial states of the West and China's emergence on the world scene after years of preocc?? pation with domestic problems have prompted a reassesment of a whole range of the Soviet Union's strategic and tactical positions.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: Chef's Choice

title: Screen: Futility in a Decaying City
description: IF IT FITS, a documentary film by John Marshall and Mark Erder; Dart of the New American Filmmakers Series at the Whitney Museum of American Art. Running time: 60 minutes.

title: CONSULAR OFFICERS: BABY SITTERS, ETC.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  After the State Department was badgered for days because its consular officers had failed in periodic visits to discover the repression in the People's Temple settlement in Guyana, one official said in exasperation, We're not baby sitters.

title: Saudi Begins Bid For Hyatt Shares
description: Interedec (U.S.A.), a corporation wholly owned by Gaith R. Pharaon, the Saudi Arabian businessman, announced commencement of its cash tender offer for any and all of the outstanding Class A and Class B common shares of the Hyatt International Corporation at $14 a share. The offer will expire Dec. 19 unless extended. Hyatt International operates hotel properties outside the United States.

title: East Germans Line Up To Buy a Pair of Levi's
description: EAST BERLIN, Nov. 29  In a heady atmosphere of expectation, East Berlin youths began to line up today at city stores for a huge sale of American blue jeans, airlifted directly from the United States.

title: Drrenmatt Premiere Opens PAF Season Dec. 7
description: The new season of the Performing Arts Foundation Playhouse, known as the PAF Playhouse, in Huntington, L.I., will begin Dec. 7 with the American premiere of An Angel Comes to Babylon by Friedrich Diirrenmatt. Directed by Jay Broad, the work is the first of six to be presented at the new, 520seat theater at 185 Second Street.

title: Rock: Sea Level Plays the Bottom Line
description: SEA LEVEL is the most impressive rock band to come out of the South since the original Allman Brothers Band. The group started as a kind of Allman spinoff the pianist, Chuck Leavell, and the bassist, Lamar Williams, were members of that band  but Sea Level actually began to come into its own a little more than a year ago, with the addition of Randall Bramblett, an exceptionally talented songwriter, vocalist and multiinstrumentalist, and his longtime associate, the guitarist Davis Causey. The guitarist, Jimmy Nails, and a new drummer, Joe English, formerly with Paul McCartney's Wings, round out the group.

title: JWT
description: National Airlines announced yesterday that it was moving its $16.5 million advertising account to the J. Walter Thompson Cornpany.

title: On Moving to Texas
description: There has been almost unanimous public approval of the evolving deregulation of the airline industry. Some of the side effects of that step, however, have not been quite so popular.

title: Amoco Container Unit
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 29 (UPI)  The Amoco Chemicals Corporation announced today the formation of the Amoco Container Company, a subsidiary under which all of Amoco's manufacturing and marketing operations of plastic bottles and containers will be consolidated. The new subsidiary of the worldwide chemical marketing and manufacturing unit of the Standard Oil Company of Indiana will have its headquarters in Atlanta. Robert D. Bishop, an executive with 15 years experience in the plastics industry, has been named president of the new subsidiary.

title: Tax Rift Snarls Norway's Volvo Bid
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 29 (AP)  Negotiations on Norway's bid to buy a part interest in Volvo, the Swedish auto manufacturer, were reported in jeopardy but not broken off here today.

title: WagePrice Questions Pour In
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The managers of the Carter Administration's voluntary wageprice stabilization campaign wish the telephone would stop ringing so often. They say they are getting so many inquiries from businessmen about how to comply with the standard for prices that they cannot get on with writing the final regulations.

title: Carter Cuts Back Exports of Arms To Countries Not Allied With U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  President Carter announced today that he had placed a ceiling of $8.43 billion on the total value of AmeriCan arms that could be sold in the 1979 fiscal year to nations not allied with the United States. That figure represents a modest reduction from the previous total.

title: Harry S. Linfield, Rabbi and Head Of Jewish Statistical Bureau, 90
description: Dr. Harry S. Linfield, an ordained rabbi and the executive director of the Jewish Statistical Bureau for more than half a century, died in his sleep last Thursday at the Hebrew Home for the Aged at Riverdale. He was 90 years old and his home was at 99 Hillside Avenue in Manhattan.

title: Home Improvement
description: OWNERS of older houses with doublehung windows that stick, rattle or fall unpredictably, or fit so loosely that they waste energy, can solve all these problems simultaneously by installing replacement window channels that fit most standardsize home window frames.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Yale Publishes Complete Pollock
description: When Jackson Pollock died in 1956, his will asked the impossible: that his widow, the artist Lee Krasner, try to keep the body of works he had left as intact as possible, should they be sold. Such was the demand for Pollocks by that time that in short order they were dispersed. And so Miss Krasner decided to fulfill her husband's request in another way  to record all of his works in the kind of definitive book too rarely published for American artists, a catalogue raisonn.

title: Music: Miss de Larrocha and Guarneri
description: WHEN Alicia de Larrocha sat down to play Schumann's Piano Quintet with the Guarneri String Quartet on Tuesday night at Alice Tully Hall, it was her first performance as a chamber musician in this country. Of course, the Spanish pianist had appeared as a vocal accompanist on a couple of occasions, but to many obsessive followers of chamber music that sort of frivolity does not count.

title: Town Hall Now a Historic Landmark
description: Town Hall, the oncemajor concert hall that suspended operations last Aug. 31, after 58 years, has been designated a historic landmark by the Landmarks Preservation Commission.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29  For most of us the sickness and death at Jonestown, Guyana, pass understanding. The more we read about the cult members' pathetic dependence on their paranoid leader, the less we understand. But there is one reassuringly familiar element in the story: the presence of Mark Lane.

title: Leaders of Democratic Party Reject New Rules for Midterm Conference
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The leadership of the Democratic National Committee voted tentatively today to reject seven changes in the rules for next week's midterm party conference. The changes were proposed by liberals in the hope of getting more debate about issues onto the meeting floor in Memphis.

title: Networks Will Televise Carter's News Session
description: President Carter's news conference in Washington at 4 P.M. today will be telecast live by the three networks and the Public Broadcasting Service.

title: A Bill on Rights Of Hornosexuals Again Rejected
description: The New York City Council yesterday defeated a motion to release a homosexual civilrights bill from the General Welfare Committee for consideration by the 43member body. The vote was 26 to 16.

title: Alleged $50,000 Offer Termed Possible Ray Motive
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)  The House Assassinations Committee said today that an alleged $50,000 offer made by two St. Louis businessmen could have provided the motive for James Earl Ray to assassinate the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 30, 1978

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, Nov. 29.1978

title: ExModel Testifies About Thorpe
description: LONDON, Nov. 29  A former model testified in court today for the first time about the homosexual relationship he said he once had with Jeremy Thorpe, the onetime leader of Britain's Liberal Party.

title: Terms Are Announced for Recall Of 7.5 Million Tires by Firestone
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The Department of Transportation and the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company, after weeks of negotiation, announced the final details today in Firestone's recall of an estimated 7.5 million steelbelted radial tires.

title: EARNINGS
description: Syntex Raises Net 25.3%; Quarterly Sales Up 34.7%The Syntex Corporation, the pharmaceutical company that is diversifying through acquisitions, yesterday reported an increase of 25.3 percent in profits for the first fiscal quarter ended Oct. 31. Sales rose 34.7 percent.

title: $25,000 DayCare Theft Charged
description: Curtis Brooks, a 40yearold former bookkeeper of the cityfinanced East Harlem Triangle Day Care Center, was arrested yesterday on charges of stealing more than $25,000 from the center. Investigation Commissioner Stanley N. Lupkin said that last August the suspect cashed three center checks totaling more than $25,000 without authorization. The Commissioner reported that his staff was investigating $50,000 more in false or unauthorized expenditures from the center.

title: Con Ed Late Charges For Commercial Gas Ruled Illegal by Court
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan ruled illegal yesterday the 1.5 percentamonth late charge Consolidated Edison imposes on the unpaid gas bills of its commercial customers.

title: About Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 28  Up from the singlechair practice, M. David Isaak, D.D.S., has multiplied lucratively, first to an eightchair Denture Center here where you can get an entire set of false teeth in four hours, including extractions. Then eastward to Manhattan with two more such centers and 16 more chairs last year, to be followed by five more centers and three dozen chairs next year in Westchester County and New York City.

title: Mexican Immigrants' Son Enters G.O.P. 1980 Race
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  Benjamin Fernandez, who rose from migrant worker to millionaire management consultant, announced today that he would wage a $15 million campaign for the Republican Presidential nomination in 1980.

title: BARBARA RICHARDS MIGHEL
description: Barbara Richards Michel, a member of the president's council at Columbia University and a board member of the Episcopal Mission Society, died Wednesday at her home. She was 61 years old and lived at 35 East 76th Street.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: Directors of the Texas International Company and NL Industries approved yesterday an agreement in principle for the purchase by NL of the wellcompletion and maintenance business of Texas International, which makes oil and gas drilling and servicing equipment.

title: E.E.C. Warns U.S. on Duties
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI)The European Economic Community served notice on the United States today that a failure by Congress to extend waivers on countervailing duties, imposed to protect American industry from subsidized imports, could lead to the collapse of their trade negotiations.

title: City Council RollCall On Homosexual Issue
description: Following is the rollcall vote of members of the City Council to move the homosexual rights bill out of committee and onto the floor of the full Council.

title: Quake Hits Wide Area in Mexico; Injuries, Several Deaths Reported
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 29  A strong tremor shook south and central Mexico today, killing and injuring several dozen people and damaging many buildings in Mexico City.

title: Christmas Gifts for Homebodies
description: More Gifts, Page C8

title: Carey Weighs Trip to China to Foster State's Trade
description: Governor Carey is trying to arrange a visit to China early next year in an effort to promote trade between that country and New York State, thus taking an advantage of an expected merger between banks in Hong Kong and Buffalo.

title: Figure Skater, 10, Starts On Lonely Road to Goal
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Nov. 29  David Liu's legs dangled at least a foot off the floor as he sat on a stool, his 74 pounds stuffed into a red and blue snowsuit, and pondered his answer.

title: Deaths
description: Abrahams, R

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in some editions of The Times Nov. 21 stated erroneously that Mark Lane, the lawyer, had lost a case in which he defended leaders of the American Indian Movement involved in a takeover at Wounded Knee, S.D. Federal District Judge Fred J. Nichol dismissed the charges against the defendants.

title: Residency Issue Brings Removal Of School Aide
description: School Chancellor Frank J. Macchiarola yesterday suspended Fred Crawford, president of the Central Harlem school board, which has been in disarray because of political conflict, for his failure to prove that he resides in the district.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MILAN, Italy, Nov. 29 (AP)  Vitas Gerulaitis defeated John McEnroe, fellow New Yorker, 46, 76, 63, in the first match of a fourman $100,00C roundrobin tennis tournament tonight. In a match marked by powerful serves, Adriano Panatta of Italy defeated Bjorn Borg of Sweden, 63, 63.

title: Toy Construction Sets Recalled After 2 Children Choke to Death
description: Parker Brothers, the toy and game manufacturer, has begun the voluntary recall of 900,000 Riviton construction sets after two children choked to death on rubber rivets.

title: SOVIET RAISES GOAL ON CONSUMER GOODS
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 29  Following a series of reprimands by Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Government announced plans today for a substantial increase in scarce consumer goods and food supplies in 1979.

title: On Buying an Indoor Fountain (Without Taking a Bath)
description: FOUNTAINS need not he only outdoor luxuries, especially if you don't have an outdoors. They can also be indoor luxuries without cramping your space or budget.

title: H.E.W. CHIEF ORDERS STRICT TOXIN RULES
description: Joseph A. Califano Jr., the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, yesterday ordered the development of new safety standards for workers exposed to the combined hazards of cigarette smoking and industrial toxins.

title: Syracuse 102, N. C. A&T 77
description: SYRACUSE, N.Y., Nov. 29 (AP) Dale Shackleford scored 25 points and flat Cohen added 15 as Syracuse beat North Carolina A&T, 10277. tonight.

title: The City
description: The head of the forensic unit of Creedmoor Psychiatric Center told a hearing in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday that Police Officer Robert H. Torsney, who was acquitted by reason of insanity in the 1976 killing of 15yearold Randolph Evans, should be released from that institution.

title: Islander Rally Ties Kings, 55
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 29 (AP) Mike Kaszycki and Gary Howatt struck for thirdperiod goals as the New York Islanders rallied for a 55 National Hockey League tie with the Los Angeles Kings tonight. The tie stretched the Islanders unbeaten string to 11 games.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: India Ruling Party Wins in Bihar
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 29 (AP)  The governing Janata Party won a special election today in the eastcentral state of Bihar, the United News of India reported. The opposition party headed by former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi had placed emphasis on the election, hoping to show that it had support outside the southern district where Mrs. Gandhi was recently elected to Parliament.

title: Cooper Increases Sterndent Holding
description: Cooper Laboratories has notified the Securities and Exchange Commission that it has increased its holdings in the Stemdent Corporation to 600,000 common shares, or 29.4 percent of the outstanding shares of Stemdent. On Nov. 14, Cooper had said that it held 450,000 shares, or 22 percent, of Sterndent's outstanding stock.

title: Remembering Their City Roots
description: Blossoms sprout from roots but sometimes the roots are embedded in asphalt. Whitey Ford, Bob Cousy and Sid Luckman were the flowers of their sports  a lefthanded pitcher for the New York Yankees with a record 10 World Series victories; a magical playmaker on six Boston Celtics championship teams; a quarterback for the Chicago Bears when they were trampling pro football. Each is in his sport's Hall of Fame but tonight each will be inducted into another. In conjunction with the 75th anniversary of the Public Schools Ath letic League, they will be honored at Antun's restaurant in Queens Village along with 42 other onetime competitors in city high school sports. The inductees include Sandy Koufax, Hank Greenberg, Waite Hoyt and Lou Gehrip, in baseball: Red Auerbach, Nat Holman and Dolph Schayes in basketball; Gertrude Ederle in swimming; Vince Matthews, Bob Beaman, Marty Glickman, Les MacMitchell, Reggie Pearman and Cheryl Toussiant in track, and Mark Roth in howling. The main speaker will be Gene Rossides, an attorney who was once an Erasmus Hall quarterback and an assistant secretary of the United States Treasury. Whitey Ford, Bob Cousy and Sid Luckman never were inspired to that scholastic level.

title: Cabaret: Don Scardino
description: A SERIES of programs called Broadway Moonlighters, featuring performers in Broadway musicals in postcurtain cabaret performances, started at Reno Sweeney on Tuesday evening with Don Scardino of King of Hearts; he will appear at 11:30 nightly through Saturday. The series will continue for the next two weeks with Marta Sanders of The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas on Dec. 3 at 9 and 11 P.M:, Jessica James of GemiM. from Dec: 5 through 9 at 11:30 P.M.. Ken Page of Ain't Misbehavin  on Dec. 10 at 9 and 11 P.M. and Judy Kaye of On the Twentieth Century from Dec. 12 through 16 at 11:30 P.M.

title: Eye Study on Marijuana Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The National Eye Institution announced today that it was soliciting research proposals from scientists to learn whether marijuana had a valid medical use as a treatment for glaucoma, an eye disease afflicting a million Americans.

title: Queens Woman a Hit Victim, Police Believe
description: Queens homicide detectives said yesterday that they now suspected that a Iranian woman who was shot to death last Sept. 27 in her Queens home was the Victim of a $10,000 contract hit.

title: Stolen Property
description: When the New York City police recover stolen property and the owner cannot be located within 90 days, the goods are sold. Last year, the sales, and unclaimed cash, totaled $1,340,000. In many places, such funds go to crime victims or to the needy.

title: TV: Fame Comedy by Arthur Miller, on NBC
description: ARTHUR MILLER's Fame, a Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation on NBC tonight at 10, was at one point being written as a stage play. Then Mr. Miller realized that the material probably would add up only to a brief film. The demand for brief films these days being negligi e, the play has ended up on television, where it still adds up to a rather insubstantial hour. The medium alone cannot fatten anemic messages.

title: Venice Flooded for Third Day
description: ROME, Nov. 29 (AP)  Winter storms and high tides today forced residents of Venice to wade through St.. Mark's Square for the third day. Strong winds pushed water into many tourist sections of the city.

title: Geneva Talks Are Extended
description: GENEVA, Nov. 29  Underdeveloped andindustrialized nations are making strenuous efforts tonight to salvage some results from their attempt to establish a new international fund to stabilize the earnings that the emerging countries realize from their exports of raw materials.

title: Top Pop Records
description: These are the moat popular albums andsingles nationwide, compiled by Record World. a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from major retail outlets; singles are chosen by combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially last selling record.

title: Dr. Frank Walsh, Noted For Ophthalmic Work
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 29 Dr. Frank B. Walsh, a professor emeritus of Johns Hopkins Medical School, died of cancer Monday at Johns Hopkins Hospital.

title: The Faraway Look In Interior Design
description: WASHINGTON IT isn't exactly the world of Billy Baldwin, Sister Parrish, Park Avenue and the Hamptons. Instead, it is a world in which the wallpaper may be glued on upside down by workmen who have never teen the stuff before, a world of flying Peruvian termites, of 35pound sample cases lost in Lagos, of furniture movers who must be communicated with in sign language, and a world in which an interior designer may be strarlied alone at midnight in a strtinge city, eating the Vienna sausage, cheese and crackers that she was wise enough to bring along.

title: Arraignment Delayed in Slaying of Mayor Moscone
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 29 (AP)  Dan White, the former County Supervisor who is charged with murdering San Francisco's Mayor and another official, made a brief appearance in a heavily guarded courtroom today, but his arraignment was postponed to give him time to hire a lawyer.

title: CULT KILLINGS YIELD CRITICISMS ABROAD
description: LONDON, Nov. 29  Much of the world's press sees the mass killings of the Rev. Jim Jones's followers in Guyana as a symptom of failures of American cul. tune and of special lunacies of life in California.

title: The Population Bomb, Reconsidered
description: The neoMalthusians have for some time dominated discussions of world population. In their gloom, some even calculated a date by which the planet would have so many people that there would be no room for anybody to lie down. A more moderate but still chilling view was put forward a few years ago by Paul Ehrlich in his widely read book, The Population Bomb. He wrote: The battle to feed all of humanity is over. In the 1970's the world will undergo famine  hundreds millions of people are going to starve to death....At this late date nothing can prevent a substantial increase in the world death rate...

title: Sound
description: WHEN my sound system goes on the blink, I don't feel so good myself. I suppose I am so intimately ??inked with my favorite toy that when something goes wrong with it, something goes wrong with me. Besides, music is habitforming, and without my daily minimum dose I get acute withdrawal symptoms. Distress calls from friends with ailing sound systems tell me that others feel the same way.

title: U.S. Plans to Conduct Autopsies On Cult Leader and Six Followers
description: DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del., Nov. 29  Federal officials, reversing an earlier decision, plan to perform autopsies on the Rev. Jim Jones, two of his close aides and four randomly selected bodies from the mass deaths in Guyana, a Justice Department official said tonight.

title: Labor Official Is Shot in Sicily
description: PALERMO, Sicily, Nov. 29 (UPI) Two young men shot and critically wounded an official of a labor office in an ambush today and stole his car to escape, police officials said. They said that Arcangelo Alaimo, 40 years old, a department head in the provincial labor office, had been wounded in the head and legs and was in very serious condition:

title: New York Planning Panel Criticized for Aid Triage
description: The New York City Planning Commission came under attack yesterday for its announced plan to select only one neighborhood in each borough to receive augmented Federal financing for physical improvements next year under the Community Development Program.

title: Carmine Santo, 64, an Executive Of Brick and Clay Workers Union
description: Carmine Santo, international executive vice president of the United Brick and Clay Workers Union, died Tuesday in Warren Hospital, Phillipsburg, N.J., after a long illness. He was 64 years old and lived in Belvidere. N.J.

title: The Firestone Merger
description: Wall Street took a look at the proposed merger of the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company and the BorgWarner Corporation and decided yesterday that the chances of it ever happening were  iust about 5050.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Prices of precious metals futures closed slightly lower yesterday after heady gains earner in the session melted away under both technical and fundamental pressures.

title: C.A.B. to Hold Hearings on SmallCity Air Service
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  The Civil Aeronautics Board said today that it would hold nine regional public hearings early next year on how to initiate Federal program to preserve airline service for small cities.

title: Amid Controversy, the U.N. Marks Day of Solidarity With Palestinians
description: UNITED NATIONS. N.Y.. Nov. 29 Boycotted by the United States and attacked by Israel, the first Day of Solidarity With the Palestinian People was observed at the United Nations today after its gates were locked to visitors as a security precaution.

title: Books of The Times
description: IDECLINE to think of an esthetic principle to guide us toward a selection of books to give for Christmas, and I've finally decided that, given the spirit of the season, not to speak of the mounting competition of electronic television games, sheer excess is the key, the more of it the better. But let us build by degrees...

title: Owner Voices Concern Over Fate of London Times
description: TORONTO, Nov. 29  Kenneth R. Thomson. the second Lord Thomson of Fleet, leaned forward in his penthouse office here and said, It is absolutely incorrect to say that I have less affection for our paers in London.

title: France to Raise Wages
description: PARIS, Nov. 29 (AP)  The French minimum wage will be increased on Friday by 2.13 percent, to 11.31 francs ($2.56) an hour, from the current 11.07 francs ($2.51), the Government announced today

title: UNESCO Affirms Stand on Israel
description: PARIS. Nov. 29 (AP)  The 20th general conference of UNESCO brushed aside United States objections yesterday and approved an Arabsponsored resolution to continue economic sanctions against Israel because of archeological excavations said to encroach on Islamic sites in Jerusalem.

title: Notes on People
description: It is rare indeed that Marlon Brando gives an interview, but when he does, the verbal sparks fly. Such is the case in an interview in the January issue of Playboy, in which the outspoken actor said he had no use for actors, as we are businessmen, we're merchants, and added: I've never met a movie star yet who made me fall to my knees in awe and wonder. He characterized Bob Hope as being pathetic and Sammy Davis Jr. as an applause junkie, and said that John Wayne would have shot Gandhi, called him a rabblerouser.

title: Uncle Subsidiary
description: My favorite analogy for summarizing the implications of the ongoing surge of, foreign investment in the United States is the early use of DDT. That toxic chemical was wonderful for killing mosquitoes and other pesky creatures. The problem was that those spreading it across the countryside created a threat to the ecology before the public realized what they were doing.

title: Times of London Is Set To Suspend Operations
description: LONDON, Nov. 29 (Reuters)  Journalists at The Times of London put together what seemed certain to be its final edition tonight before suspending publication tomorrow because of a bitter labor dispute. Lastminute efforts to resolve the dispute appeared to have failed.

title: Around the Nation
description: GOLDEN, Colo., Nov. 29  Ten antinuclear protesters, including Daniel Ellsberg, who released the Pentagon Papers to the press, were convicted here today on trespassing charges by an obviously sympathetic jury.

title: Fire Routs 125 in Hotel
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 29 (AP)  Fires in three Vending machines damaged a wing of the Edgewater Hotel today, forcing, the brief evacuation of 125 hotel guests, including seven governors of Philippine provinces. The governors were staying in a separate wing of the lakefront hotel and were allowed to return to their rooms after a halfhour, said Jan Byers, the front desk manager.

title: Seton Hall 109, Merrimack 68
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Nov. 29 Nick Galis had 28 points and three other players were in double figures as Seton Hall University defeated Merrimack College, 10968, tonight. It was the Pirates' second straight victory.

title: For Furniture, the Warmth of a Fine Patina
description: TO most collectors and dealers. patina is one quality that a piece of furniture must possess for it to be truly desirable. Patina is the undisturbed finish of wood that has been cared for and polished over a long period of time.

title: Roy Boe Is Down But Not Out
description: They still make a fuss over Roy Boe at the Yale Club, so how bad could things be?

title: 131 Marine Recruits Stricken
description: PARRIS ISLAND, S.C., Nov. 29 (AP)  A total of 131 male and female recruits at the Parris Island Marine Recruit Depot have been stricken with an apparent reaction to typhoid vaccine. None of the recruits were seriously ill, Comdr. William Blankenship of the Naval Hospital in Beaufort said today. lie said that 30 had been hospitalized overnight.

title: World News Briefs
description: MANAGUA. Nicaragua. Nov. 29 (UPI)  Nicaragua's broad opposition front agreed, conditionally today to accept a proposal by international mediators for a plebiscite on whether President Anastasio Somoza Debayle should stay in office.

title: Dow Plunges 14 Points On TradeDeficit News
description: The impact of October's biggerthanexpected trade deficit sent shock waves through the stock market yesterday and touched off a 14point drop in the Dow Jones industrial average.

title: Carter Ties Oil To Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI) President Carter said today that efforts to control inflation and strengthen the dollar would have a major effect on whether the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries raised oil prices.

title: Sadat Aide Flying to Give Carter New Cairo Position on Peace Talks
description: CAIRO, Nov. 29  Prime Minister Mustafa Khalil left today on a mission to Washington, where he is to inform President Carter of Egypt's latest proposals to revive peace talks with Israel.

title: Talking Business
description: TOKYO The hottest market for Japanese steel is no longer the United States, but China. In the six months ended last September, Japanese steel exports to China rose to 2.8 million ??ons, just below the 2.9 million tons sold to the United States, and they are still climbing. In Japan, the leading name both steel and the China trade is Yoshihiro Inavama.

title: Williams Backs Fed In Dispute
description: BOCA RATON, Fla. Nov. 29  The chairman of the Senate securities sub. committee is planning to support strongly the Federal Reserve Board's stand regarding margin requirements for the proposed futures contracts based on a stock market index and planned by the Kansas City Board of Trade.

title: CARACAS CAMPAIGN NEARS FRENZIED END
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 29 Venezuela's presidential campaign is building to a frenzied finale as candidates try to attract voters through street rallies and costly political advertising.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: Senator Edward Kennedy's recent denunciation of the LykesLTV steel merger, despite its approval by the Justice Department, is apt to be passed off as grandstanding. But the Senator was voicing the dissatisfaction of able professionals in Government who think antitrust policy has been used too little to check corporate power. They believe, in fact, that antitrust policy should be used to cut big business down to size. Now that Mr. Kennedy will inherit the chair of the Senate Judiciary Committee, we can expect more action from these hawks.

title: Handling the Guyana Bodies Has Delaware City on Edge
description: DOVER, Del., Nov. 29  This is a little town in a little state, a place where the parttime Mayor proudly raises the American flag each morning there is no rain. In the center of town is the capitol, old and red brick, where they make the laws of a land merely 96 miles long and 35 miles wide at its widest. To the south of town is its largest industry, Doyer Air Force Base, 3,600 acres on which 6,500 people work for an annual payroll of about $70 million.

title: LACK of AUTHORITY CITED IN AIR CRASH
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 29  The last traffic controller in contact with a jet airliner involved in a midair collision in which 144 people died testified today that if the crew had asked for a lastminute change of heading he would not have been authorized to approve it.

title: Knicks Lise to facers, 10199
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 29The New York Knicks ran out of time and into a hot 7footer tonight as they lost by 10199 to the Indiana Pacers before 8,239 fans in the Market Square Arena.

title: Corporate Earnings Reported
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange,(A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: 3 Guards Are Indicted As Prison Conspirators
description: Three officers of the New York City Department of Correction were indicted yesterday on charges of official misconduct and related offenses following an investigation that used an undercover man in the Queens House of Detention.

title: Radio
description: 7:30.9, WNYCFM. Minuet from Bernice, Handel; English Suite No. 4, Bach; Menuet Antique, Ravel; Violin Transcription, Kreisler; Capriccio Brillante for Piano and Orchestra, Mendelssohn; Zorahayda, Legend, Svendsen.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The nation's trade deficit expanded to $2.13 billion in October, the Commerce Department said. The October increase reflected sharp declines in exports of food, chemicals and gold. It brought the imbalance for the first 10 months Of 1978 to $24.8 billion, up sharply from $21.2 billion in the comparable period of last year. [Page A1.]

title: Deaths
description: DELIGDISCHCerhnard Nomember 28 1978, beloved father, grand father, great grandfather. Bunal Friday

title: Youth Freed in Shooting
description: Charges were dismissed yesterday in Bronx Criminal Court against a 15yearold youth who had been charged with, shooting one of three men subsequently indicted for robbing him.

title: City Weighs Retaining Shea Firm
description: New York City officials are reviewing the retention of the Shea, Gould law firm as counsel for the $2.8 billion fund of the New York City's Teachers Retirement System following the report that the firm's senior partner, William A. Shea, did not disclose his knowledge of a theft of funds by Peter P. Smith 3d from the firm during a routine background check by the Department of Investigation.

title: Rangers, Murdoch to Continue Negotations
description: The New York Rangers, who have made four offers, all rejected, in renegotiating Don Murdoch's contract, will meet with Murdoch's lawyer in Toronto on Saturday.

title: Black Hawks 1, Canucks 1
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 29 (AP)  Ivan Boldirev's 11th goal of the season on a twoman advantage late in the second period lifted Chicago into a 11 tie with the Vancouver Canucks tonight as the Black Hawks clung to their firstplace lead in the Smythe Division.

title: L.I.U. 83, Southampton 68
description: John Nelson Bailey and Steve Lewis combined for 46 points to lead Long Island University to an 8368 victory over Southampton College at the winner's gym last night.

title: Strayhorn Music Done By Kerr
description: BROOKS KERR, the pianist and singer whose detailed knowledge of the music of Duke Ellington led Mr. Ellington to refer to him as the encyclopedia of our music, turned his attention to subsidiary element of the Ellington band's repertory on Tuesday evening  the music of Billy Strayhorn, the Duke's close colleague as composer and arranger from 1939 until his death in 1967.

title: Teng Says Party Meeting Won't Purge Any Top Leaders
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 29  Teng Hsiaoping, China's Deputy Prime Minister, when asked today whether a major Communist Party meeting now under way in Peking would lead to a purge of any ranking leaders, said no.

title: U.S. Moving Toward Vast Revision Of Its Strategy on Nuclear Warfare
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  Quietly, and with little public debate, the Carter Administration is taking tentative steps to a drastic revision of the American policy of relying upon largescale retaliation for deterring a nuclear war with the Soviet Union.

title: Q&A
description: Q. We have an older house with natural oak trim. Since it had scratches and some of it had a darker finish that the rest, we decided to steelwool all of the trim and apply a stain to cover all the scratches. However, we want to know what we should put over this  varnish? polyurethane?  Mrs. F.R., Staten Island, N.Y.

title: O'Hagan Wins NoTax Pension In Court Ruling
description: Justice Burton B. Roberts yesterday reversed the decision of the trustees of the New York City Fire Department Pension Fund and awarded former Fire Commissioner John T. O'Hagan the full $42,500ayear taxfree pension he sought when he retired last January.

title: Business as Usual in Moscow
description: MOSCOW. Nov. 29  Whatever anger the Soviet Union may feel about Rumania's unwillingness to go along with higher military spending within the Warsaw Pact, not a word has been said here about the dispute in public.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAHAMSRebecca C on November 27 Beloved wife of the late Samuel K., devoted mother of Richard K and Norbert S Dear sister of Sade Hauserman. Anne Hirsch, Frank Greenberg and the late Herman Greenberg and Fan Greenberg Service and interment private.

title: Countercharges by Lincoln Drug Unit
description: City hospital officials closed the drug detoxification unit at Lincoln Hospital in the South Bronx yesterday morning as the leaders of the highly controversial drugtreatment program contended that they had been made scapegoats to cover up other medical and administrative failures at the municipal hospital.

title: Rosalynn Carter is a product of a strong strain in American culture
description: PEOPLE seem to be puzzled by Rosalynn Carter. I grant that. if you follow her activities in press and media, there seem to be two Rosalynns. In the past few days we have read and heard of the First Lady much in the mold of her predecessors. She is going on a crosscountry tour to highlight volunteer efforts in urban areas; she has written an article in a current woman's publication saying, among other things, that without volunteers, we'd be a nation without a soul. She has been a gracious White House hostess to the King of Morocco. She has been on television, poised and pretty, faultlessly fending off loaded questions about the religious cults.

title: Hitachi Weighs Its Own U.S. Plant
description: TOKYO, Nov. 29 (AP)  Executives of Hitachi Ltd. said today that there was a possibility that the company would set up a television production plant in the United States by itself if it was prevented from establishing a joint venture with the General Electric Company.
